2326 
2327 namespace detail {
2328 
2329 #if defined(_WIN64)
2330 inline std::wstring u8string_to_wstring(const char *s) {
2331  std::wstring ws;
2332  auto len = static_cast<int>(strlen(s));
2333  auto wlen = ::MultiByteToWideChar(CP_UTF8, 0, s, len, nullptr, 0);
2334  if (wlen > 0) {
2335  ws.resize(wlen);
2336  wlen = ::MultiByteToWideChar(
2337  CP_UTF8, 0, s, len,
2338  const_cast<LPWSTR>(reinterpret_cast<LPCWSTR>(ws.data())), wlen);
2339  if (wlen != static_cast<int>(ws.size())) { ws.clear(); }
2340  }
2341  return ws;
2342 }
2343 #endif
2344

2346  FileStat(const std::string &path);
2347  bool is_file() const;
2348  bool is_dir() const;
2349 
2350 private:
2351 #if defined(_WIN64)
2352  struct _stat st_;
2353 #else
2354  struct stat st_;
2355 #endif
2356  int ret_ = -1;
2357 };

2421 class BufferStream final : public Stream {
2422 public:
2423  BufferStream() = default;
2424  ~BufferStream() override = default;
2425 
2426  bool is_readable() const override;
2427  bool wait_readable() const override;
2428  bool wait_writable() const override;
2429  ssize_t read(char *ptr, size_t size) override;
2430  ssize_t write(const char *ptr, size_t size) override;
2431  void get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
2432  void get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
2433  socket_t socket() const override;
2434  time_t duration() const override;
2435 
2436  const std::string &get_buffer() const;
2437

2441 };
2442 
2443 class compressor {
2444 public:
2445  virtual ~compressor() = default;
2446 
2447  typedef std::function<bool(const char *data, size_t data_len)> Callback;
2448  virtual bool compress(const char *data, size_t data_length, bool last,
2449  Callback callback) = 0;
2450 };
2451 
2452 class decompressor {
2453 public:
2454  virtual ~decompressor() = default;
2455 
2456  virtual bool is_valid() const = 0;
2457 
2458  typedef std::function<bool(const char *data, size_t data_len)> Callback;
2459  virtual bool decompress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
2460  Callback callback) = 0;
2461 };
2462 
2463 class nocompressor final : public compressor {
2464 public:
2465  ~nocompressor() override = default;
2466 
2467  bool compress(const char *data, size_t data_length, bool /*last*/,
2468  Callback callback) override;
2469 };
2470

2483 };

2602 
2603 // NOTE: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110#section-5
2604 namespace fields {
2605 
2606 inline bool is_token_char(char c) {
2607  return std::isalnum(c) || c == '!' || c == '#' || c == '$' || c == '%' ||
2608  c == '&' || c == '\'' || c == '*' || c == '+' || c == '-' ||
2609  c == '.' || c == '^' || c == '_' || c == '`' || c == '|' || c == '~';
2610 }
2611 
2612 inline bool is_token(const std::string &s) {
2613  if (s.empty()) { return false; }
2614  for (auto c : s) {
2615  if (!is_token_char(c)) { return false; }
2616  }
2617  return true;
2618 }
2619 
2620 inline bool is_field_name(const std::string &s) { return is_token(s); }
2621 
2622 inline bool is_vchar(char c) { return c >= 33 && c <= 126; }
2623 
2624 inline bool is_obs_text(char c) { return 128 <= static_cast<unsigned char>(c); }
2625 
2626 inline bool is_field_vchar(char c) { return is_vchar(c) || is_obs_text(c); }
2627 
2628 inline bool is_field_content(const std::string &s) {
2629  if (s.empty()) { return true; }
2630 
2631  if (s.size() == 1) {
2632  return is_field_vchar(s[0]);
2633  } else if (s.size() == 2) {
2634  return is_field_vchar(s[0]) && is_field_vchar(s[1]);
2635  } else {
2636  size_t i = 0;
2637 
2638  if (!is_field_vchar(s[i])) { return false; }
2639  i++;
2640 
2641  while (i < s.size() - 1) {
2642  auto c = s[i++];
2643  if (c == ' ' || c == '\t' || is_field_vchar(c)) {
2644  } else {
2645  return false;
2646  }
2647  }
2648 
2649  return is_field_vchar(s[i]);
2650  }
2651 }
2652 
2653 inline bool is_field_value(const std::string &s) { return is_field_content(s); }
2654 
2655 } // namespace fields
2656 
2657 } // namespace detail
2658 
2659 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
2660 
2661 /*
2662  * Implementation that will be part of the .cc file if split into .h + .cc.
2663  */
2664 
2665 namespace detail {
2666 
2667 inline bool is_hex(char c, int &v) {
2668  if (0x20 <= c && isdigit(c)) {
2669  v = c - '0';
2670  return true;
2671  } else if ('A' <= c && c <= 'F') {
2672  v = c - 'A' + 10;
2673  return true;
2674  } else if ('a' <= c && c <= 'f') {
2675  v = c - 'a' + 10;
2676  return true;
2677  }
2678  return false;
2679 }
2680 
2681 inline bool from_hex_to_i(const std::string &s, size_t i, size_t cnt,
2682  int &val) {
2683  if (i >= s.size()) { return false; }
2684 
2685  val = 0;
2686  for (; cnt; i++, cnt--) {
2687  if (!s[i]) { return false; }
2688  auto v = 0;
2689  if (is_hex(s[i], v)) {
2690  val = val * 16 + v;
2691  } else {
2692  return false;
2693  }
2694  }
2695  return true;
2696 }
2697 
2698 inline std::string from_i_to_hex(size_t n) {
2699  static const auto charset = "0123456789abcdef";
2700  std::string ret;
2701  do {
2702  ret = charset[n & 15] + ret;
2703  n >>= 4;
2704  } while (n > 0);
2705  return ret;
2706 }
2707 
2708 inline size_t to_utf8(int code, char *buff) {
2709  if (code < 0x0080) {
2710  buff[0] = static_cast<char>(code & 0x7F);
2711  return 1;
2712  } else if (code < 0x0800) {
2713  buff[0] = static_cast<char>(0xC0 | ((code >> 6) & 0x1F));
2714  buff[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (code & 0x3F));
2715  return 2;
2716  } else if (code < 0xD800) {
2717  buff[0] = static_cast<char>(0xE0 | ((code >> 12) & 0xF));
2718  buff[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3F));
2719  buff[2] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (code & 0x3F));
2720  return 3;
2721  } else if (code < 0xE000) { // D800 - DFFF is invalid...
2722  return 0;
2723  } else if (code < 0x10000) {
2724  buff[0] = static_cast<char>(0xE0 | ((code >> 12) & 0xF));
2725  buff[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3F));
2726  buff[2] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (code & 0x3F));
2727  return 3;
2728  } else if (code < 0x110000) {
2729  buff[0] = static_cast<char>(0xF0 | ((code >> 18) & 0x7));
2730  buff[1] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | ((code >> 12) & 0x3F));
2731  buff[2] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | ((code >> 6) & 0x3F));
2732  buff[3] = static_cast<char>(0x80 | (code & 0x3F));
2733  return 4;
2734  }
2735 
2736  // NOTREACHED
2737  return 0;
2738 }
2739 
2740 // NOTE: This code came up with the following stackoverflow post:
2741 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/180947/base64-decode-snippet-in-c
2742 inline std::string base64_encode(const std::string &in) {
2743  static const auto lookup =
2744  "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
2745 
2746  std::string out;
2747  out.reserve(in.size());
2748 
2749  auto val = 0;
2750  auto valb = -6;
2751 
2752  for (auto c : in) {
2753  val = (val << 8) + static_cast<uint8_t>(c);
2754  valb += 8;
2755  while (valb >= 0) {
2756  out.push_back(lookup[(val >> valb) & 0x3F]);
2757  valb -= 6;
2758  }
2759  }
2760 
2761  if (valb > -6) { out.push_back(lookup[((val << 8) >> (valb + 8)) & 0x3F]); }
2762 
2763  while (out.size() % 4) {
2764  out.push_back('=');
2765  }
2766 
2767  return out;
2768 }
2769 
2770 inline bool is_valid_path(const std::string &path) {
2771  size_t level = 0;
2772  size_t i = 0;
2773 
2774  // Skip slash
2775  while (i < path.size() && path[i] == '/') {
2776  i++;
2777  }
2778 
2779  while (i < path.size()) {
2780  // Read component
2781  auto beg = i;
2782  while (i < path.size() && path[i] != '/') {
2783  if (path[i] == '\0') {
2784  return false;
2785  } else if (path[i] == '\\') {
2786  return false;
2787  }
2788  i++;
2789  }
2790 
2791  auto len = i - beg;
2792  assert(len > 0);
2793 
2794  if (!path.compare(beg, len, ".")) {
2795  ;
2796  } else if (!path.compare(beg, len, "..")) {
2797  if (level == 0) { return false; }
2798  level--;
2799  } else {
2800  level++;
2801  }
2802 
2803  // Skip slash
2804  while (i < path.size() && path[i] == '/') {
2805  i++;
2806  }
2807  }
2808 
2809  return true;
2810 }
2811 
2812 inline FileStat::FileStat(const std::string &path) {
2813 #if defined(_WIN64)
2814  auto wpath = u8string_to_wstring(path.c_str());
2815  ret_ = _wstat(wpath.c_str(), &st_);
2816 #else
2817  ret_ = stat(path.c_str(), &st_);
2818 #endif
2819 }
2820 inline bool FileStat::is_file() const {
2821  return ret_ >= 0 && S_ISREG(st_.st_mode);
2822 }
2823 inline bool FileStat::is_dir() const {
2824  return ret_ >= 0 && S_ISDIR(st_.st_mode);
2825 }
2826 
2827 inline std::string encode_path(const std::string &s) {
2828  std::string result;
2829  result.reserve(s.size());
2830 
2831  for (size_t i = 0; s[i]; i++) {
2832  switch (s[i]) {
2833  case ' ': result += "%20"; break;
2834  case '+': result += "%2B"; break;
2835  case '\r': result += "%0D"; break;
2836  case '\n': result += "%0A"; break;
2837  case '\'': result += "%27"; break;
2838  case ',': result += "%2C"; break;
2839  // case ':': result += "%3A"; break; // ok? probably...
2840  case ';': result += "%3B"; break;
2841  default:
2842  auto c = static_cast<uint8_t>(s[i]);
2843  if (c >= 0x80) {
2844  result += '%';
2845  char hex[4];
2846  auto len = snprintf(hex, sizeof(hex) - 1, "%02X", c);
2847  assert(len == 2);
2848  result.append(hex, static_cast<size_t>(len));
2849  } else {
2850  result += s[i];
2851  }
2852  break;
2853  }
2854  }
2855 
2856  return result;
2857 }
2858 
2859 inline std::string file_extension(const std::string &path) {
2860  std::smatch m;
2861  thread_local auto re = std::regex("\\.([a-zA-Z0-9]+)$");
2862  if (std::regex_search(path, m, re)) { return m[1].str(); }
2863  return std::string();
2864 }
2865 
2866 inline bool is_space_or_tab(char c) { return c == ' ' || c == '\t'; }
2867 
2868 inline std::pair<size_t, size_t> trim(const char *b, const char *e, size_t left,
2869  size_t right) {
2870  while (b + left < e && is_space_or_tab(b[left])) {
2871  left++;
2872  }
2873  while (right > 0 && is_space_or_tab(b[right - 1])) {
2874  right--;
2875  }
2876  return std::make_pair(left, right);
2877 }
2878 
2879 inline std::string trim_copy(const std::string &s) {
2880  auto r = trim(s.data(), s.data() + s.size(), 0, s.size());
2881  return s.substr(r.first, r.second - r.first);
2882 }
2883 
2884 inline std::string trim_double_quotes_copy(const std::string &s) {
2885  if (s.length() >= 2 && s.front() == '"' && s.back() == '"') {
2886  return s.substr(1, s.size() - 2);
2887  }
2888  return s;
2889 }
2890 
2891 inline void
2892 divide(const char *data, std::size_t size, char d,
2893  std::function<void(const char *, std::size_t, const char *, std::size_t)>
2894  fn) {
2895  const auto it = std::find(data, data + size, d);
2896  const auto found = static_cast<std::size_t>(it != data + size);
2897  const auto lhs_data = data;
2898  const auto lhs_size = static_cast<std::size_t>(it - data);
2899  const auto rhs_data = it + found;
2900  const auto rhs_size = size - lhs_size - found;
2901 
2902  fn(lhs_data, lhs_size, rhs_data, rhs_size);
2903 }
2904 
2905 inline void
2906 divide(const std::string &str, char d,
2907  std::function<void(const char *, std::size_t, const char *, std::size_t)>
2908  fn) {
2909  divide(str.data(), str.size(), d, std::move(fn));
2910 }
2911 
2912 inline void split(const char *b, const char *e, char d,
2913  std::function<void(const char *, const char *)> fn) {
2914  return split(b, e, d, (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max)(), std::move(fn));
2915 }
2916 
2917 inline void split(const char *b, const char *e, char d, size_t m,
2918  std::function<void(const char *, const char *)> fn) {
2919  size_t i = 0;
2920  size_t beg = 0;
2921  size_t count = 1;
2922 
2923  while (e ? (b + i < e) : (b[i] != '\0')) {
2924  if (b[i] == d && count < m) {
2925  auto r = trim(b, e, beg, i);
2926  if (r.first < r.second) { fn(&b[r.first], &b[r.second]); }
2927  beg = i + 1;
2928  count++;
2929  }
2930  i++;
2931  }
2932 
2933  if (i) {
2934  auto r = trim(b, e, beg, i);
2935  if (r.first < r.second) { fn(&b[r.first], &b[r.second]); }
2936  }
2937 }
2938 
2939 inline stream_line_reader::stream_line_reader(Stream &strm, char *fixed_buffer,
2940  size_t fixed_buffer_size)
2941  : strm_(strm), fixed_buffer_(fixed_buffer),
2942  fixed_buffer_size_(fixed_buffer_size) {}
2943 
2944 inline const char *stream_line_reader::ptr() const {
2945  if (growable_buffer_.empty()) {
2946  return fixed_buffer_;
2947  } else {
2948  return growable_buffer_.data();
2949  }
2950 }
2951 
2952 inline size_t stream_line_reader::size() const {
2953  if (growable_buffer_.empty()) {
2954  return fixed_buffer_used_size_;
2955  } else {
2956  return growable_buffer_.size();
2957  }
2958 }
2959 
2960 inline bool stream_line_reader::end_with_crlf() const {
2961  auto end = ptr() + size();
2962  return size() >= 2 && end[-2] == '\r' && end[-1] == '\n';
2963 }
2964 
2965 inline bool stream_line_reader::getline() {
2966  fixed_buffer_used_size_ = 0;
2967  growable_buffer_.clear();
2968 
2969 #ifndef CPPHTTPLIB_ALLOW_LF_AS_LINE_TERMINATOR
2970  char prev_byte = 0;
2971 #endif
2972 
2973  for (size_t i = 0;; i++) {
2974  if (size() >= CPPHTTPLIB_MAX_LINE_LENGTH) {
2975  // Treat exceptionally long lines as an error to
2976  // prevent infinite loops/memory exhaustion
2977  return false;
2978  }
2979  char byte;
2980  auto n = strm_.read(&byte, 1);
2981 
2982  if (n < 0) {
2983  return false;
2984  } else if (n == 0) {
2985  if (i == 0) {
2986  return false;
2987  } else {
2988  break;
2989  }
2990  }
2991 
2992  append(byte);
2993 
2994 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ALLOW_LF_AS_LINE_TERMINATOR
2995  if (byte == '\n') { break; }
2996 #else
2997  if (prev_byte == '\r' && byte == '\n') { break; }
2998  prev_byte = byte;
2999 #endif
3000  }
3001 
3002  return true;
3003 }
3004 
3005 inline void stream_line_reader::append(char c) {
3006  if (fixed_buffer_used_size_ < fixed_buffer_size_ - 1) {
3007  fixed_buffer_[fixed_buffer_used_size_++] = c;
3008  fixed_buffer_[fixed_buffer_used_size_] = '\0';
3009  } else {
3010  if (growable_buffer_.empty()) {
3011  assert(fixed_buffer_[fixed_buffer_used_size_] == '\0');
3012  growable_buffer_.assign(fixed_buffer_, fixed_buffer_used_size_);
3013  }
3014  growable_buffer_ += c;
3015  }
3016 }
3017 
3018 inline mmap::mmap(const char *path) { open(path); }
3019 
3020 inline mmap::~mmap() { close(); }
3021 
3022 inline bool mmap::open(const char *path) {
3023  close();
3024 
3025 #if defined(_WIN64)
3026  auto wpath = u8string_to_wstring(path);
3027  if (wpath.empty()) { return false; }
3028 
3029  hFile_ = ::CreateFile2(wpath.c_str(), GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ,
3030  OPEN_EXISTING, NULL);
3031 
3032  if (hFile_ == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) { return false; }
3033 
3034  LARGE_INTEGER size{};
3035  if (!::GetFileSizeEx(hFile_, &size)) { return false; }
3036  // If the following line doesn't compile due to QuadPart, update Windows SDK.
3037  // See:
3038  // https://github.com/yhirose/cpp-httplib/issues/1903#issuecomment-2316520721
3039  if (static_cast<ULONGLONG>(size.QuadPart) >
3040  (std::numeric_limits<decltype(size_)>::max)()) {
3041  // `size_t` might be 32-bits, on 32-bits Windows.
3042  return false;
3043  }
3044  size_ = static_cast<size_t>(size.QuadPart);
3045 
3046  hMapping_ =
3047  ::CreateFileMappingFromApp(hFile_, NULL, PAGE_READONLY, size_, NULL);
3048 
3049  // Special treatment for an empty file...
3050  if (hMapping_ == NULL && size_ == 0) {
3051  close();
3052  is_open_empty_file = true;
3053  return true;
3054  }
3055 
3056  if (hMapping_ == NULL) {
3057  close();
3058  return false;
3059  }
3060 
3061  addr_ = ::MapViewOfFileFromApp(hMapping_, FILE_MAP_READ, 0, 0);
3062 
3063  if (addr_ == nullptr) {
3064  close();
3065  return false;
3066  }
3067 #else
3068  fd_ = ::open(path, O_RDONLY);
3069  if (fd_ == -1) { return false; }
3070 
3071  struct stat sb;
3072  if (fstat(fd_, &sb) == -1) {
3073  close();
3074  return false;
3075  }
3076  size_ = static_cast<size_t>(sb.st_size);
3077 
3078  addr_ = ::mmap(NULL, size_, PROT_READ, MAP_PRIVATE, fd_, 0);
3079 
3080  // Special treatment for an empty file...
3081  if (addr_ == MAP_FAILED && size_ == 0) {
3082  close();
3083  is_open_empty_file = true;
3084  return false;
3085  }
3086 #endif
3087 
3088  return true;
3089 }
3090 
3091 inline bool mmap::is_open() const {
3092  return is_open_empty_file ? true : addr_ != nullptr;
3093 }
3094 
3095 inline size_t mmap::size() const { return size_; }
3096 
3097 inline const char *mmap::data() const {
3098  return is_open_empty_file ? "" : static_cast<const char *>(addr_);
3099 }
3100 
3101 inline void mmap::close() {
3102 #if defined(_WIN64)
3103  if (addr_) {
3104  ::UnmapViewOfFile(addr_);
3105  addr_ = nullptr;
3106  }
3107 
3108  if (hMapping_) {
3109  ::CloseHandle(hMapping_);
3110  hMapping_ = NULL;
3111  }
3112 
3113  if (hFile_ != INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
3114  ::CloseHandle(hFile_);
3115  hFile_ = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
3116  }
3117 
3118  is_open_empty_file = false;
3119 #else
3120  if (addr_ != nullptr) {
3121  munmap(addr_, size_);
3122  addr_ = nullptr;
3123  }
3124 
3125  if (fd_ != -1) {
3126  ::close(fd_);
3127  fd_ = -1;
3128  }
3129 #endif
3130  size_ = 0;
3131 }
3132 inline int close_socket(socket_t sock) {
3133 #ifdef _WIN64
3134  return closesocket(sock);
3135 #else
3136  return close(sock);
3137 #endif
3138 }
3139 
3140 template <typename T> inline ssize_t handle_EINTR(T fn) {
3141  ssize_t res = 0;
3142  while (true) {
3143  res = fn();
3144  if (res < 0 && errno == EINTR) {
3145  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::microseconds{1});
3146  continue;
3147  }
3148  break;
3149  }
3150  return res;
3151 }
3152 
3153 inline ssize_t read_socket(socket_t sock, void *ptr, size_t size, int flags) {
3154  return handle_EINTR([&]() {
3155  return recv(sock,
3156 #ifdef _WIN64
3157  static_cast<char *>(ptr), static_cast<int>(size),
3158 #else
3159  ptr, size,
3160 #endif
3161  flags);
3162  });
3163 }
3164 
3165 inline ssize_t send_socket(socket_t sock, const void *ptr, size_t size,
3166  int flags) {
3167  return handle_EINTR([&]() {
3168  return send(sock,
3169 #ifdef _WIN64
3170  static_cast<const char *>(ptr), static_cast<int>(size),
3171 #else
3172  ptr, size,
3173 #endif
3174  flags);
3175  });
3176 }
3177 
3178 inline int poll_wrapper(struct pollfd *fds, nfds_t nfds, int timeout) {
3179 #ifdef _WIN64
3180  return ::WSAPoll(fds, nfds, timeout);
3181 #else
3182  return ::poll(fds, nfds, timeout);
3183 #endif
3184 }
3185 
3186 template <bool Read>
3187 inline ssize_t select_impl(socket_t sock, time_t sec, time_t usec) {
3188 #ifdef __APPLE__
3189  if (sock >= FD_SETSIZE) { return -1; }
3190 
3191  fd_set fds, *rfds, *wfds;
3192  FD_ZERO(&fds);
3193  FD_SET(sock, &fds);
3194  rfds = (Read ? &fds : nullptr);
3195  wfds = (Read ? nullptr : &fds);
3196 
3197  timeval tv;
3198  tv.tv_sec = static_cast<long>(sec);
3199  tv.tv_usec = static_cast<decltype(tv.tv_usec)>(usec);
3200 
3201  return handle_EINTR([&]() {
3202  return select(static_cast<int>(sock + 1), rfds, wfds, nullptr, &tv);
3203  });
3204 #else
3205  struct pollfd pfd;
3206  pfd.fd = sock;
3207  pfd.events = (Read ? POLLIN : POLLOUT);
3208 
3209  auto timeout = static_cast<int>(sec * 1000 + usec / 1000);
3210 
3211  return handle_EINTR([&]() { return poll_wrapper(&pfd, 1, timeout); });
3212 #endif
3213 }
3214 
3215 inline ssize_t select_read(socket_t sock, time_t sec, time_t usec) {
3216  return select_impl<true>(sock, sec, usec);
3217 }
3218 
3219 inline ssize_t select_write(socket_t sock, time_t sec, time_t usec) {
3220  return select_impl<false>(sock, sec, usec);
3221 }
3222 
3223 inline Error wait_until_socket_is_ready(socket_t sock, time_t sec,
3224  time_t usec) {
3225 #ifdef __APPLE__
3226  if (sock >= FD_SETSIZE) { return Error::Connection; }
3227 
3228  fd_set fdsr, fdsw;
3229  FD_ZERO(&fdsr);
3230  FD_ZERO(&fdsw);
3231  FD_SET(sock, &fdsr);
3232  FD_SET(sock, &fdsw);
3233 
3234  timeval tv;
3235  tv.tv_sec = static_cast<long>(sec);
3236  tv.tv_usec = static_cast<decltype(tv.tv_usec)>(usec);
3237 
3238  auto ret = handle_EINTR([&]() {
3239  return select(static_cast<int>(sock + 1), &fdsr, &fdsw, nullptr, &tv);
3240  });
3241 
3242  if (ret == 0) { return Error::ConnectionTimeout; }
3243 
3244  if (ret > 0 && (FD_ISSET(sock, &fdsr) || FD_ISSET(sock, &fdsw))) {
3245  auto error = 0;
3246  socklen_t len = sizeof(error);
3247  auto res = getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR,
3248  reinterpret_cast<char *>(&error), &len);
3249  auto successful = res >= 0 && !error;
3250  return successful ? Error::Success : Error::Connection;
3251  }
3252 
3253  return Error::Connection;
3254 #else
3255  struct pollfd pfd_read;
3256  pfd_read.fd = sock;
3257  pfd_read.events = POLLIN | POLLOUT;
3258 
3259  auto timeout = static_cast<int>(sec * 1000 + usec / 1000);
3260 
3261  auto poll_res =
3262  handle_EINTR([&]() { return poll_wrapper(&pfd_read, 1, timeout); });
3263 
3264  if (poll_res == 0) { return Error::ConnectionTimeout; }
3265 
3266  if (poll_res > 0 && pfd_read.revents & (POLLIN | POLLOUT)) {
3267  auto error = 0;
3268  socklen_t len = sizeof(error);
3269  auto res = getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_ERROR,
3270  reinterpret_cast<char *>(&error), &len);
3271  auto successful = res >= 0 && !error;
3272  return successful ? Error::Success : Error::Connection;
3273  }
3274 
3275  return Error::Connection;
3276 #endif
3277 }
3278 
3279 inline bool is_socket_alive(socket_t sock) {
3280  const auto val = detail::select_read(sock, 0, 0);
3281  if (val == 0) {
3282  return true;
3283  } else if (val < 0 && errno == EBADF) {
3284  return false;
3285  }
3286  char buf[1];
3287  return detail::read_socket(sock, &buf[0], sizeof(buf), MSG_PEEK) > 0;
3288 }
3289 
3290 class SocketStream final : public Stream {
3291 public:
3292  SocketStream(socket_t sock, time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec,
3293  time_t write_timeout_sec, time_t write_timeout_usec,
3294  time_t max_timeout_msec = 0,
3295  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time =
3296  (std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point::min)());
3297  ~SocketStream() override;
3298 
3299  bool is_readable() const override;
3300  bool wait_readable() const override;
3301  bool wait_writable() const override;
3302  ssize_t read(char *ptr, size_t size) override;
3303  ssize_t write(const char *ptr, size_t size) override;
3304  void get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
3305  void get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
3306  socket_t socket() const override;
3307  time_t duration() const override;
3308 
3309 private:
3310  socket_t sock_;
3311  time_t read_timeout_sec_;
3312  time_t read_timeout_usec_;
3313  time_t write_timeout_sec_;
3314  time_t write_timeout_usec_;
3315  time_t max_timeout_msec_;
3316  const std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time_;
3317 
3318  std::vector<char> read_buff_;
3319  size_t read_buff_off_ = 0;
3320  size_t read_buff_content_size_ = 0;
3321 
3322  static const size_t read_buff_size_ = 1024l * 4;
3323 };
3324 
3325 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
3326 class SSLSocketStream final : public Stream {
3327 public:
3328  SSLSocketStream(
3329  socket_t sock, SSL *ssl, time_t read_timeout_sec,
3330  time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
3331  time_t write_timeout_usec, time_t max_timeout_msec = 0,
3332  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time =
3333  (std::chrono::steady_clock::time_point::min)());
3334  ~SSLSocketStream() override;
3335 
3336  bool is_readable() const override;
3337  bool wait_readable() const override;
3338  bool wait_writable() const override;
3339  ssize_t read(char *ptr, size_t size) override;
3340  ssize_t write(const char *ptr, size_t size) override;
3341  void get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
3342  void get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip, int &port) const override;
3343  socket_t socket() const override;
3344  time_t duration() const override;
3345 
3346 private:
3347  socket_t sock_;
3348  SSL *ssl_;
3349  time_t read_timeout_sec_;
3350  time_t read_timeout_usec_;
3351  time_t write_timeout_sec_;
3352  time_t write_timeout_usec_;
3353  time_t max_timeout_msec_;
3354  const std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time_;
3355 };
3356 #endif
3357 
3358 inline bool keep_alive(const std::atomic<socket_t> &svr_sock, socket_t sock,
3359  time_t keep_alive_timeout_sec) {
3360  using namespace std::chrono;
3361 
3362  const auto interval_usec =
3363  CPPHTTPLIB_KEEPALIVE_TIMEOUT_CHECK_INTERVAL_USECOND;
3364 
3365  // Avoid expensive `steady_clock::now()` call for the first time
3366  if (select_read(sock, 0, interval_usec) > 0) { return true; }
3367 
3368  const auto start = steady_clock::now() - microseconds{interval_usec};
3369  const auto timeout = seconds{keep_alive_timeout_sec};
3370 
3371  while (true) {
3372  if (svr_sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
3373  break; // Server socket is closed
3374  }
3375 
3376  auto val = select_read(sock, 0, interval_usec);
3377  if (val < 0) {
3378  break; // Ssocket error
3379  } else if (val == 0) {
3380  if (steady_clock::now() - start > timeout) {
3381  break; // Timeout
3382  }
3383  } else {
3384  return true; // Ready for read
3385  }
3386  }
3387 
3388  return false;
3389 }
3390 
3391 template <typename T>
3392 inline bool
3393 process_server_socket_core(const std::atomic<socket_t> &svr_sock, socket_t sock,
3394  size_t keep_alive_max_count,
3395  time_t keep_alive_timeout_sec, T callback) {
3396  assert(keep_alive_max_count > 0);
3397  auto ret = false;
3398  auto count = keep_alive_max_count;
3399  while (count > 0 && keep_alive(svr_sock, sock, keep_alive_timeout_sec)) {
3400  auto close_connection = count == 1;
3401  auto connection_closed = false;
3402  ret = callback(close_connection, connection_closed);
3403  if (!ret || connection_closed) { break; }
3404  count--;
3405  }
3406  return ret;
3407 }
3408 
3409 template <typename T>
3410 inline bool
3411 process_server_socket(const std::atomic<socket_t> &svr_sock, socket_t sock,
3412  size_t keep_alive_max_count,
3413  time_t keep_alive_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_sec,
3414  time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
3415  time_t write_timeout_usec, T callback) {
3416  return process_server_socket_core(
3417  svr_sock, sock, keep_alive_max_count, keep_alive_timeout_sec,
3418  [&](bool close_connection, bool &connection_closed) {
3419  SocketStream strm(sock, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
3420  write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec);
3421  return callback(strm, close_connection, connection_closed);
3422  });
3423 }
3424 
3425 inline bool process_client_socket(
3426  socket_t sock, time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec,
3427  time_t write_timeout_sec, time_t write_timeout_usec,
3428  time_t max_timeout_msec,
3429  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time,
3430  std::function<bool(Stream &)> callback) {
3431  SocketStream strm(sock, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
3432  write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec, max_timeout_msec,
3433  start_time);
3434  return callback(strm);
3435 }
3436 
3437 inline int shutdown_socket(socket_t sock) {
3438 #ifdef _WIN64
3439  return shutdown(sock, SD_BOTH);
3440 #else
3441  return shutdown(sock, SHUT_RDWR);
3442 #endif
3443 }
3444 
3445 inline std::string escape_abstract_namespace_unix_domain(const std::string &s) {
3446  if (s.size() > 1 && s[0] == '\0') {
3447  auto ret = s;
3448  ret[0] = '@';
3449  return ret;
3450  }
3451  return s;
3452 }
3453 
3454 inline std::string
3455 unescape_abstract_namespace_unix_domain(const std::string &s) {
3456  if (s.size() > 1 && s[0] == '@') {
3457  auto ret = s;
3458  ret[0] = '\0';
3459  return ret;
3460  }
3461  return s;
3462 }
3463 
3464 inline int getaddrinfo_with_timeout(const char *node, const char *service,
3465  const struct addrinfo *hints,
3466  struct addrinfo **res, time_t timeout_sec) {
3467 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_USE_NON_BLOCKING_GETADDRINFO
3468  if (timeout_sec <= 0) {
3469  // No timeout specified, use standard getaddrinfo
3470  return getaddrinfo(node, service, hints, res);
3471  }
3472 
3473 #ifdef _WIN64
3474  // Windows-specific implementation using GetAddrInfoEx with overlapped I/O
3475  OVERLAPPED overlapped = {0};
3476  HANDLE event = CreateEventW(nullptr, TRUE, FALSE, nullptr);
3477  if (!event) { return EAI_FAIL; }
3478 
3479  overlapped.hEvent = event;
3480 
3481  PADDRINFOEXW result_addrinfo = nullptr;
3482  HANDLE cancel_handle = nullptr;
3483 
3484  ADDRINFOEXW hints_ex = {0};
3485  if (hints) {
3486  hints_ex.ai_flags = hints->ai_flags;
3487  hints_ex.ai_family = hints->ai_family;
3488  hints_ex.ai_socktype = hints->ai_socktype;
3489  hints_ex.ai_protocol = hints->ai_protocol;
3490  }
3491 
3492  auto wnode = u8string_to_wstring(node);
3493  auto wservice = u8string_to_wstring(service);
3494 
3495  auto ret = ::GetAddrInfoExW(wnode.data(), wservice.data(), NS_DNS, nullptr,
3496  hints ? &hints_ex : nullptr, &result_addrinfo,
3497  nullptr, &overlapped, nullptr, &cancel_handle);
3498 
3499  if (ret == WSA_IO_PENDING) {
3500  auto wait_result =
3501  ::WaitForSingleObject(event, static_cast<DWORD>(timeout_sec * 1000));
3502  if (wait_result == WAIT_TIMEOUT) {
3503  if (cancel_handle) { ::GetAddrInfoExCancel(&cancel_handle); }
3504  ::CloseHandle(event);
3505  return EAI_AGAIN;
3506  }
3507 
3508  DWORD bytes_returned;
3509  if (!::GetOverlappedResult((HANDLE)INVALID_SOCKET, &overlapped,
3510  &bytes_returned, FALSE)) {
3511  ::CloseHandle(event);
3512  return ::WSAGetLastError();
3513  }
3514  }
3515 
3516  ::CloseHandle(event);
3517 
3518  if (ret == NO_ERROR || ret == WSA_IO_PENDING) {
3519  *res = reinterpret_cast<struct addrinfo *>(result_addrinfo);
3520  return 0;
3521  }
3522 
3523  return ret;
3524 #elif defined(TARGET_OS_OSX)
3525  // macOS implementation using CFHost API for asynchronous DNS resolution
3526  CFStringRef hostname_ref = CFStringCreateWithCString(
3527  kCFAllocatorDefault, node, kCFStringEncodingUTF8);
3528  if (!hostname_ref) { return EAI_MEMORY; }
3529 
3530  CFHostRef host_ref = CFHostCreateWithName(kCFAllocatorDefault, hostname_ref);
3531  CFRelease(hostname_ref);
3532  if (!host_ref) { return EAI_MEMORY; }
3533 
3534  // Set up context for callback
3535  struct CFHostContext {
3536  bool completed = false;
3537  bool success = false;
3538  CFArrayRef addresses = nullptr;
3539  std::mutex mutex;
3540  std::condition_variable cv;
3541  } context;
3542 
3543  CFHostClientContext client_context;
3544  memset(&client_context, 0, sizeof(client_context));
3545  client_context.info = &context;
3546 
3547  // Set callback
3548  auto callback = [](CFHostRef theHost, CFHostInfoType /*typeInfo*/,
3549  const CFStreamError *error, void *info) {
3550  auto ctx = static_cast<CFHostContext *>(info);
3551  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(ctx->mutex);
3552 
3553  if (error && error->error != 0) {
3554  ctx->success = false;
3555  } else {
3556  Boolean hasBeenResolved;
3557  ctx->addresses = CFHostGetAddressing(theHost, &hasBeenResolved);
3558  if (ctx->addresses && hasBeenResolved) {
3559  CFRetain(ctx->addresses);
3560  ctx->success = true;
3561  } else {
3562  ctx->success = false;
3563  }
3564  }
3565  ctx->completed = true;
3566  ctx->cv.notify_one();
3567  };
3568 
3569  if (!CFHostSetClient(host_ref, callback, &client_context)) {
3570  CFRelease(host_ref);
3571  return EAI_SYSTEM;
3572  }
3573 
3574  // Schedule on run loop
3575  CFRunLoopRef run_loop = CFRunLoopGetCurrent();
3576  CFHostScheduleWithRunLoop(host_ref, run_loop, kCFRunLoopDefaultMode);
3577 
3578  // Start resolution
3579  CFStreamError stream_error;
3580  if (!CFHostStartInfoResolution(host_ref, kCFHostAddresses, &stream_error)) {
3581  CFHostUnscheduleFromRunLoop(host_ref, run_loop, kCFRunLoopDefaultMode);
3582  CFRelease(host_ref);
3583  return EAI_FAIL;
3584  }
3585 
3586  // Wait for completion with timeout
3587  auto timeout_time =
3588  std::chrono::steady_clock::now() + std::chrono::seconds(timeout_sec);
3589  bool timed_out = false;
3590 
3591  {
3592  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(context.mutex);
3593 
3594  while (!context.completed) {
3595  auto now = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
3596  if (now >= timeout_time) {
3597  timed_out = true;
3598  break;
3599  }
3600 
3601  // Run the runloop for a short time
3602  lock.unlock();
3603  CFRunLoopRunInMode(kCFRunLoopDefaultMode, 0.1, true);
3604  lock.lock();
3605  }
3606  }
3607 
3608  // Clean up
3609  CFHostUnscheduleFromRunLoop(host_ref, run_loop, kCFRunLoopDefaultMode);
3610  CFHostSetClient(host_ref, nullptr, nullptr);
3611 
3612  if (timed_out || !context.completed) {
3613  CFHostCancelInfoResolution(host_ref, kCFHostAddresses);
3614  CFRelease(host_ref);
3615  return EAI_AGAIN;
3616  }
3617 
3618  if (!context.success || !context.addresses) {
3619  CFRelease(host_ref);
3620  return EAI_NODATA;
3621  }
3622 
3623  // Convert CFArray to addrinfo
3624  CFIndex count = CFArrayGetCount(context.addresses);
3625  if (count == 0) {
3626  CFRelease(context.addresses);
3627  CFRelease(host_ref);
3628  return EAI_NODATA;
3629  }
3630 
3631  struct addrinfo *result_addrinfo = nullptr;
3632  struct addrinfo **current = &result_addrinfo;
3633 
3634  for (CFIndex i = 0; i < count; i++) {
3635  CFDataRef addr_data =
3636  static_cast<CFDataRef>(CFArrayGetValueAtIndex(context.addresses, i));
3637  if (!addr_data) continue;
3638 
3639  const struct sockaddr *sockaddr_ptr =
3640  reinterpret_cast<const struct sockaddr *>(CFDataGetBytePtr(addr_data));
3641  socklen_t sockaddr_len = static_cast<socklen_t>(CFDataGetLength(addr_data));
3642 
3643  // Allocate addrinfo structure
3644  *current = static_cast<struct addrinfo *>(malloc(sizeof(struct addrinfo)));
3645  if (!*current) {
3646  freeaddrinfo(result_addrinfo);
3647  CFRelease(context.addresses);
3648  CFRelease(host_ref);
3649  return EAI_MEMORY;
3650  }
3651 
3652  memset(*current, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
3653 
3654  // Set up addrinfo fields
3655  (*current)->ai_family = sockaddr_ptr->sa_family;
3656  (*current)->ai_socktype = hints ? hints->ai_socktype : SOCK_STREAM;
3657  (*current)->ai_protocol = hints ? hints->ai_protocol : IPPROTO_TCP;
3658  (*current)->ai_addrlen = sockaddr_len;
3659 
3660  // Copy sockaddr
3661  (*current)->ai_addr = static_cast<struct sockaddr *>(malloc(sockaddr_len));
3662  if (!(*current)->ai_addr) {
3663  freeaddrinfo(result_addrinfo);
3664  CFRelease(context.addresses);
3665  CFRelease(host_ref);
3666  return EAI_MEMORY;
3667  }
3668  memcpy((*current)->ai_addr, sockaddr_ptr, sockaddr_len);
3669 
3670  // Set port if service is specified
3671  if (service && strlen(service) > 0) {
3672  int port = atoi(service);
3673  if (port > 0) {
3674  if (sockaddr_ptr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
3675  reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in *>((*current)->ai_addr)
3676  ->sin_port = htons(static_cast<uint16_t>(port));
3677  } else if (sockaddr_ptr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
3678  reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in6 *>((*current)->ai_addr)
3679  ->sin6_port = htons(static_cast<uint16_t>(port));
3680  }
3681  }
3682  }
3683 
3684  current = &((*current)->ai_next);
3685  }
3686 
3687  CFRelease(context.addresses);
3688  CFRelease(host_ref);
3689 
3690  *res = result_addrinfo;
3691  return 0;
3692 #elif defined(_GNU_SOURCE) && defined(__GLIBC__) && \
3693  (__GLIBC__ > 2 || (__GLIBC__ == 2 && __GLIBC_MINOR__ >= 2))
3694  // Linux implementation using getaddrinfo_a for asynchronous DNS resolution
3695  struct gaicb request;
3696  struct gaicb *requests[1] = {&request};
3697  struct sigevent sevp;
3698  struct timespec timeout;
3699 
3700  // Initialize the request structure
3701  memset(&request, 0, sizeof(request));
3702  request.ar_name = node;
3703  request.ar_service = service;
3704  request.ar_request = hints;
3705 
3706  // Set up timeout
3707  timeout.tv_sec = timeout_sec;
3708  timeout.tv_nsec = 0;
3709 
3710  // Initialize sigevent structure (not used, but required)
3711  memset(&sevp, 0, sizeof(sevp));
3712  sevp.sigev_notify = SIGEV_NONE;
3713 
3714  // Start asynchronous resolution
3715  int start_result = getaddrinfo_a(GAI_NOWAIT, requests, 1, &sevp);
3716  if (start_result != 0) { return start_result; }
3717 
3718  // Wait for completion with timeout
3719  int wait_result =
3720  gai_suspend((const struct gaicb *const *)requests, 1, &timeout);
3721 
3722  if (wait_result == 0) {
3723  // Completed successfully, get the result
3724  int gai_result = gai_error(&request);
3725  if (gai_result == 0) {
3726  *res = request.ar_result;
3727  return 0;
3728  } else {
3729  // Clean up on error
3730  if (request.ar_result) { freeaddrinfo(request.ar_result); }
3731  return gai_result;
3732  }
3733  } else if (wait_result == EAI_AGAIN) {
3734  // Timeout occurred, cancel the request
3735  gai_cancel(&request);
3736  return EAI_AGAIN;
3737  } else {
3738  // Other error occurred
3739  gai_cancel(&request);
3740  return wait_result;
3741  }
3742 #else
3743  // Fallback implementation using thread-based timeout for other Unix systems
3744  std::mutex result_mutex;
3745  std::condition_variable result_cv;
3746  auto completed = false;
3747  auto result = EAI_SYSTEM;
3748  struct addrinfo *result_addrinfo = nullptr;
3749 
3750  std::thread resolve_thread([&]() {
3751  auto thread_result = getaddrinfo(node, service, hints, &result_addrinfo);
3752 
3753  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock(result_mutex);
3754  result = thread_result;
3755  completed = true;
3756  result_cv.notify_one();
3757  });
3758 
3759  // Wait for completion or timeout
3760  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock(result_mutex);
3761  auto finished = result_cv.wait_for(lock, std::chrono::seconds(timeout_sec),
3762  [&] { return completed; });
3763 
3764  if (finished) {
3765  // Operation completed within timeout
3766  resolve_thread.join();
3767  *res = result_addrinfo;
3768  return result;
3769  } else {
3770  // Timeout occurred
3771  resolve_thread.detach(); // Let the thread finish in background
3772  return EAI_AGAIN; // Return timeout error
3773  }
3774 #endif
3775 #else
3776  (void)(timeout_sec); // Unused parameter for non-blocking getaddrinfo
3777  return getaddrinfo(node, service, hints, res);
3778 #endif
3779 }
3780 
3781 template <typename BindOrConnect>
3782 socket_t create_socket(const std::string &host, const std::string &ip, int port,
3783  int address_family, int socket_flags, bool tcp_nodelay,
3784  bool ipv6_v6only, SocketOptions socket_options,
3785  BindOrConnect bind_or_connect, time_t timeout_sec = 0) {
3786  // Get address info
3787  const char *node = nullptr;
3788  struct addrinfo hints;
3789  struct addrinfo *result;
3790 
3791  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
3792  hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
3793  hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_IP;
3794 
3795  if (!ip.empty()) {
3796  node = ip.c_str();
3797  // Ask getaddrinfo to convert IP in c-string to address
3798  hints.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
3799  hints.ai_flags = AI_NUMERICHOST;
3800  } else {
3801  if (!host.empty()) { node = host.c_str(); }
3802  hints.ai_family = address_family;
3803  hints.ai_flags = socket_flags;
3804  }
3805 
3806 #if !defined(_WIN64) || defined(CPPHTTPLIB_HAVE_AFUNIX_H)
3807  if (hints.ai_family == AF_UNIX) {
3808  const auto addrlen = host.length();
3809  if (addrlen > sizeof(sockaddr_un::sun_path)) { return INVALID_SOCKET; }
3810 
3811 #ifdef SOCK_CLOEXEC
3812  auto sock = socket(hints.ai_family, hints.ai_socktype | SOCK_CLOEXEC,
3813  hints.ai_protocol);
3814 #else
3815  auto sock = socket(hints.ai_family, hints.ai_socktype, hints.ai_protocol);
3816 #endif
3817 
3818  if (sock != INVALID_SOCKET) {
3819  sockaddr_un addr{};
3820  addr.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
3821 
3822  auto unescaped_host = unescape_abstract_namespace_unix_domain(host);
3823  std::copy(unescaped_host.begin(), unescaped_host.end(), addr.sun_path);
3824 
3825  hints.ai_addr = reinterpret_cast<sockaddr *>(&addr);
3826  hints.ai_addrlen = static_cast<socklen_t>(
3827  sizeof(addr) - sizeof(addr.sun_path) + addrlen);
3828 
3829 #ifndef SOCK_CLOEXEC
3830 #ifndef _WIN64
3831  fcntl(sock, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC);
3832 #endif
3833 #endif
3834 
3835  if (socket_options) { socket_options(sock); }
3836 
3837 #ifdef _WIN64
3838  // Setting SO_REUSEADDR seems not to work well with AF_UNIX on windows, so
3839  // remove the option.
3840  detail::set_socket_opt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, 0);
3841 #endif
3842 
3843  bool dummy;
3844  if (!bind_or_connect(sock, hints, dummy)) {
3845  close_socket(sock);
3846  sock = INVALID_SOCKET;
3847  }
3848  }
3849  return sock;
3850  }
3851 #endif
3852 
3853  auto service = std::to_string(port);
3854 
3855  if (getaddrinfo_with_timeout(node, service.c_str(), &hints, &result,
3856  timeout_sec)) {
3857 #if defined __linux__ && !defined __ANDROID__
3858  res_init();
3859 #endif
3860  return INVALID_SOCKET;
3861  }
3862  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { freeaddrinfo(result); });
3863 
3864  for (auto rp = result; rp; rp = rp->ai_next) {
3865  // Create a socket
3866 #ifdef _WIN64
3867  auto sock =
3868  WSASocketW(rp->ai_family, rp->ai_socktype, rp->ai_protocol, nullptr, 0,
3869  WSA_FLAG_NO_HANDLE_INHERIT | WSA_FLAG_OVERLAPPED);
3884  if (sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
3885  sock = socket(rp->ai_family, rp->ai_socktype, rp->ai_protocol);
3886  }
3887 #else
3888 
3889 #ifdef SOCK_CLOEXEC
3890  auto sock =
3891  socket(rp->ai_family, rp->ai_socktype | SOCK_CLOEXEC, rp->ai_protocol);
3892 #else
3893  auto sock = socket(rp->ai_family, rp->ai_socktype, rp->ai_protocol);
3894 #endif
3895 
3896 #endif
3897  if (sock == INVALID_SOCKET) { continue; }
3898 
3899 #if !defined _WIN64 && !defined SOCK_CLOEXEC
3900  if (fcntl(sock, F_SETFD, FD_CLOEXEC) == -1) {
3901  close_socket(sock);
3902  continue;
3903  }
3904 #endif
3905 
3906  if (tcp_nodelay) { set_socket_opt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, 1); }
3907 
3908  if (rp->ai_family == AF_INET6) {
3909  set_socket_opt(sock, IPPROTO_IPV6, IPV6_V6ONLY, ipv6_v6only ? 1 : 0);
3910  }
3911 
3912  if (socket_options) { socket_options(sock); }
3913 
3914  // bind or connect
3915  auto quit = false;
3916  if (bind_or_connect(sock, *rp, quit)) { return sock; }
3917 
3918  close_socket(sock);
3919 
3920  if (quit) { break; }
3921  }
3922 
3923  return INVALID_SOCKET;
3924 }
3925 
3926 inline void set_nonblocking(socket_t sock, bool nonblocking) {
3927 #ifdef _WIN64
3928  auto flags = nonblocking ? 1UL : 0UL;
3929  ioctlsocket(sock, FIONBIO, &flags);
3930 #else
3931  auto flags = fcntl(sock, F_GETFL, 0);
3932  fcntl(sock, F_SETFL,
3933  nonblocking ? (flags | O_NONBLOCK) : (flags & (~O_NONBLOCK)));
3934 #endif
3935 }
3936 
3937 inline bool is_connection_error() {
3938 #ifdef _WIN64
3939  return WSAGetLastError() != WSAEWOULDBLOCK;
3940 #else
3941  return errno != EINPROGRESS;
3942 #endif
3943 }
3944 
3945 inline bool bind_ip_address(socket_t sock, const std::string &host) {
3946  struct addrinfo hints;
3947  struct addrinfo *result;
3948 
3949  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
3950  hints.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
3951  hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
3952  hints.ai_protocol = 0;
3953 
3954  if (getaddrinfo_with_timeout(host.c_str(), "0", &hints, &result, 0)) {
3955  return false;
3956  }
3957 
3958  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { freeaddrinfo(result); });
3959 
3960  auto ret = false;
3961  for (auto rp = result; rp; rp = rp->ai_next) {
3962  const auto &ai = *rp;
3963  if (!::bind(sock, ai.ai_addr, static_cast<socklen_t>(ai.ai_addrlen))) {
3964  ret = true;
3965  break;
3966  }
3967  }
3968 
3969  return ret;
3970 }
3971 
3972 #if !defined _WIN64 && !defined ANDROID && !defined _AIX && !defined __MVS__
3973 #define USE_IF2IP
3974 #endif
3975 
3976 #ifdef USE_IF2IP
3977 inline std::string if2ip(int address_family, const std::string &ifn) {
3978  struct ifaddrs *ifap;
3979  getifaddrs(&ifap);
3980  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { freeifaddrs(ifap); });
3981 
3982  std::string addr_candidate;
3983  for (auto ifa = ifap; ifa; ifa = ifa->ifa_next) {
3984  if (ifa->ifa_addr && ifn == ifa->ifa_name &&
3985  (AF_UNSPEC == address_family ||
3986  ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == address_family)) {
3987  if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET) {
3988  auto sa = reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in *>(ifa->ifa_addr);
3989  char buf[INET_ADDRSTRLEN];
3990  if (inet_ntop(AF_INET, &sa->sin_addr, buf, INET_ADDRSTRLEN)) {
3991  return std::string(buf, INET_ADDRSTRLEN);
3992  }
3993  } else if (ifa->ifa_addr->sa_family == AF_INET6) {
3994  auto sa = reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_in6 *>(ifa->ifa_addr);
3995  if (!IN6_IS_ADDR_LINKLOCAL(&sa->sin6_addr)) {
3996  char buf[INET6_ADDRSTRLEN] = {};
3997  if (inet_ntop(AF_INET6, &sa->sin6_addr, buf, INET6_ADDRSTRLEN)) {
3998  // equivalent to mac's IN6_IS_ADDR_UNIQUE_LOCAL
3999  auto s6_addr_head = sa->sin6_addr.s6_addr[0];
4000  if (s6_addr_head == 0xfc || s6_addr_head == 0xfd) {
4001  addr_candidate = std::string(buf, INET6_ADDRSTRLEN);
4002  } else {
4003  return std::string(buf, INET6_ADDRSTRLEN);
4004  }
4005  }
4006  }
4007  }
4008  }
4009  }
4010  return addr_candidate;
4011 }
4012 #endif
4013 
4014 inline socket_t create_client_socket(
4015  const std::string &host, const std::string &ip, int port,
4016  int address_family, bool tcp_nodelay, bool ipv6_v6only,
4017  SocketOptions socket_options, time_t connection_timeout_sec,
4018  time_t connection_timeout_usec, time_t read_timeout_sec,
4019  time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
4020  time_t write_timeout_usec, const std::string &intf, Error &error) {
4021  auto sock = create_socket(
4022  host, ip, port, address_family, 0, tcp_nodelay, ipv6_v6only,
4023  std::move(socket_options),
4024  [&](socket_t sock2, struct addrinfo &ai, bool &quit) -> bool {
4025  if (!intf.empty()) {
4026 #ifdef USE_IF2IP
4027  auto ip_from_if = if2ip(address_family, intf);
4028  if (ip_from_if.empty()) { ip_from_if = intf; }
4029  if (!bind_ip_address(sock2, ip_from_if)) {
4030  error = Error::BindIPAddress;
4031  return false;
4032  }
4033 #endif
4034  }
4035 
4036  set_nonblocking(sock2, true);
4037 
4038  auto ret =
4039  ::connect(sock2, ai.ai_addr, static_cast<socklen_t>(ai.ai_addrlen));
4040 
4041  if (ret < 0) {
4042  if (is_connection_error()) {
4043  error = Error::Connection;
4044  return false;
4045  }
4046  error = wait_until_socket_is_ready(sock2, connection_timeout_sec,
4047  connection_timeout_usec);
4048  if (error != Error::Success) {
4049  if (error == Error::ConnectionTimeout) { quit = true; }
4050  return false;
4051  }
4052  }
4053 
4054  set_nonblocking(sock2, false);
4055  set_socket_opt_time(sock2, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO, read_timeout_sec,
4056  read_timeout_usec);
4057  set_socket_opt_time(sock2, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDTIMEO, write_timeout_sec,
4058  write_timeout_usec);
4059 
4060  error = Error::Success;
4061  return true;
4062  },
4063  connection_timeout_sec); // Pass DNS timeout
4064 
4065  if (sock != INVALID_SOCKET) {
4066  error = Error::Success;
4067  } else {
4068  if (error == Error::Success) { error = Error::Connection; }
4069  }
4070 
4071  return sock;
4072 }
4073 
4074 inline bool get_ip_and_port(const struct sockaddr_storage &addr,
4075  socklen_t addr_len, std::string &ip, int &port) {
4076  if (addr.ss_family == AF_INET) {
4077  port = ntohs(reinterpret_cast<const struct sockaddr_in *>(&addr)->sin_port);
4078  } else if (addr.ss_family == AF_INET6) {
4079  port =
4080  ntohs(reinterpret_cast<const struct sockaddr_in6 *>(&addr)->sin6_port);
4081  } else {
4082  return false;
4083  }
4084 
4085  std::array<char, NI_MAXHOST> ipstr{};
4086  if (getnameinfo(reinterpret_cast<const struct sockaddr *>(&addr), addr_len,
4087  ipstr.data(), static_cast<socklen_t>(ipstr.size()), nullptr,
4088  0, NI_NUMERICHOST)) {
4089  return false;
4090  }
4091 
4092  ip = ipstr.data();
4093  return true;
4094 }
4095 
4096 inline void get_local_ip_and_port(socket_t sock, std::string &ip, int &port) {
4097  struct sockaddr_storage addr;
4098  socklen_t addr_len = sizeof(addr);
4099  if (!getsockname(sock, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&addr),
4100  &addr_len)) {
4101  get_ip_and_port(addr, addr_len, ip, port);
4102  }
4103 }
4104 
4105 inline void get_remote_ip_and_port(socket_t sock, std::string &ip, int &port) {
4106  struct sockaddr_storage addr;
4107  socklen_t addr_len = sizeof(addr);
4108 
4109  if (!getpeername(sock, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr *>(&addr),
4110  &addr_len)) {
4111 #ifndef _WIN64
4112  if (addr.ss_family == AF_UNIX) {
4113 #if defined(__linux__)
4114  struct ucred ucred;
4115  socklen_t len = sizeof(ucred);
4116  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_PEERCRED, &ucred, &len) == 0) {
4117  port = ucred.pid;
4118  }
4119 #elif defined(SOL_LOCAL) && defined(SO_PEERPID)
4120  pid_t pid;
4121  socklen_t len = sizeof(pid);
4122  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_LOCAL, SO_PEERPID, &pid, &len) == 0) {
4123  port = pid;
4124  }
4125 #endif
4126  return;
4127  }
4128 #endif
4129  get_ip_and_port(addr, addr_len, ip, port);
4130  }
4131 }
4132 
4133 inline constexpr unsigned int str2tag_core(const char *s, size_t l,
4134  unsigned int h) {
4135  return (l == 0)
4136  ? h
4137  : str2tag_core(
4138  s + 1, l - 1,
4139  // Unsets the 6 high bits of h, therefore no overflow happens
4140  (((std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::max)() >> 6) &
4141  h * 33) ^
4142  static_cast<unsigned char>(*s));
4143 }
4144 
4145 inline unsigned int str2tag(const std::string &s) {
4146  return str2tag_core(s.data(), s.size(), 0);
4147 }
4148 
4149 namespace udl {
4150 
4151 inline constexpr unsigned int operator""_t(const char *s, size_t l) {
4152  return str2tag_core(s, l, 0);
4153 }
4154 
4155 } // namespace udl
4156 
4157 inline std::string
4158 find_content_type(const std::string &path,
4159  const std::map<std::string, std::string> &user_data,
4160  const std::string &default_content_type) {
4161  auto ext = file_extension(path);
4162 
4163  auto it = user_data.find(ext);
4164  if (it != user_data.end()) { return it->second; }
4165 
4166  using udl::operator""_t;
4167 
4168  switch (str2tag(ext)) {
4169  default: return default_content_type;
4170 
4171  case "css"_t: return "text/css";
4172  case "csv"_t: return "text/csv";
4173  case "htm"_t:
4174  case "html"_t: return "text/html";
4175  case "js"_t:
4176  case "mjs"_t: return "text/javascript";
4177  case "txt"_t: return "text/plain";
4178  case "vtt"_t: return "text/vtt";
4179 
4180  case "apng"_t: return "image/apng";
4181  case "avif"_t: return "image/avif";
4182  case "bmp"_t: return "image/bmp";
4183  case "gif"_t: return "image/gif";
4184  case "png"_t: return "image/png";
4185  case "svg"_t: return "image/svg+xml";
4186  case "webp"_t: return "image/webp";
4187  case "ico"_t: return "image/x-icon";
4188  case "tif"_t: return "image/tiff";
4189  case "tiff"_t: return "image/tiff";
4190  case "jpg"_t:
4191  case "jpeg"_t: return "image/jpeg";
4192 
4193  case "mp4"_t: return "video/mp4";
4194  case "mpeg"_t: return "video/mpeg";
4195  case "webm"_t: return "video/webm";
4196 
4197  case "mp3"_t: return "audio/mp3";
4198  case "mpga"_t: return "audio/mpeg";
4199  case "weba"_t: return "audio/webm";
4200  case "wav"_t: return "audio/wave";
4201 
4202  case "otf"_t: return "font/otf";
4203  case "ttf"_t: return "font/ttf";
4204  case "woff"_t: return "font/woff";
4205  case "woff2"_t: return "font/woff2";
4206 
4207  case "7z"_t: return "application/x-7z-compressed";
4208  case "atom"_t: return "application/atom+xml";
4209  case "pdf"_t: return "application/pdf";
4210  case "json"_t: return "application/json";
4211  case "rss"_t: return "application/rss+xml";
4212  case "tar"_t: return "application/x-tar";
4213  case "xht"_t:
4214  case "xhtml"_t: return "application/xhtml+xml";
4215  case "xslt"_t: return "application/xslt+xml";
4216  case "xml"_t: return "application/xml";
4217  case "gz"_t: return "application/gzip";
4218  case "zip"_t: return "application/zip";
4219  case "wasm"_t: return "application/wasm";
4220  }
4221 }
4222 
4223 inline bool can_compress_content_type(const std::string &content_type) {
4224  using udl::operator""_t;
4225 
4226  auto tag = str2tag(content_type);
4227 
4228  switch (tag) {
4229  case "image/svg+xml"_t:
4230  case "application/javascript"_t:
4231  case "application/json"_t:
4232  case "application/xml"_t:
4233  case "application/protobuf"_t:
4234  case "application/xhtml+xml"_t: return true;
4235 
4236  case "text/event-stream"_t: return false;
4237 
4238  default: return !content_type.rfind("text/", 0);
4239  }
4240 }
4241 
4242 inline EncodingType encoding_type(const Request &req, const Response &res) {
4243  auto ret =
4244  detail::can_compress_content_type(res.get_header_value("Content-Type"));
4245  if (!ret) { return EncodingType::None; }
4246 
4247  const auto &s = req.get_header_value("Accept-Encoding");
4248  (void)(s);
4249 
4250 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_BROTLI_SUPPORT
4251  // TODO: 'Accept-Encoding' has br, not br;q=0
4252  ret = s.find("br") != std::string::npos;
4253  if (ret) { return EncodingType::Brotli; }
4254 #endif
4255 
4256 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZLIB_SUPPORT
4257  // TODO: 'Accept-Encoding' has gzip, not gzip;q=0
4258  ret = s.find("gzip") != std::string::npos;
4259  if (ret) { return EncodingType::Gzip; }
4260 #endif
4261 
4262 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZSTD_SUPPORT
4263  // TODO: 'Accept-Encoding' has zstd, not zstd;q=0
4264  ret = s.find("zstd") != std::string::npos;
4265  if (ret) { return EncodingType::Zstd; }
4266 #endif
4267 
4268  return EncodingType::None;
4269 }
4270 
4271 inline bool nocompressor::compress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4272  bool /*last*/, Callback callback) {
4273  if (!data_length) { return true; }
4274  return callback(data, data_length);
4275 }
4276 
4277 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZLIB_SUPPORT
4278 inline gzip_compressor::gzip_compressor() {
4279  std::memset(&strm_, 0, sizeof(strm_));
4280  strm_.zalloc = Z_NULL;
4281  strm_.zfree = Z_NULL;
4282  strm_.opaque = Z_NULL;
4283 
4284  is_valid_ = deflateInit2(&strm_, Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION, Z_DEFLATED, 31, 8,
4285  Z_DEFAULT_STRATEGY) == Z_OK;
4286 }
4287 
4288 inline gzip_compressor::~gzip_compressor() { deflateEnd(&strm_); }
4289 
4290 inline bool gzip_compressor::compress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4291  bool last, Callback callback) {
4292  assert(is_valid_);
4293 
4294  do {
4295  constexpr size_t max_avail_in =
4296  (std::numeric_limits<decltype(strm_.avail_in)>::max)();
4297 
4298  strm_.avail_in = static_cast<decltype(strm_.avail_in)>(
4299  (std::min)(data_length, max_avail_in));
4300  strm_.next_in = const_cast<Bytef *>(reinterpret_cast<const Bytef *>(data));
4301 
4302  data_length -= strm_.avail_in;
4303  data += strm_.avail_in;
4304 
4305  auto flush = (last && data_length == 0) ? Z_FINISH : Z_NO_FLUSH;
4306  auto ret = Z_OK;
4307 
4308  std::array<char, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4309  do {
4310  strm_.avail_out = static_cast<uInt>(buff.size());
4311  strm_.next_out = reinterpret_cast<Bytef *>(buff.data());
4312 
4313  ret = deflate(&strm_, flush);
4314  if (ret == Z_STREAM_ERROR) { return false; }
4315 
4316  if (!callback(buff.data(), buff.size() - strm_.avail_out)) {
4317  return false;
4318  }
4319  } while (strm_.avail_out == 0);
4320 
4321  assert((flush == Z_FINISH && ret == Z_STREAM_END) ||
4322  (flush == Z_NO_FLUSH && ret == Z_OK));
4323  assert(strm_.avail_in == 0);
4324  } while (data_length > 0);
4325 
4326  return true;
4327 }
4328 
4329 inline gzip_decompressor::gzip_decompressor() {
4330  std::memset(&strm_, 0, sizeof(strm_));
4331  strm_.zalloc = Z_NULL;
4332  strm_.zfree = Z_NULL;
4333  strm_.opaque = Z_NULL;
4334 
4335  // 15 is the value of wbits, which should be at the maximum possible value
4336  // to ensure that any gzip stream can be decoded. The offset of 32 specifies
4337  // that the stream type should be automatically detected either gzip or
4338  // deflate.
4339  is_valid_ = inflateInit2(&strm_, 32 + 15) == Z_OK;
4340 }
4341 
4342 inline gzip_decompressor::~gzip_decompressor() { inflateEnd(&strm_); }
4343 
4344 inline bool gzip_decompressor::is_valid() const { return is_valid_; }
4345 
4346 inline bool gzip_decompressor::decompress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4347  Callback callback) {
4348  assert(is_valid_);
4349 
4350  auto ret = Z_OK;
4351 
4352  do {
4353  constexpr size_t max_avail_in =
4354  (std::numeric_limits<decltype(strm_.avail_in)>::max)();
4355 
4356  strm_.avail_in = static_cast<decltype(strm_.avail_in)>(
4357  (std::min)(data_length, max_avail_in));
4358  strm_.next_in = const_cast<Bytef *>(reinterpret_cast<const Bytef *>(data));
4359 
4360  data_length -= strm_.avail_in;
4361  data += strm_.avail_in;
4362 
4363  std::array<char, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4364  while (strm_.avail_in > 0 && ret == Z_OK) {
4365  strm_.avail_out = static_cast<uInt>(buff.size());
4366  strm_.next_out = reinterpret_cast<Bytef *>(buff.data());
4367 
4368  ret = inflate(&strm_, Z_NO_FLUSH);
4369 
4370  assert(ret != Z_STREAM_ERROR);
4371  switch (ret) {
4372  case Z_NEED_DICT:
4373  case Z_DATA_ERROR:
4374  case Z_MEM_ERROR: inflateEnd(&strm_); return false;
4375  }
4376 
4377  if (!callback(buff.data(), buff.size() - strm_.avail_out)) {
4378  return false;
4379  }
4380  }
4381 
4382  if (ret != Z_OK && ret != Z_STREAM_END) { return false; }
4383 
4384  } while (data_length > 0);
4385 
4386  return true;
4387 }
4388 #endif
4389 
4390 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_BROTLI_SUPPORT
4391 inline brotli_compressor::brotli_compressor() {
4392  state_ = BrotliEncoderCreateInstance(nullptr, nullptr, nullptr);
4393 }
4394 
4395 inline brotli_compressor::~brotli_compressor() {
4396  BrotliEncoderDestroyInstance(state_);
4397 }
4398 
4399 inline bool brotli_compressor::compress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4400  bool last, Callback callback) {
4401  std::array<uint8_t, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4402 
4403  auto operation = last ? BROTLI_OPERATION_FINISH : BROTLI_OPERATION_PROCESS;
4404  auto available_in = data_length;
4405  auto next_in = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(data);
4406 
4407  for (;;) {
4408  if (last) {
4409  if (BrotliEncoderIsFinished(state_)) { break; }
4410  } else {
4411  if (!available_in) { break; }
4412  }
4413 
4414  auto available_out = buff.size();
4415  auto next_out = buff.data();
4416 
4417  if (!BrotliEncoderCompressStream(state_, operation, &available_in, &next_in,
4418  &available_out, &next_out, nullptr)) {
4419  return false;
4420  }
4421 
4422  auto output_bytes = buff.size() - available_out;
4423  if (output_bytes) {
4424  callback(reinterpret_cast<const char *>(buff.data()), output_bytes);
4425  }
4426  }
4427 
4428  return true;
4429 }
4430 
4431 inline brotli_decompressor::brotli_decompressor() {
4432  decoder_s = BrotliDecoderCreateInstance(0, 0, 0);
4433  decoder_r = decoder_s ? BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_NEEDS_MORE_INPUT
4434  : BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_ERROR;
4435 }
4436 
4437 inline brotli_decompressor::~brotli_decompressor() {
4438  if (decoder_s) { BrotliDecoderDestroyInstance(decoder_s); }
4439 }
4440 
4441 inline bool brotli_decompressor::is_valid() const { return decoder_s; }
4442 
4443 inline bool brotli_decompressor::decompress(const char *data,
4444  size_t data_length,
4445  Callback callback) {
4446  if (decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_SUCCESS ||
4447  decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_ERROR) {
4448  return 0;
4449  }
4450 
4451  auto next_in = reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(data);
4452  size_t avail_in = data_length;
4453  size_t total_out;
4454 
4455  decoder_r = BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_NEEDS_MORE_OUTPUT;
4456 
4457  std::array<char, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4458  while (decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_NEEDS_MORE_OUTPUT) {
4459  char *next_out = buff.data();
4460  size_t avail_out = buff.size();
4461 
4462  decoder_r = BrotliDecoderDecompressStream(
4463  decoder_s, &avail_in, &next_in, &avail_out,
4464  reinterpret_cast<uint8_t **>(&next_out), &total_out);
4465 
4466  if (decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_ERROR) { return false; }
4467 
4468  if (!callback(buff.data(), buff.size() - avail_out)) { return false; }
4469  }
4470 
4471  return decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_SUCCESS ||
4472  decoder_r == BROTLI_DECODER_RESULT_NEEDS_MORE_INPUT;
4473 }
4474 #endif
4475 
4476 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZSTD_SUPPORT
4477 inline zstd_compressor::zstd_compressor() {
4478  ctx_ = ZSTD_createCCtx();
4479  ZSTD_CCtx_setParameter(ctx_, ZSTD_c_compressionLevel, ZSTD_fast);
4480 }
4481 
4482 inline zstd_compressor::~zstd_compressor() { ZSTD_freeCCtx(ctx_); }
4483 
4484 inline bool zstd_compressor::compress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4485  bool last, Callback callback) {
4486  std::array<char, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4487 
4488  ZSTD_EndDirective mode = last ? ZSTD_e_end : ZSTD_e_continue;
4489  ZSTD_inBuffer input = {data, data_length, 0};
4490 
4491  bool finished;
4492  do {
4493  ZSTD_outBuffer output = {buff.data(), CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ, 0};
4494  size_t const remaining = ZSTD_compressStream2(ctx_, &output, &input, mode);
4495 
4496  if (ZSTD_isError(remaining)) { return false; }
4497 
4498  if (!callback(buff.data(), output.pos)) { return false; }
4499 
4500  finished = last ? (remaining == 0) : (input.pos == input.size);
4501 
4502  } while (!finished);
4503 
4504  return true;
4505 }
4506 
4507 inline zstd_decompressor::zstd_decompressor() { ctx_ = ZSTD_createDCtx(); }
4508 
4509 inline zstd_decompressor::~zstd_decompressor() { ZSTD_freeDCtx(ctx_); }
4510 
4511 inline bool zstd_decompressor::is_valid() const { return ctx_ != nullptr; }
4512 
4513 inline bool zstd_decompressor::decompress(const char *data, size_t data_length,
4514  Callback callback) {
4515  std::array<char, CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ> buff{};
4516  ZSTD_inBuffer input = {data, data_length, 0};
4517 
4518  while (input.pos < input.size) {
4519  ZSTD_outBuffer output = {buff.data(), CPPHTTPLIB_COMPRESSION_BUFSIZ, 0};
4520  size_t const remaining = ZSTD_decompressStream(ctx_, &output, &input);
4521 
4522  if (ZSTD_isError(remaining)) { return false; }
4523 
4524  if (!callback(buff.data(), output.pos)) { return false; }
4525  }
4526 
4527  return true;
4528 }
4529 #endif
4530 
4531 inline bool has_header(const Headers &headers, const std::string &key) {
4532  return headers.find(key) != headers.end();
4533 }
4534 
4535 inline const char *get_header_value(const Headers &headers,
4536  const std::string &key, const char *def,
4537  size_t id) {
4538  auto rng = headers.equal_range(key);
4539  auto it = rng.first;
4540  std::advance(it, static_cast<ssize_t>(id));
4541  if (it != rng.second) { return it->second.c_str(); }
4542  return def;
4543 }
4544 
4545 template <typename T>
4546 inline bool parse_header(const char *beg, const char *end, T fn) {
4547  // Skip trailing spaces and tabs.
4548  while (beg < end && is_space_or_tab(end[-1])) {
4549  end--;
4550  }
4551 
4552  auto p = beg;
4553  while (p < end && *p != ':') {
4554  p++;
4555  }
4556 
4557  auto name = std::string(beg, p);
4558  if (!detail::fields::is_field_name(name)) { return false; }
4559 
4560  if (p == end) { return false; }
4561 
4562  auto key_end = p;
4563 
4564  if (*p++ != ':') { return false; }
4565 
4566  while (p < end && is_space_or_tab(*p)) {
4567  p++;
4568  }
4569 
4570  if (p <= end) {
4571  auto key_len = key_end - beg;
4572  if (!key_len) { return false; }
4573 
4574  auto key = std::string(beg, key_end);
4575  auto val = std::string(p, end);
4576 
4577  if (!detail::fields::is_field_value(val)) { return false; }
4578 
4579  if (case_ignore::equal(key, "Location") ||
4580  case_ignore::equal(key, "Referer")) {
4581  fn(key, val);
4582  } else {
4583  fn(key, decode_path_component(val));
4584  }
4585 
4586  return true;
4587  }
4588 
4589  return false;
4590 }
4591 
4592 inline bool read_headers(Stream &strm, Headers &headers) {
4593  const auto bufsiz = 2048;
4594  char buf[bufsiz];
4595  stream_line_reader line_reader(strm, buf, bufsiz);
4596 
4597  size_t header_count = 0;
4598 
4599  for (;;) {
4600  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return false; }
4601 
4602  // Check if the line ends with CRLF.
4603  auto line_terminator_len = 2;
4604  if (line_reader.end_with_crlf()) {
4605  // Blank line indicates end of headers.
4606  if (line_reader.size() == 2) { break; }
4607  } else {
4608 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ALLOW_LF_AS_LINE_TERMINATOR
4609  // Blank line indicates end of headers.
4610  if (line_reader.size() == 1) { break; }
4611  line_terminator_len = 1;
4612 #else
4613  continue; // Skip invalid line.
4614 #endif
4615  }
4616 
4617  if (line_reader.size() > CPPHTTPLIB_HEADER_MAX_LENGTH) { return false; }
4618 
4619  // Check header count limit
4620  if (header_count >= CPPHTTPLIB_HEADER_MAX_COUNT) { return false; }
4621 
4622  // Exclude line terminator
4623  auto end = line_reader.ptr() + line_reader.size() - line_terminator_len;
4624 
4625  if (!parse_header(line_reader.ptr(), end,
4626  [&](const std::string &key, const std::string &val) {
4627  headers.emplace(key, val);
4628  })) {
4629  return false;
4630  }
4631 
4632  header_count++;
4633  }
4634 
4635  return true;
4636 }
4637 
4638 inline bool read_content_with_length(Stream &strm, size_t len,
4639  DownloadProgress progress,
4640  ContentReceiverWithProgress out) {
4641  char buf[CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ];
4642 
4643  size_t r = 0;
4644  while (r < len) {
4645  auto read_len = static_cast<size_t>(len - r);
4646  auto n = strm.read(buf, (std::min)(read_len, CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ));
4647  if (n <= 0) { return false; }
4648 
4649  if (!out(buf, static_cast<size_t>(n), r, len)) { return false; }
4650  r += static_cast<size_t>(n);
4651 
4652  if (progress) {
4653  if (!progress(r, len)) { return false; }
4654  }
4655  }
4656 
4657  return true;
4658 }
4659 
4660 inline void skip_content_with_length(Stream &strm, size_t len) {
4661  char buf[CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ];
4662  size_t r = 0;
4663  while (r < len) {
4664  auto read_len = static_cast<size_t>(len - r);
4665  auto n = strm.read(buf, (std::min)(read_len, CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ));
4666  if (n <= 0) { return; }
4667  r += static_cast<size_t>(n);
4668  }
4669 }
4670 
4671 enum class ReadContentResult {
4672  Success, // Successfully read the content
4673  PayloadTooLarge, // The content exceeds the specified payload limit
4674  Error // An error occurred while reading the content
4675 };
4676 
4677 inline ReadContentResult
4678 read_content_without_length(Stream &strm, size_t payload_max_length,
4679  ContentReceiverWithProgress out) {
4680  char buf[CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ];
4681  size_t r = 0;
4682  for (;;) {
4683  auto n = strm.read(buf, CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_BUFSIZ);
4684  if (n == 0) { return ReadContentResult::Success; }
4685  if (n < 0) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4686 
4687  // Check if adding this data would exceed the payload limit
4688  if (r > payload_max_length ||
4689  payload_max_length - r < static_cast<size_t>(n)) {
4690  return ReadContentResult::PayloadTooLarge;
4691  }
4692 
4693  if (!out(buf, static_cast<size_t>(n), r, 0)) {
4694  return ReadContentResult::Error;
4695  }
4696  r += static_cast<size_t>(n);
4697  }
4698 
4699  return ReadContentResult::Success;
4700 }
4701 
4702 template <typename T>
4703 inline ReadContentResult read_content_chunked(Stream &strm, T &x,
4704  size_t payload_max_length,
4705  ContentReceiverWithProgress out) {
4706  const auto bufsiz = 16;
4707  char buf[bufsiz];
4708 
4709  stream_line_reader line_reader(strm, buf, bufsiz);
4710 
4711  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4712 
4713  unsigned long chunk_len;
4714  size_t total_len = 0;
4715  while (true) {
4716  char *end_ptr;
4717 
4718  chunk_len = std::strtoul(line_reader.ptr(), &end_ptr, 16);
4719 
4720  if (end_ptr == line_reader.ptr()) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4721  if (chunk_len == ULONG_MAX) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4722 
4723  if (chunk_len == 0) { break; }
4724 
4725  // Check if adding this chunk would exceed the payload limit
4726  if (total_len > payload_max_length ||
4727  payload_max_length - total_len < chunk_len) {
4728  return ReadContentResult::PayloadTooLarge;
4729  }
4730 
4731  total_len += chunk_len;
4732 
4733  if (!read_content_with_length(strm, chunk_len, nullptr, out)) {
4734  return ReadContentResult::Error;
4735  }
4736 
4737  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4738 
4739  if (strcmp(line_reader.ptr(), "\r\n") != 0) {
4740  return ReadContentResult::Error;
4741  }
4742 
4743  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4744  }
4745 
4746  assert(chunk_len == 0);
4747 
4748  // NOTE: In RFC 9112, '7.1 Chunked Transfer Coding' mentions "The chunked
4749  // transfer coding is complete when a chunk with a chunk-size of zero is
4750  // received, possibly followed by a trailer section, and finally terminated by
4751  // an empty line". https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9112.html#section-7.1
4752  //
4753  // In '7.1.3. Decoding Chunked', however, the pseudo-code in the section
4754  // does't care for the existence of the final CRLF. In other words, it seems
4755  // to be ok whether the final CRLF exists or not in the chunked data.
4756  // https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9112.html#section-7.1.3
4757  //
4758  // According to the reference code in RFC 9112, cpp-httplib now allows
4759  // chunked transfer coding data without the final CRLF.
4760  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return ReadContentResult::Success; }
4761 
4762  // RFC 7230 Section 4.1.2 - Headers prohibited in trailers
4763  thread_local case_ignore::unordered_set<std::string> prohibited_trailers = {
4764  // Message framing
4765  "transfer-encoding", "content-length",
4766 
4767  // Routing
4768  "host",
4769 
4770  // Authentication
4771  "authorization", "www-authenticate", "proxy-authenticate",
4772  "proxy-authorization", "cookie", "set-cookie",
4773 
4774  // Request modifiers
4775  "cache-control", "expect", "max-forwards", "pragma", "range", "te",
4776 
4777  // Response control
4778  "age", "expires", "date", "location", "retry-after", "vary", "warning",
4779 
4780  // Payload processing
4781  "content-encoding", "content-type", "content-range", "trailer"};
4782 
4783  // Parse declared trailer headers once for performance
4784  case_ignore::unordered_set<std::string> declared_trailers;
4785  if (has_header(x.headers, "Trailer")) {
4786  auto trailer_header = get_header_value(x.headers, "Trailer", "", 0);
4787  auto len = std::strlen(trailer_header);
4788 
4789  split(trailer_header, trailer_header + len, ',',
4790  [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
4791  std::string key(b, e);
4792  if (prohibited_trailers.find(key) == prohibited_trailers.end()) {
4793  declared_trailers.insert(key);
4794  }
4795  });
4796  }
4797 
4798  size_t trailer_header_count = 0;
4799  while (strcmp(line_reader.ptr(), "\r\n") != 0) {
4800  if (line_reader.size() > CPPHTTPLIB_HEADER_MAX_LENGTH) {
4801  return ReadContentResult::Error;
4802  }
4803 
4804  // Check trailer header count limit
4805  if (trailer_header_count >= CPPHTTPLIB_HEADER_MAX_COUNT) {
4806  return ReadContentResult::Error;
4807  }
4808 
4809  // Exclude line terminator
4810  constexpr auto line_terminator_len = 2;
4811  auto end = line_reader.ptr() + line_reader.size() - line_terminator_len;
4812 
4813  parse_header(line_reader.ptr(), end,
4814  [&](const std::string &key, const std::string &val) {
4815  if (declared_trailers.find(key) != declared_trailers.end()) {
4816  x.trailers.emplace(key, val);
4817  trailer_header_count++;
4818  }
4819  });
4820 
4821  if (!line_reader.getline()) { return ReadContentResult::Error; }
4822  }
4823 
4824  return ReadContentResult::Success;
4825 }
4826 
4827 inline bool is_chunked_transfer_encoding(const Headers &headers) {
4828  return case_ignore::equal(
4829  get_header_value(headers, "Transfer-Encoding", "", 0), "chunked");
4830 }
4831 
4832 template <typename T, typename U>
4833 bool prepare_content_receiver(T &x, int &status,
4834  ContentReceiverWithProgress receiver,
4835  bool decompress, U callback) {
4836  if (decompress) {
4837  std::string encoding = x.get_header_value("Content-Encoding");
4838  std::unique_ptr<decompressor> decompressor;
4839 
4840  if (encoding == "gzip" || encoding == "deflate") {
4841 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZLIB_SUPPORT
4842  decompressor = detail::make_unique<gzip_decompressor>();
4843 #else
4844  status = StatusCode::UnsupportedMediaType_415;
4845  return false;
4846 #endif
4847  } else if (encoding.find("br") != std::string::npos) {
4848 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_BROTLI_SUPPORT
4849  decompressor = detail::make_unique<brotli_decompressor>();
4850 #else
4851  status = StatusCode::UnsupportedMediaType_415;
4852  return false;
4853 #endif
4854  } else if (encoding == "zstd") {
4855 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_ZSTD_SUPPORT
4856  decompressor = detail::make_unique<zstd_decompressor>();
4857 #else
4858  status = StatusCode::UnsupportedMediaType_415;
4859  return false;
4860 #endif
4861  }
4862 
4863  if (decompressor) {
4864  if (decompressor->is_valid()) {
4865  ContentReceiverWithProgress out = [&](const char *buf, size_t n,
4866  size_t off, size_t len) {
4867  return decompressor->decompress(buf, n,
4868  [&](const char *buf2, size_t n2) {
4869  return receiver(buf2, n2, off, len);
4870  });
4871  };
4872  return callback(std::move(out));
4873  } else {
4874  status = StatusCode::InternalServerError_500;
4875  return false;
4876  }
4877  }
4878  }
4879 
4880  ContentReceiverWithProgress out = [&](const char *buf, size_t n, size_t off,
4881  size_t len) {
4882  return receiver(buf, n, off, len);
4883  };
4884  return callback(std::move(out));
4885 }
4886 
4887 template <typename T>
4888 bool read_content(Stream &strm, T &x, size_t payload_max_length, int &status,
4889  DownloadProgress progress,
4890  ContentReceiverWithProgress receiver, bool decompress) {
4891  return prepare_content_receiver(
4892  x, status, std::move(receiver), decompress,
4893  [&](const ContentReceiverWithProgress &out) {
4894  auto ret = true;
4895  auto exceed_payload_max_length = false;
4896 
4897  if (is_chunked_transfer_encoding(x.headers)) {
4898  auto result = read_content_chunked(strm, x, payload_max_length, out);
4899  if (result == ReadContentResult::Success) {
4900  ret = true;
4901  } else if (result == ReadContentResult::PayloadTooLarge) {
4902  exceed_payload_max_length = true;
4903  ret = false;
4904  } else {
4905  ret = false;
4906  }
4907  } else if (!has_header(x.headers, "Content-Length")) {
4908  auto result =
4909  read_content_without_length(strm, payload_max_length, out);
4910  if (result == ReadContentResult::Success) {
4911  ret = true;
4912  } else if (result == ReadContentResult::PayloadTooLarge) {
4913  exceed_payload_max_length = true;
4914  ret = false;
4915  } else {
4916  ret = false;
4917  }
4918  } else {
4919  auto is_invalid_value = false;
4920  auto len = get_header_value_u64(x.headers, "Content-Length",
4921  (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max)(),
4922  0, is_invalid_value);
4923 
4924  if (is_invalid_value) {
4925  ret = false;
4926  } else if (len > payload_max_length) {
4927  exceed_payload_max_length = true;
4928  skip_content_with_length(strm, len);
4929  ret = false;
4930  } else if (len > 0) {
4931  ret = read_content_with_length(strm, len, std::move(progress), out);
4932  }
4933  }
4934 
4935  if (!ret) {
4936  status = exceed_payload_max_length ? StatusCode::PayloadTooLarge_413
4937  : StatusCode::BadRequest_400;
4938  }
4939  return ret;
4940  });
4941 }
4942 
4943 inline ssize_t write_request_line(Stream &strm, const std::string &method,
4944  const std::string &path) {
4945  std::string s = method;
4946  s += " ";
4947  s += path;
4948  s += " HTTP/1.1\r\n";
4949  return strm.write(s.data(), s.size());
4950 }
4951 
4952 inline ssize_t write_response_line(Stream &strm, int status) {
4953  std::string s = "HTTP/1.1 ";
4954  s += std::to_string(status);
4955  s += " ";
4956  s += httplib::status_message(status);
4957  s += "\r\n";
4958  return strm.write(s.data(), s.size());
4959 }
4960 
4961 inline ssize_t write_headers(Stream &strm, const Headers &headers) {
4962  ssize_t write_len = 0;
4963  for (const auto &x : headers) {
4964  std::string s;
4965  s = x.first;
4966  s += ": ";
4967  s += x.second;
4968  s += "\r\n";
4969 
4970  auto len = strm.write(s.data(), s.size());
4971  if (len < 0) { return len; }
4972  write_len += len;
4973  }
4974  auto len = strm.write("\r\n");
4975  if (len < 0) { return len; }
4976  write_len += len;
4977  return write_len;
4978 }
4979 
4980 inline bool write_data(Stream &strm, const char *d, size_t l) {
4981  size_t offset = 0;
4982  while (offset < l) {
4983  auto length = strm.write(d + offset, l - offset);
4984  if (length < 0) { return false; }
4985  offset += static_cast<size_t>(length);
4986  }
4987  return true;
4988 }
4989 
4990 template <typename T>
4991 inline bool write_content_with_progress(Stream &strm,
4992  const ContentProvider &content_provider,
4993  size_t offset, size_t length,
4994  T is_shutting_down,
4995  const UploadProgress &upload_progress,
4996  Error &error) {
4997  size_t end_offset = offset + length;
4998  size_t start_offset = offset;
4999  auto ok = true;
5000  DataSink data_sink;
5001 
5002  data_sink.write = [&](const char *d, size_t l) -> bool {
5003  if (ok) {
5004  if (write_data(strm, d, l)) {
5005  offset += l;
5006 
5007  if (upload_progress && length > 0) {
5008  size_t current_written = offset - start_offset;
5009  if (!upload_progress(current_written, length)) {
5010  ok = false;
5011  return false;
5012  }
5013  }
5014  } else {
5015  ok = false;
5016  }
5017  }
5018  return ok;
5019  };
5020 
5021  data_sink.is_writable = [&]() -> bool { return strm.wait_writable(); };
5022 
5023  while (offset < end_offset && !is_shutting_down()) {
5024  if (!strm.wait_writable()) {
5025  error = Error::Write;
5026  return false;
5027  } else if (!content_provider(offset, end_offset - offset, data_sink)) {
5028  error = Error::Canceled;
5029  return false;
5030  } else if (!ok) {
5031  error = Error::Write;
5032  return false;
5033  }
5034  }
5035 
5036  error = Error::Success;
5037  return true;
5038 }
5039 
5040 template <typename T>
5041 inline bool write_content(Stream &strm, const ContentProvider &content_provider,
5042  size_t offset, size_t length, T is_shutting_down,
5043  Error &error) {
5044  return write_content_with_progress<T>(strm, content_provider, offset, length,
5045  is_shutting_down, nullptr, error);
5046 }
5047 
5048 template <typename T>
5049 inline bool write_content(Stream &strm, const ContentProvider &content_provider,
5050  size_t offset, size_t length,
5051  const T &is_shutting_down) {
5052  auto error = Error::Success;
5053  return write_content(strm, content_provider, offset, length, is_shutting_down,
5054  error);
5055 }
5056 
5057 template <typename T>
5058 inline bool
5059 write_content_without_length(Stream &strm,
5060  const ContentProvider &content_provider,
5061  const T &is_shutting_down) {
5062  size_t offset = 0;
5063  auto data_available = true;
5064  auto ok = true;
5065  DataSink data_sink;
5066 
5067  data_sink.write = [&](const char *d, size_t l) -> bool {
5068  if (ok) {
5069  offset += l;
5070  if (!write_data(strm, d, l)) { ok = false; }
5071  }
5072  return ok;
5073  };
5074 
5075  data_sink.is_writable = [&]() -> bool { return strm.wait_writable(); };
5076 
5077  data_sink.done = [&](void) { data_available = false; };
5078 
5079  while (data_available && !is_shutting_down()) {
5080  if (!strm.wait_writable()) {
5081  return false;
5082  } else if (!content_provider(offset, 0, data_sink)) {
5083  return false;
5084  } else if (!ok) {
5085  return false;
5086  }
5087  }
5088  return true;
5089 }
5090 
5091 template <typename T, typename U>
5092 inline bool
5093 write_content_chunked(Stream &strm, const ContentProvider &content_provider,
