5094  const T &is_shutting_down, U &compressor, Error &error) {
5095  size_t offset = 0;
5096  auto data_available = true;
5097  auto ok = true;
5098  DataSink data_sink;
5099 
5100  data_sink.write = [&](const char *d, size_t l) -> bool {
5101  if (ok) {
5102  data_available = l > 0;
5103  offset += l;
5104 
5105  std::string payload;
5106  if (compressor.compress(d, l, false,
5107  [&](const char *data, size_t data_len) {
5108  payload.append(data, data_len);
5109  return true;
5110  })) {
5111  if (!payload.empty()) {
5112  // Emit chunked response header and footer for each chunk
5113  auto chunk =
5114  from_i_to_hex(payload.size()) + "\r\n" + payload + "\r\n";
5115  if (!write_data(strm, chunk.data(), chunk.size())) { ok = false; }
5116  }
5117  } else {
5118  ok = false;
5119  }
5120  }
5121  return ok;
5122  };
5123 
5124  data_sink.is_writable = [&]() -> bool { return strm.wait_writable(); };
5125 
5126  auto done_with_trailer = [&](const Headers *trailer) {
5127  if (!ok) { return; }
5128 
5129  data_available = false;
5130 
5131  std::string payload;
5132  if (!compressor.compress(nullptr, 0, true,
5133  [&](const char *data, size_t data_len) {
5134  payload.append(data, data_len);
5135  return true;
5136  })) {
5137  ok = false;
5138  return;
5139  }
5140 
5141  if (!payload.empty()) {
5142  // Emit chunked response header and footer for each chunk
5143  auto chunk = from_i_to_hex(payload.size()) + "\r\n" + payload + "\r\n";
5144  if (!write_data(strm, chunk.data(), chunk.size())) {
5145  ok = false;
5146  return;
5147  }
5148  }
5149 
5150  constexpr const char done_marker[] = "0\r\n";
5151  if (!write_data(strm, done_marker, str_len(done_marker))) { ok = false; }
5152 
5153  // Trailer
5154  if (trailer) {
5155  for (const auto &kv : *trailer) {
5156  std::string field_line = kv.first + ": " + kv.second + "\r\n";
5157  if (!write_data(strm, field_line.data(), field_line.size())) {
5158  ok = false;
5159  }
5160  }
5161  }
5162 
5163  constexpr const char crlf[] = "\r\n";
5164  if (!write_data(strm, crlf, str_len(crlf))) { ok = false; }
5165  };
5166 
5167  data_sink.done = [&](void) { done_with_trailer(nullptr); };
5168 
5169  data_sink.done_with_trailer = [&](const Headers &trailer) {
5170  done_with_trailer(&trailer);
5171  };
5172 
5173  while (data_available && !is_shutting_down()) {
5174  if (!strm.wait_writable()) {
5175  error = Error::Write;
5176  return false;
5177  } else if (!content_provider(offset, 0, data_sink)) {
5178  error = Error::Canceled;
5179  return false;
5180  } else if (!ok) {
5181  error = Error::Write;
5182  return false;
5183  }
5184  }
5185 
5186  error = Error::Success;
5187  return true;
5188 }
5189 
5190 template <typename T, typename U>
5191 inline bool write_content_chunked(Stream &strm,
5192  const ContentProvider &content_provider,
5193  const T &is_shutting_down, U &compressor) {
5194  auto error = Error::Success;
5195  return write_content_chunked(strm, content_provider, is_shutting_down,
5196  compressor, error);
5197 }
5198 
5199 template <typename T>
5200 inline bool redirect(T &cli, Request &req, Response &res,
5201  const std::string &path, const std::string &location,
5202  Error &error) {
5203  Request new_req = req;
5204  new_req.path = path;
5205  new_req.redirect_count_ -= 1;
5206 
5207  if (res.status == StatusCode::SeeOther_303 &&
5208  (req.method != "GET" && req.method != "HEAD")) {
5209  new_req.method = "GET";
5210  new_req.body.clear();
5211  new_req.headers.clear();
5212  }
5213 
5214  Response new_res;
5215 
5216  auto ret = cli.send(new_req, new_res, error);
5217  if (ret) {
5218  req = new_req;
5219  res = new_res;
5220 
5221  if (res.location.empty()) { res.location = location; }
5222  }
5223  return ret;
5224 }
5225 
5226 inline std::string params_to_query_str(const Params &params) {
5227  std::string query;
5228 
5229  for (auto it = params.begin(); it != params.end(); ++it) {
5230  if (it != params.begin()) { query += "&"; }
5231  query += encode_query_component(it->first);
5232  query += "=";
5233  query += encode_query_component(it->second);
5234  }
5235  return query;
5236 }
5237 
5238 inline void parse_query_text(const char *data, std::size_t size,
5239  Params &params) {
5240  std::set<std::string> cache;
5241  split(data, data + size, '&', [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
5242  std::string kv(b, e);
5243  if (cache.find(kv) != cache.end()) { return; }
5244  cache.insert(std::move(kv));
5245 
5246  std::string key;
5247  std::string val;
5248  divide(b, static_cast<std::size_t>(e - b), '=',
5249  [&](const char *lhs_data, std::size_t lhs_size, const char *rhs_data,
5250  std::size_t rhs_size) {
5251  key.assign(lhs_data, lhs_size);
5252  val.assign(rhs_data, rhs_size);
5253  });
5254 
5255  if (!key.empty()) {
5256  params.emplace(decode_query_component(key), decode_query_component(val));
5257  }
5258  });
5259 }
5260 
5261 inline void parse_query_text(const std::string &s, Params &params) {
5262  parse_query_text(s.data(), s.size(), params);
5263 }
5264 
5265 inline bool parse_multipart_boundary(const std::string &content_type,
5266  std::string &boundary) {
5267  auto boundary_keyword = "boundary=";
5268  auto pos = content_type.find(boundary_keyword);
5269  if (pos == std::string::npos) { return false; }
5270  auto end = content_type.find(';', pos);
5271  auto beg = pos + strlen(boundary_keyword);
5272  boundary = trim_double_quotes_copy(content_type.substr(beg, end - beg));
5273  return !boundary.empty();
5274 }
5275 
5276 inline void parse_disposition_params(const std::string &s, Params &params) {
5277  std::set<std::string> cache;
5278  split(s.data(), s.data() + s.size(), ';', [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
5279  std::string kv(b, e);
5280  if (cache.find(kv) != cache.end()) { return; }
5281  cache.insert(kv);
5282 
5283  std::string key;
5284  std::string val;
5285  split(b, e, '=', [&](const char *b2, const char *e2) {
5286  if (key.empty()) {
5287  key.assign(b2, e2);
5288  } else {
5289  val.assign(b2, e2);
5290  }
5291  });
5292 
5293  if (!key.empty()) {
5294  params.emplace(trim_double_quotes_copy((key)),
5295  trim_double_quotes_copy((val)));
5296  }
5297  });
5298 }
5299 
5300 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5301 inline bool parse_range_header(const std::string &s, Ranges &ranges) {
5302 #else
5303 inline bool parse_range_header(const std::string &s, Ranges &ranges) try {
5304 #endif
5305  auto is_valid = [](const std::string &str) {
5306  return std::all_of(str.cbegin(), str.cend(),
5307  [](unsigned char c) { return std::isdigit(c); });
5308  };
5309 
5310  if (s.size() > 7 && s.compare(0, 6, "bytes=") == 0) {
5311  const auto pos = static_cast<size_t>(6);
5312  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(s.size() - 6);
5313  auto all_valid_ranges = true;
5314  split(&s[pos], &s[pos + len], ',', [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
5315  if (!all_valid_ranges) { return; }
5316 
5317  const auto it = std::find(b, e, '-');
5318  if (it == e) {
5319  all_valid_ranges = false;
5320  return;
5321  }
5322 
5323  const auto lhs = std::string(b, it);
5324  const auto rhs = std::string(it + 1, e);
5325  if (!is_valid(lhs) || !is_valid(rhs)) {
5326  all_valid_ranges = false;
5327  return;
5328  }
5329 
5330  const auto first =
5331  static_cast<ssize_t>(lhs.empty() ? -1 : std::stoll(lhs));
5332  const auto last =
5333  static_cast<ssize_t>(rhs.empty() ? -1 : std::stoll(rhs));
5334  if ((first == -1 && last == -1) ||
5335  (first != -1 && last != -1 && first > last)) {
5336  all_valid_ranges = false;
5337  return;
5338  }
5339 
5340  ranges.emplace_back(first, last);
5341  });
5342  return all_valid_ranges && !ranges.empty();
5343  }
5344  return false;
5345 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5346 }
5347 #else
5348 } catch (...) { return false; }
5349 #endif
5350 
5351 inline bool parse_accept_header(const std::string &s,
5352  std::vector<std::string> &content_types) {
5353  content_types.clear();
5354 
5355  // Empty string is considered valid (no preference)
5356  if (s.empty()) { return true; }
5357 
5358  // Check for invalid patterns: leading/trailing commas or consecutive commas
5359  if (s.front() == ',' || s.back() == ',' ||
5360  s.find(",,") != std::string::npos) {
5361  return false;
5362  }
5363 
5364  struct AcceptEntry {
5365  std::string media_type;
5366  double quality;
5367  int order; // Original order in header
5368  };
5369 
5370  std::vector<AcceptEntry> entries;
5371  int order = 0;
5372  bool has_invalid_entry = false;
5373 
5374  // Split by comma and parse each entry
5375  split(s.data(), s.data() + s.size(), ',', [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
5376  std::string entry(b, e);
5377  entry = trim_copy(entry);
5378 
5379  if (entry.empty()) {
5380  has_invalid_entry = true;
5381  return;
5382  }
5383 
5384  AcceptEntry accept_entry;
5385  accept_entry.quality = 1.0; // Default quality
5386  accept_entry.order = order++;
5387 
5388  // Find q= parameter
5389  auto q_pos = entry.find(";q=");
5390  if (q_pos == std::string::npos) { q_pos = entry.find("; q="); }
5391 
5392  if (q_pos != std::string::npos) {
5393  // Extract media type (before q parameter)
5394  accept_entry.media_type = trim_copy(entry.substr(0, q_pos));
5395 
5396  // Extract quality value
5397  auto q_start = entry.find('=', q_pos) + 1;
5398  auto q_end = entry.find(';', q_start);
5399  if (q_end == std::string::npos) { q_end = entry.length(); }
5400 
5401  std::string quality_str =
5402  trim_copy(entry.substr(q_start, q_end - q_start));
5403  if (quality_str.empty()) {
5404  has_invalid_entry = true;
5405  return;
5406  }
5407 
5408 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
5409  {
5410  std::istringstream iss(quality_str);
5411  iss >> accept_entry.quality;
5412 
5413  // Check if conversion was successful and entire string was consumed
5414  if (iss.fail() || !iss.eof()) {
5415  has_invalid_entry = true;
5416  return;
5417  }
5418  }
5419 #else
5420  try {
5421  accept_entry.quality = std::stod(quality_str);
5422  } catch (...) {
5423  has_invalid_entry = true;
5424  return;
5425  }
5426 #endif
5427  // Check if quality is in valid range [0.0, 1.0]
5428  if (accept_entry.quality < 0.0 || accept_entry.quality > 1.0) {
5429  has_invalid_entry = true;
5430  return;
5431  }
5432  } else {
5433  // No quality parameter, use entire entry as media type
5434  accept_entry.media_type = entry;
5435  }
5436 
5437  // Remove additional parameters from media type
5438  auto param_pos = accept_entry.media_type.find(';');
5439  if (param_pos != std::string::npos) {
5440  accept_entry.media_type =
5441  trim_copy(accept_entry.media_type.substr(0, param_pos));
5442  }
5443 
5444  // Basic validation of media type format
5445  if (accept_entry.media_type.empty()) {
5446  has_invalid_entry = true;
5447  return;
5448  }
5449 
5450  // Check for basic media type format (should contain '/' or be '*')
5451  if (accept_entry.media_type != "*" &&
5452  accept_entry.media_type.find('/') == std::string::npos) {
5453  has_invalid_entry = true;
5454  return;
5455  }
5456 
5457  entries.push_back(accept_entry);
5458  });
5459 
5460  // Return false if any invalid entry was found
5461  if (has_invalid_entry) { return false; }
5462 
5463  // Sort by quality (descending), then by original order (ascending)
5464  std::sort(entries.begin(), entries.end(),
5465  [](const AcceptEntry &a, const AcceptEntry &b) {
5466  if (a.quality != b.quality) {
5467  return a.quality > b.quality; // Higher quality first
5468  }
5469  return a.order < b.order; // Earlier order first for same quality
5470  });
5471 
5472  // Extract sorted media types
5473  content_types.reserve(entries.size());
5474  for (const auto &entry : entries) {
5475  content_types.push_back(entry.media_type);
5476  }
5477 
5478  return true;
5479 }
5480 
5481 class FormDataParser {
5482 public:
5483  FormDataParser() = default;
5484 
5485  void set_boundary(std::string &&boundary) {
5486  boundary_ = boundary;
5487  dash_boundary_crlf_ = dash_ + boundary_ + crlf_;
5488  crlf_dash_boundary_ = crlf_ + dash_ + boundary_;
5489  }
5490 
5491  bool is_valid() const { return is_valid_; }
5492 
5493  bool parse(const char *buf, size_t n, const FormDataHeader &header_callback,
5494  const ContentReceiver &content_callback) {
5495 
5496  buf_append(buf, n);
5497 
5498  while (buf_size() > 0) {
5499  switch (state_) {
5500  case 0: { // Initial boundary
5501  auto pos = buf_find(dash_boundary_crlf_);
5502  if (pos == buf_size()) { return true; }
5503  buf_erase(pos + dash_boundary_crlf_.size());
5504  state_ = 1;
5505  break;
5506  }
5507  case 1: { // New entry
5508  clear_file_info();
5509  state_ = 2;
5510  break;
5511  }
5512  case 2: { // Headers
5513  auto pos = buf_find(crlf_);
5514  if (pos > CPPHTTPLIB_HEADER_MAX_LENGTH) { return false; }
5515  while (pos < buf_size()) {
5516  // Empty line
5517  if (pos == 0) {
5518  if (!header_callback(file_)) {
5519  is_valid_ = false;
5520  return false;
5521  }
5522  buf_erase(crlf_.size());
5523  state_ = 3;
5524  break;
5525  }
5526 
5527  const auto header = buf_head(pos);
5528 
5529  if (!parse_header(header.data(), header.data() + header.size(),
5530  [&](const std::string &, const std::string &) {})) {
5531  is_valid_ = false;
5532  return false;
5533  }
5534 
5535  // Parse and emplace space trimmed headers into a map
5536  if (!parse_header(
5537  header.data(), header.data() + header.size(),
5538  [&](const std::string &key, const std::string &val) {
5539  file_.headers.emplace(key, val);
5540  })) {
5541  is_valid_ = false;
5542  return false;
5543  }
5544 
5545  constexpr const char header_content_type[] = "Content-Type:";
5546 
5547  if (start_with_case_ignore(header, header_content_type)) {
5548  file_.content_type =
5549  trim_copy(header.substr(str_len(header_content_type)));
5550  } else {
5551  thread_local const std::regex re_content_disposition(
5552  R"~(^Content-Disposition:\s*form-data;\s*(.*)$)~",
5553  std::regex_constants::icase);
5554 
5555  std::smatch m;
5556  if (std::regex_match(header, m, re_content_disposition)) {
5557  Params params;
5558  parse_disposition_params(m[1], params);
5559 
5560  auto it = params.find("name");
5561  if (it != params.end()) {
5562  file_.name = it->second;
5563  } else {
5564  is_valid_ = false;
5565  return false;
5566  }
5567 
5568  it = params.find("filename");
5569  if (it != params.end()) { file_.filename = it->second; }
5570 
5571  it = params.find("filename*");
5572  if (it != params.end()) {
5573  // Only allow UTF-8 encoding...
5574  thread_local const std::regex re_rfc5987_encoding(
5575  R"~(^UTF-8''(.+?)$)~", std::regex_constants::icase);
5576 
5577  std::smatch m2;
5578  if (std::regex_match(it->second, m2, re_rfc5987_encoding)) {
5579  file_.filename = decode_path_component(m2[1]); // override...
5580  } else {
5581  is_valid_ = false;
5582  return false;
5583  }
5584  }
5585  }
5586  }
5587  buf_erase(pos + crlf_.size());
5588  pos = buf_find(crlf_);
5589  }
5590  if (state_ != 3) { return true; }
5591  break;
5592  }
5593  case 3: { // Body
5594  if (crlf_dash_boundary_.size() > buf_size()) { return true; }
5595  auto pos = buf_find(crlf_dash_boundary_);
5596  if (pos < buf_size()) {
5597  if (!content_callback(buf_data(), pos)) {
5598  is_valid_ = false;
5599  return false;
5600  }
5601  buf_erase(pos + crlf_dash_boundary_.size());
5602  state_ = 4;
5603  } else {
5604  auto len = buf_size() - crlf_dash_boundary_.size();
5605  if (len > 0) {
5606  if (!content_callback(buf_data(), len)) {
5607  is_valid_ = false;
5608  return false;
5609  }
5610  buf_erase(len);
5611  }
5612  return true;
5613  }
5614  break;
5615  }
5616  case 4: { // Boundary
5617  if (crlf_.size() > buf_size()) { return true; }
5618  if (buf_start_with(crlf_)) {
5619  buf_erase(crlf_.size());
5620  state_ = 1;
5621  } else {
5622  if (dash_.size() > buf_size()) { return true; }
5623  if (buf_start_with(dash_)) {
5624  buf_erase(dash_.size());
5625  is_valid_ = true;
5626  buf_erase(buf_size()); // Remove epilogue
5627  } else {
5628  return true;
5629  }
5630  }
5631  break;
5632  }
5633  }
5634  }
5635 
5636  return true;
5637  }
5638 
5639 private:
5640  void clear_file_info() {
5641  file_.name.clear();
5642  file_.filename.clear();
5643  file_.content_type.clear();
5644  file_.headers.clear();
5645  }
5646 
5647  bool start_with_case_ignore(const std::string &a, const char *b) const {
5648  const auto b_len = strlen(b);
5649  if (a.size() < b_len) { return false; }
5650  for (size_t i = 0; i < b_len; i++) {
5651  if (case_ignore::to_lower(a[i]) != case_ignore::to_lower(b[i])) {
5652  return false;
5653  }
5654  }
5655  return true;
5656  }
5657 
5658  const std::string dash_ = "--";
5659  const std::string crlf_ = "\r\n";
5660  std::string boundary_;
5661  std::string dash_boundary_crlf_;
5662  std::string crlf_dash_boundary_;
5663 
5664  size_t state_ = 0;
5665  bool is_valid_ = false;
5666  FormData file_;
5667 
5668  // Buffer
5669  bool start_with(const std::string &a, size_t spos, size_t epos,
5670  const std::string &b) const {
5671  if (epos - spos < b.size()) { return false; }
5672  for (size_t i = 0; i < b.size(); i++) {
5673  if (a[i + spos] != b[i]) { return false; }
5674  }
5675  return true;
5676  }
5677 
5678  size_t buf_size() const { return buf_epos_ - buf_spos_; }
5679 
5680  const char *buf_data() const { return &buf_[buf_spos_]; }
5681 
5682  std::string buf_head(size_t l) const { return buf_.substr(buf_spos_, l); }
5683 
5684  bool buf_start_with(const std::string &s) const {
5685  return start_with(buf_, buf_spos_, buf_epos_, s);
5686  }
5687 
5688  size_t buf_find(const std::string &s) const {
5689  auto c = s.front();
5690 
5691  size_t off = buf_spos_;
5692  while (off < buf_epos_) {
5693  auto pos = off;
5694  while (true) {
5695  if (pos == buf_epos_) { return buf_size(); }
5696  if (buf_[pos] == c) { break; }
5697  pos++;
5698  }
5699 
5700  auto remaining_size = buf_epos_ - pos;
5701  if (s.size() > remaining_size) { return buf_size(); }
5702 
5703  if (start_with(buf_, pos, buf_epos_, s)) { return pos - buf_spos_; }
5704 
5705  off = pos + 1;
5706  }
5707 
5708  return buf_size();
5709  }
5710 
5711  void buf_append(const char *data, size_t n) {
5712  auto remaining_size = buf_size();
5713  if (remaining_size > 0 && buf_spos_ > 0) {
5714  for (size_t i = 0; i < remaining_size; i++) {
5715  buf_[i] = buf_[buf_spos_ + i];
5716  }
5717  }
5718  buf_spos_ = 0;
5719  buf_epos_ = remaining_size;
5720 
5721  if (remaining_size + n > buf_.size()) { buf_.resize(remaining_size + n); }
5722 
5723  for (size_t i = 0; i < n; i++) {
5724  buf_[buf_epos_ + i] = data[i];
5725  }
5726  buf_epos_ += n;
5727  }
5728 
5729  void buf_erase(size_t size) { buf_spos_ += size; }
5730 
5731  std::string buf_;
5732  size_t buf_spos_ = 0;
5733  size_t buf_epos_ = 0;
5734 };
5735 
5736 inline std::string random_string(size_t length) {
5737  constexpr const char data[] =
5738  "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";
5739 
5740  thread_local auto engine([]() {
5741  // std::random_device might actually be deterministic on some
5742  // platforms, but due to lack of support in the c++ standard library,
5743  // doing better requires either some ugly hacks or breaking portability.
5744  std::random_device seed_gen;
5745  // Request 128 bits of entropy for initialization
5746  std::seed_seq seed_sequence{seed_gen(), seed_gen(), seed_gen(), seed_gen()};
5747  return std::mt19937(seed_sequence);
5748  }());
5749 
5750  std::string result;
5751  for (size_t i = 0; i < length; i++) {
5752  result += data[engine() % (sizeof(data) - 1)];
5753  }
5754  return result;
5755 }
5756 
5757 inline std::string make_multipart_data_boundary() {
5758  return "--cpp-httplib-multipart-data-" + detail::random_string(16);
5759 }
5760 
5761 inline bool is_multipart_boundary_chars_valid(const std::string &boundary) {
5762  auto valid = true;
5763  for (size_t i = 0; i < boundary.size(); i++) {
5764  auto c = boundary[i];
5765  if (!std::isalnum(c) && c != '-' && c != '_') {
5766  valid = false;
5767  break;
5768  }
5769  }
5770  return valid;
5771 }
5772 
5773 template <typename T>
5774 inline std::string
5775 serialize_multipart_formdata_item_begin(const T &item,
5776  const std::string &boundary) {
5777  std::string body = "--" + boundary + "\r\n";
5778  body += "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"" + item.name + "\"";
5779  if (!item.filename.empty()) {
5780  body += "; filename=\"" + item.filename + "\"";
5781  }
5782  body += "\r\n";
5783  if (!item.content_type.empty()) {
5784  body += "Content-Type: " + item.content_type + "\r\n";
5785  }
5786  body += "\r\n";
5787 
5788  return body;
5789 }
5790 
5791 inline std::string serialize_multipart_formdata_item_end() { return "\r\n"; }
5792 
5793 inline std::string
5794 serialize_multipart_formdata_finish(const std::string &boundary) {
5795  return "--" + boundary + "--\r\n";
5796 }
5797 
5798 inline std::string
5799 serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(const std::string &boundary) {
5800  return "multipart/form-data; boundary=" + boundary;
5801 }
5802 
5803 inline std::string
5804 serialize_multipart_formdata(const UploadFormDataItems &items,
5805  const std::string &boundary, bool finish = true) {
5806  std::string body;
5807 
5808  for (const auto &item : items) {
5809  body += serialize_multipart_formdata_item_begin(item, boundary);
5810  body += item.content + serialize_multipart_formdata_item_end();
5811  }
5812 
5813  if (finish) { body += serialize_multipart_formdata_finish(boundary); }
5814 
5815  return body;
5816 }
5817 
5818 inline void coalesce_ranges(Ranges &ranges, size_t content_length) {
5819  if (ranges.size() <= 1) return;
5820 
5821  // Sort ranges by start position
5822  std::sort(ranges.begin(), ranges.end(),
5823  [](const Range &a, const Range &b) { return a.first < b.first; });
5824 
5825  Ranges coalesced;
5826  coalesced.reserve(ranges.size());
5827 
5828  for (auto &r : ranges) {
5829  auto first_pos = r.first;
5830  auto last_pos = r.second;
5831 
5832  // Handle special cases like in range_error
5833  if (first_pos == -1 && last_pos == -1) {
5834  first_pos = 0;
5835  last_pos = static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length);
5836  }
5837 
5838  if (first_pos == -1) {
5839  first_pos = static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length) - last_pos;
5840  last_pos = static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length) - 1;
5841  }
5842 
5843  if (last_pos == -1 || last_pos >= static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length)) {
5844  last_pos = static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length) - 1;
5845  }
5846 
5847  // Skip invalid ranges
5848  if (!(0 <= first_pos && first_pos <= last_pos &&
5849  last_pos < static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length))) {
5850  continue;
5851  }
5852 
5853  // Coalesce with previous range if overlapping or adjacent (but not
5854  // identical)
5855  if (!coalesced.empty()) {
5856  auto &prev = coalesced.back();
5857  // Check if current range overlaps or is adjacent to previous range
5858  // but don't coalesce identical ranges (allow duplicates)
5859  if (first_pos <= prev.second + 1 &&
5860  !(first_pos == prev.first && last_pos == prev.second)) {
5861  // Extend the previous range
5862  prev.second = (std::max)(prev.second, last_pos);
5863  continue;
5864  }
5865  }
5866 
5867  // Add new range
5868  coalesced.emplace_back(first_pos, last_pos);
5869  }
5870 
5871  ranges = std::move(coalesced);
5872 }
5873 
5874 inline bool range_error(Request &req, Response &res) {
5875  if (!req.ranges.empty() && 200 <= res.status && res.status < 300) {
5876  ssize_t content_len = static_cast<ssize_t>(
5877  res.content_length_ ? res.content_length_ : res.body.size());
5878 
5879  std::vector<std::pair<ssize_t, ssize_t>> processed_ranges;
5880  size_t overwrapping_count = 0;
5881 
5882  // NOTE: The following Range check is based on '14.2. Range' in RFC 9110
5883  // 'HTTP Semantics' to avoid potential denial-of-service attacks.
5884  // https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110#section-14.2
5885 
5886  // Too many ranges
5887  if (req.ranges.size() > CPPHTTPLIB_RANGE_MAX_COUNT) { return true; }
5888 
5889  for (auto &r : req.ranges) {
5890  auto &first_pos = r.first;
5891  auto &last_pos = r.second;
5892 
5893  if (first_pos == -1 && last_pos == -1) {
5894  first_pos = 0;
5895  last_pos = content_len;
5896  }
5897 
5898  if (first_pos == -1) {
5899  first_pos = content_len - last_pos;
5900  last_pos = content_len - 1;
5901  }
5902 
5903  // NOTE: RFC-9110 '14.1.2. Byte Ranges':
5904  // A client can limit the number of bytes requested without knowing the
5905  // size of the selected representation. If the last-pos value is absent,
5906  // or if the value is greater than or equal to the current length of the
5907  // representation data, the byte range is interpreted as the remainder of
5908  // the representation (i.e., the server replaces the value of last-pos
5909  // with a value that is one less than the current length of the selected
5910  // representation).
5911  // https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc9110.html#section-14.1.2-6
5912  if (last_pos == -1 || last_pos >= content_len) {
5913  last_pos = content_len - 1;
5914  }
5915 
5916  // Range must be within content length
5917  if (!(0 <= first_pos && first_pos <= last_pos &&
5918  last_pos <= content_len - 1)) {
5919  return true;
5920  }
5921 
5922  // Request must not have more than two overlapping ranges
5923  for (const auto &processed_range : processed_ranges) {
5924  if (!(last_pos < processed_range.first ||
5925  first_pos > processed_range.second)) {
5926  overwrapping_count++;
5927  if (overwrapping_count > 2) { return true; }
5928  break; // Only count once per range
5929  }
5930  }
5931 
5932  processed_ranges.emplace_back(first_pos, last_pos);
5933  }
5934 
5935  // After validation, coalesce overlapping ranges as per RFC 9110
5936  coalesce_ranges(req.ranges, static_cast<size_t>(content_len));
5937  }
5938 
5939  return false;
5940 }
5941 
5942 inline std::pair<size_t, size_t>
5943 get_range_offset_and_length(Range r, size_t content_length) {
5944  assert(r.first != -1 && r.second != -1);
5945  assert(0 <= r.first && r.first < static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length));
5946  assert(r.first <= r.second &&
5947  r.second < static_cast<ssize_t>(content_length));
5948  (void)(content_length);
5949  return std::make_pair(r.first, static_cast<size_t>(r.second - r.first) + 1);
5950 }
5951 
5952 inline std::string make_content_range_header_field(
5953  const std::pair<size_t, size_t> &offset_and_length, size_t content_length) {
5954  auto st = offset_and_length.first;
5955  auto ed = st + offset_and_length.second - 1;
5956 
5957  std::string field = "bytes ";
5958  field += std::to_string(st);
5959  field += "-";
5960  field += std::to_string(ed);
5961  field += "/";
5962  field += std::to_string(content_length);
5963  return field;
5964 }
5965 
5966 template <typename SToken, typename CToken, typename Content>
5967 bool process_multipart_ranges_data(const Request &req,
5968  const std::string &boundary,
5969  const std::string &content_type,
5970  size_t content_length, SToken stoken,
5971  CToken ctoken, Content content) {
5972  for (size_t i = 0; i < req.ranges.size(); i++) {
5973  ctoken("--");
5974  stoken(boundary);
5975  ctoken("\r\n");
5976  if (!content_type.empty()) {
5977  ctoken("Content-Type: ");
5978  stoken(content_type);
5979  ctoken("\r\n");
5980  }
5981 
5982  auto offset_and_length =
5983  get_range_offset_and_length(req.ranges[i], content_length);
5984 
5985  ctoken("Content-Range: ");
5986  stoken(make_content_range_header_field(offset_and_length, content_length));
5987  ctoken("\r\n");
5988  ctoken("\r\n");
5989 
5990  if (!content(offset_and_length.first, offset_and_length.second)) {
5991  return false;
5992  }
5993  ctoken("\r\n");
5994  }
5995 
5996  ctoken("--");
5997  stoken(boundary);
5998  ctoken("--");
5999 
6000  return true;
6001 }
6002 
6003 inline void make_multipart_ranges_data(const Request &req, Response &res,
6004  const std::string &boundary,
6005  const std::string &content_type,
6006  size_t content_length,
6007  std::string &data) {
6008  process_multipart_ranges_data(
6009  req, boundary, content_type, content_length,
6010  [&](const std::string &token) { data += token; },
6011  [&](const std::string &token) { data += token; },
6012  [&](size_t offset, size_t length) {
6013  assert(offset + length <= content_length);
6014  data += res.body.substr(offset, length);
6015  return true;
6016  });
6017 }
6018 
6019 inline size_t get_multipart_ranges_data_length(const Request &req,
6020  const std::string &boundary,
6021  const std::string &content_type,
6022  size_t content_length) {
6023  size_t data_length = 0;
6024 
6025  process_multipart_ranges_data(
6026  req, boundary, content_type, content_length,
6027  [&](const std::string &token) { data_length += token.size(); },
6028  [&](const std::string &token) { data_length += token.size(); },
6029  [&](size_t /*offset*/, size_t length) {
6030  data_length += length;
6031  return true;
6032  });
6033 
6034  return data_length;
6035 }
6036 
6037 template <typename T>
6038 inline bool
6039 write_multipart_ranges_data(Stream &strm, const Request &req, Response &res,
6040  const std::string &boundary,
6041  const std::string &content_type,
6042  size_t content_length, const T &is_shutting_down) {
6043  return process_multipart_ranges_data(
6044  req, boundary, content_type, content_length,
6045  [&](const std::string &token) { strm.write(token); },
6046  [&](const std::string &token) { strm.write(token); },
6047  [&](size_t offset, size_t length) {
6048  return write_content(strm, res.content_provider_, offset, length,
6049  is_shutting_down);
6050  });
6051 }
6052 
6053 inline bool expect_content(const Request &req) {
6054  if (req.method == "POST" || req.method == "PUT" || req.method == "PATCH" ||
6055  req.method == "DELETE") {
6056  return true;
6057  }
6058  if (req.has_header("Content-Length") &&
6059  req.get_header_value_u64("Content-Length") > 0) {
6060  return true;
6061  }
6062  if (is_chunked_transfer_encoding(req.headers)) { return true; }
6063  return false;
6064 }
6065 
6066 inline bool has_crlf(const std::string &s) {
6067  auto p = s.c_str();
6068  while (*p) {
6069  if (*p == '\r' || *p == '\n') { return true; }
6070  p++;
6071  }
6072  return false;
6073 }
6074 
6075 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
6076 inline std::string message_digest(const std::string &s, const EVP_MD *algo) {
6077  auto context = std::unique_ptr<EVP_MD_CTX, decltype(&EVP_MD_CTX_free)>(
6078  EVP_MD_CTX_new(), EVP_MD_CTX_free);
6079 
6080  unsigned int hash_length = 0;
6081  unsigned char hash[EVP_MAX_MD_SIZE];
6082 
6083  EVP_DigestInit_ex(context.get(), algo, nullptr);
6084  EVP_DigestUpdate(context.get(), s.c_str(), s.size());
6085  EVP_DigestFinal_ex(context.get(), hash, &hash_length);
6086 
6087  std::stringstream ss;
6088  for (auto i = 0u; i < hash_length; ++i) {
6089  ss << std::hex << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0')
6090  << static_cast<unsigned int>(hash[i]);
6091  }
6092 
6093  return ss.str();
6094 }
6095 
6096 inline std::string MD5(const std::string &s) {
6097  return message_digest(s, EVP_md5());
6098 }
6099 
6100 inline std::string SHA_256(const std::string &s) {
6101  return message_digest(s, EVP_sha256());
6102 }
6103 
6104 inline std::string SHA_512(const std::string &s) {
6105  return message_digest(s, EVP_sha512());
6106 }
6107 
6108 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string> make_digest_authentication_header(
6109  const Request &req, const std::map<std::string, std::string> &auth,
6110  size_t cnonce_count, const std::string &cnonce, const std::string &username,
6111  const std::string &password, bool is_proxy = false) {
6112  std::string nc;
6113  {
6114  std::stringstream ss;
6115  ss << std::setfill('0') << std::setw(8) << std::hex << cnonce_count;
6116  nc = ss.str();
6117  }
6118 
6119  std::string qop;
6120  if (auth.find("qop") != auth.end()) {
6121  qop = auth.at("qop");
6122  if (qop.find("auth-int") != std::string::npos) {
6123  qop = "auth-int";
6124  } else if (qop.find("auth") != std::string::npos) {
6125  qop = "auth";
6126  } else {
6127  qop.clear();
6128  }
6129  }
6130 
6131  std::string algo = "MD5";
6132  if (auth.find("algorithm") != auth.end()) { algo = auth.at("algorithm"); }
6133 
6134  std::string response;
6135  {
6136  auto H = algo == "SHA-256" ? detail::SHA_256
6137  : algo == "SHA-512" ? detail::SHA_512
6138  : detail::MD5;
6139 
6140  auto A1 = username + ":" + auth.at("realm") + ":" + password;
6141 
6142  auto A2 = req.method + ":" + req.path;
6143  if (qop == "auth-int") { A2 += ":" + H(req.body); }
6144 
6145  if (qop.empty()) {
6146  response = H(H(A1) + ":" + auth.at("nonce") + ":" + H(A2));
6147  } else {
6148  response = H(H(A1) + ":" + auth.at("nonce") + ":" + nc + ":" + cnonce +
6149  ":" + qop + ":" + H(A2));
6150  }
6151  }
6152 
6153  auto opaque = (auth.find("opaque") != auth.end()) ? auth.at("opaque") : "";
6154 
6155  auto field = "Digest username=\"" + username + "\", realm=\"" +
6156  auth.at("realm") + "\", nonce=\"" + auth.at("nonce") +
6157  "\", uri=\"" + req.path + "\", algorithm=" + algo +
6158  (qop.empty() ? ", response=\""
6159  : ", qop=" + qop + ", nc=" + nc + ", cnonce=\"" +
6160  cnonce + "\", response=\"") +
6161  response + "\"" +
6162  (opaque.empty() ? "" : ", opaque=\"" + opaque + "\"");
6163 
6164  auto key = is_proxy ? "Proxy-Authorization" : "Authorization";
6165  return std::make_pair(key, field);
6166 }
6167 
6168 inline bool is_ssl_peer_could_be_closed(SSL *ssl, socket_t sock) {
6169  detail::set_nonblocking(sock, true);
6170  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&]() { detail::set_nonblocking(sock, false); });
6171 
6172  char buf[1];
6173  return !SSL_peek(ssl, buf, 1) &&
6174  SSL_get_error(ssl, 0) == SSL_ERROR_ZERO_RETURN;
6175 }
6176 
6177 #ifdef _WIN64
6178 // NOTE: This code came up with the following stackoverflow post:
6179 // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9507184/can-openssl-on-windows-use-the-system-certificate-store
6180 inline bool load_system_certs_on_windows(X509_STORE *store) {
6181  auto hStore = CertOpenSystemStoreW((HCRYPTPROV_LEGACY)NULL, L"ROOT");
6182  if (!hStore) { return false; }
6183 
6184  auto result = false;
6185  PCCERT_CONTEXT pContext = NULL;
6186  while ((pContext = CertEnumCertificatesInStore(hStore, pContext)) !=
6187  nullptr) {
6188  auto encoded_cert =
6189  static_cast<const unsigned char *>(pContext->pbCertEncoded);
6190 
6191  auto x509 = d2i_X509(NULL, &encoded_cert, pContext->cbCertEncoded);
6192  if (x509) {
6193  X509_STORE_add_cert(store, x509);
6194  X509_free(x509);
6195  result = true;
6196  }
6197  }
6198 
6199  CertFreeCertificateContext(pContext);
6200  CertCloseStore(hStore, 0);
6201 
6202  return result;
6203 }
6204 #elif defined(CPPHTTPLIB_USE_CERTS_FROM_MACOSX_KEYCHAIN) && \
6205  defined(TARGET_OS_OSX)
6206 template <typename T>
6207 using CFObjectPtr =
6208  std::unique_ptr<typename std::remove_pointer<T>::type, void (*)(CFTypeRef)>;
6209 
6210 inline void cf_object_ptr_deleter(CFTypeRef obj) {
6211  if (obj) { CFRelease(obj); }
6212 }
6213 
6214 inline bool retrieve_certs_from_keychain(CFObjectPtr<CFArrayRef> &certs) {
6215  CFStringRef keys[] = {kSecClass, kSecMatchLimit, kSecReturnRef};
6216  CFTypeRef values[] = {kSecClassCertificate, kSecMatchLimitAll,
6217  kCFBooleanTrue};
6218 
6219  CFObjectPtr<CFDictionaryRef> query(
6220  CFDictionaryCreate(nullptr, reinterpret_cast<const void **>(keys), values,
6221  sizeof(keys) / sizeof(keys[0]),
6222  &kCFTypeDictionaryKeyCallBacks,
6223  &kCFTypeDictionaryValueCallBacks),
6224  cf_object_ptr_deleter);
6225 
6226  if (!query) { return false; }
6227 
6228  CFTypeRef security_items = nullptr;
6229  if (SecItemCopyMatching(query.get(), &security_items) != errSecSuccess ||
6230  CFArrayGetTypeID() != CFGetTypeID(security_items)) {
6231  return false;
6232  }
6233 
6234  certs.reset(reinterpret_cast<CFArrayRef>(security_items));
6235  return true;
6236 }
6237 
6238 inline bool retrieve_root_certs_from_keychain(CFObjectPtr<CFArrayRef> &certs) {
6239  CFArrayRef root_security_items = nullptr;
6240  if (SecTrustCopyAnchorCertificates(&root_security_items) != errSecSuccess) {
6241  return false;
6242  }
6243 
6244  certs.reset(root_security_items);
6245  return true;
6246 }
6247 
6248 inline bool add_certs_to_x509_store(CFArrayRef certs, X509_STORE *store) {
6249  auto result = false;
6250  for (auto i = 0; i < CFArrayGetCount(certs); ++i) {
6251  const auto cert = reinterpret_cast<const __SecCertificate *>(
6252  CFArrayGetValueAtIndex(certs, i));
6253 
6254  if (SecCertificateGetTypeID() != CFGetTypeID(cert)) { continue; }
6255 
6256  CFDataRef cert_data = nullptr;
6257  if (SecItemExport(cert, kSecFormatX509Cert, 0, nullptr, &cert_data) !=
6258  errSecSuccess) {
6259  continue;
6260  }
6261 
6262  CFObjectPtr<CFDataRef> cert_data_ptr(cert_data, cf_object_ptr_deleter);
6263 
6264  auto encoded_cert = static_cast<const unsigned char *>(
6265  CFDataGetBytePtr(cert_data_ptr.get()));
6266 
6267  auto x509 =
6268  d2i_X509(NULL, &encoded_cert, CFDataGetLength(cert_data_ptr.get()));
6269 
6270  if (x509) {
6271  X509_STORE_add_cert(store, x509);
6272  X509_free(x509);
6273  result = true;
6274  }
6275  }
6276 
6277  return result;
6278 }
6279 
6280 inline bool load_system_certs_on_macos(X509_STORE *store) {
6281  auto result = false;
6282  CFObjectPtr<CFArrayRef> certs(nullptr, cf_object_ptr_deleter);
6283  if (retrieve_certs_from_keychain(certs) && certs) {
6284  result = add_certs_to_x509_store(certs.get(), store);
6285  }
6286 
6287  if (retrieve_root_certs_from_keychain(certs) && certs) {
6288  result = add_certs_to_x509_store(certs.get(), store) || result;
6289  }
6290 
6291  return result;
6292 }
6293 #endif // _WIN64
6294 #endif // CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
6295 
6296 #ifdef _WIN64
6297 class WSInit {
6298 public:
6299  WSInit() {
6300  WSADATA wsaData;
6301  if (WSAStartup(0x0002, &wsaData) == 0) is_valid_ = true;
6302  }
6303 
6304  ~WSInit() {
6305  if (is_valid_) WSACleanup();
6306  }
6307 
6308  bool is_valid_ = false;
6309 };
6310 
6311 static WSInit wsinit_;
6312 #endif
6313 
6314 inline bool parse_www_authenticate(const Response &res,
6315  std::map<std::string, std::string> &auth,
6316  bool is_proxy) {
6317  auto auth_key = is_proxy ? "Proxy-Authenticate" : "WWW-Authenticate";
6318  if (res.has_header(auth_key)) {
6319  thread_local auto re =
6320  std::regex(R"~((?:(?:,\s*)?(.+?)=(?:"(.*?)"|([^,]*))))~");
6321  auto s = res.get_header_value(auth_key);
6322  auto pos = s.find(' ');
6323  if (pos != std::string::npos) {
6324  auto type = s.substr(0, pos);
6325  if (type == "Basic") {
6326  return false;
6327  } else if (type == "Digest") {
6328  s = s.substr(pos + 1);
6329  auto beg = std::sregex_iterator(s.begin(), s.end(), re);
6330  for (auto i = beg; i != std::sregex_iterator(); ++i) {
6331  const auto &m = *i;
6332  auto key = s.substr(static_cast<size_t>(m.position(1)),
6333  static_cast<size_t>(m.length(1)));
6334  auto val = m.length(2) > 0
6335  ? s.substr(static_cast<size_t>(m.position(2)),
6336  static_cast<size_t>(m.length(2)))
6337  : s.substr(static_cast<size_t>(m.position(3)),
6338  static_cast<size_t>(m.length(3)));
6339  auth[key] = val;
6340  }
6341  return true;
6342  }
6343  }
6344  }
6345  return false;
6346 }
6347 
6348 class ContentProviderAdapter {
6349 public:
6350  explicit ContentProviderAdapter(
6351  ContentProviderWithoutLength &&content_provider)
6352  : content_provider_(content_provider) {}
6353 
6354  bool operator()(size_t offset, size_t, DataSink &sink) {
6355  return content_provider_(offset, sink);
6356  }
6357 
6358 private:
6359  ContentProviderWithoutLength content_provider_;
6360 };
6361 
6362 } // namespace detail
6363 
6364 inline std::string hosted_at(const std::string &hostname) {
6365  std::vector<std::string> addrs;
6366  hosted_at(hostname, addrs);
6367  if (addrs.empty()) { return std::string(); }
6368  return addrs[0];
6369 }
6370 
6371 inline void hosted_at(const std::string &hostname,
6372  std::vector<std::string> &addrs) {
6373  struct addrinfo hints;
6374  struct addrinfo *result;
6375 
6376  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
6377  hints.ai_family = AF_UNSPEC;
6378  hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
6379  hints.ai_protocol = 0;
6380 
6381  if (detail::getaddrinfo_with_timeout(hostname.c_str(), nullptr, &hints,
6382  &result, 0)) {
6383 #if defined __linux__ && !defined __ANDROID__
6384  res_init();
6385 #endif
6386  return;
6387  }
6388  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { freeaddrinfo(result); });
6389 
6390  for (auto rp = result; rp; rp = rp->ai_next) {
6391  const auto &addr =
6392  *reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr_storage *>(rp->ai_addr);
6393  std::string ip;
6394  auto dummy = -1;
6395  if (detail::get_ip_and_port(addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr_storage), ip,
6396  dummy)) {
6397  addrs.push_back(ip);
6398  }
6399  }
6400 }
6401 
6402 inline std::string encode_uri_component(const std::string &value) {
6403  std::ostringstream escaped;
6404  escaped.fill('0');
6405  escaped << std::hex;
6406 
6407  for (auto c : value) {
6408  if (std::isalnum(static_cast<uint8_t>(c)) || c == '-' || c == '_' ||
6409  c == '.' || c == '!' || c == '~' || c == '*' || c == '\'' || c == '(' ||
6410  c == ')') {
6411  escaped << c;
6412  } else {
6413  escaped << std::uppercase;
6414  escaped << '%' << std::setw(2)
6415  << static_cast<int>(static_cast<unsigned char>(c));
6416  escaped << std::nouppercase;
6417  }
6418  }
6419 
6420  return escaped.str();
6421 }
6422 
6423 inline std::string encode_uri(const std::string &value) {
6424  std::ostringstream escaped;
6425  escaped.fill('0');
6426  escaped << std::hex;
6427 
6428  for (auto c : value) {
6429  if (std::isalnum(static_cast<uint8_t>(c)) || c == '-' || c == '_' ||
6430  c == '.' || c == '!' || c == '~' || c == '*' || c == '\'' || c == '(' ||
6431  c == ')' || c == ';' || c == '/' || c == '?' || c == ':' || c == '@' ||
6432  c == '&' || c == '=' || c == '+' || c == '$' || c == ',' || c == '#') {
6433  escaped << c;
6434  } else {
6435  escaped << std::uppercase;
6436  escaped << '%' << std::setw(2)
6437  << static_cast<int>(static_cast<unsigned char>(c));
6438  escaped << std::nouppercase;
6439  }
6440  }
6441 
6442  return escaped.str();
6443 }
6444 
6445 inline std::string decode_uri_component(const std::string &value) {
6446  std::string result;
6447 
6448  for (size_t i = 0; i < value.size(); i++) {
6449  if (value[i] == '%' && i + 2 < value.size()) {
6450  auto val = 0;
6451  if (detail::from_hex_to_i(value, i + 1, 2, val)) {
6452  result += static_cast<char>(val);
6453  i += 2;
6454  } else {
6455  result += value[i];
6456  }
6457  } else {
6458  result += value[i];
6459  }
6460  }
6461 
6462  return result;
6463 }
6464 
6465 inline std::string decode_uri(const std::string &value) {
6466  std::string result;
6467 
6468  for (size_t i = 0; i < value.size(); i++) {
6469  if (value[i] == '%' && i + 2 < value.size()) {
6470  auto val = 0;
6471  if (detail::from_hex_to_i(value, i + 1, 2, val)) {
6472  result += static_cast<char>(val);
6473  i += 2;
6474  } else {
6475  result += value[i];
6476  }
6477  } else {
6478  result += value[i];
6479  }
6480  }
6481 
6482  return result;
6483 }
6484 
6485 inline std::string encode_path_component(const std::string &component) {
6486  std::string result;
6487  result.reserve(component.size() * 3);
6488 
6489  for (size_t i = 0; i < component.size(); i++) {
6490  auto c = static_cast<unsigned char>(component[i]);
6491 
6492  // Unreserved characters per RFC 3986: ALPHA / DIGIT / "-" / "." / "_" / "~"
6493  if (std::isalnum(c) || c == '-' || c == '.' || c == '_' || c == '~') {
6494  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6495  }
6496  // Path-safe sub-delimiters: "!" / "$" / "&" / "'" / "(" / ")" / "*" / "+" /
6497  // "," / ";" / "="
6498  else if (c == '!' || c == '$' || c == '&' || c == '\'' || c == '(' ||
6499  c == ')' || c == '*' || c == '+' || c == ',' || c == ';' ||
6500  c == '=') {
6501  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6502  }
6503  // Colon is allowed in path segments except first segment
6504  else if (c == ':') {
6505  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6506  }
6507  // @ is allowed in path
6508  else if (c == '@') {
6509  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6510  } else {
6511  result += '%';
6512  char hex[3];
6513  snprintf(hex, sizeof(hex), "%02X", c);
6514  result.append(hex, 2);
6515  }
6516  }
6517  return result;
6518 }
6519 
6520 inline std::string decode_path_component(const std::string &component) {
6521  std::string result;
6522  result.reserve(component.size());
6523 
6524  for (size_t i = 0; i < component.size(); i++) {
6525  if (component[i] == '%' && i + 1 < component.size()) {
6526  if (component[i + 1] == 'u') {
6527  // Unicode %uXXXX encoding
6528  auto val = 0;
6529  if (detail::from_hex_to_i(component, i + 2, 4, val)) {
6530  // 4 digits Unicode codes
6531  char buff[4];
6532  size_t len = detail::to_utf8(val, buff);
6533  if (len > 0) { result.append(buff, len); }
6534  i += 5; // 'u0000'
6535  } else {
6536  result += component[i];
6537  }
6538  } else {
6539  // Standard %XX encoding
6540  auto val = 0;
6541  if (detail::from_hex_to_i(component, i + 1, 2, val)) {
6542  // 2 digits hex codes
6543  result += static_cast<char>(val);
6544  i += 2; // 'XX'
6545  } else {
6546  result += component[i];
6547  }
6548  }
6549  } else {
6550  result += component[i];
6551  }
6552  }
6553  return result;
6554 }
6555 
6556 inline std::string encode_query_component(const std::string &component,
6557  bool space_as_plus) {
6558  std::string result;
6559  result.reserve(component.size() * 3);
6560 
6561  for (size_t i = 0; i < component.size(); i++) {
6562  auto c = static_cast<unsigned char>(component[i]);
6563 
6564  // Unreserved characters per RFC 3986
6565  if (std::isalnum(c) || c == '-' || c == '.' || c == '_' || c == '~') {
6566  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6567  }
6568  // Space handling
6569  else if (c == ' ') {
6570  if (space_as_plus) {
6571  result += '+';
6572  } else {
6573  result += "%20";
6574  }
6575  }
6576  // Plus sign handling
6577  else if (c == '+') {
6578  if (space_as_plus) {
6579  result += "%2B";
6580  } else {
6581  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6582  }
6583  }
6584  // Query-safe sub-delimiters (excluding & and = which are query delimiters)
6585  else if (c == '!' || c == '$' || c == '\'' || c == '(' || c == ')' ||
6586  c == '*' || c == ',' || c == ';') {
6587  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6588  }
6589  // Colon and @ are allowed in query
6590  else if (c == ':' || c == '@') {
6591  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6592  }
6593  // Forward slash is allowed in query values
6594  else if (c == '/') {
6595  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6596  }
6597  // Question mark is allowed in query values (after first ?)
6598  else if (c == '?') {
6599  result += static_cast<char>(c);
6600  } else {
6601  result += '%';
6602  char hex[3];
6603  snprintf(hex, sizeof(hex), "%02X", c);
6604  result.append(hex, 2);
6605  }
6606  }
6607  return result;
6608 }
6609 
6610 inline std::string decode_query_component(const std::string &component,
6611  bool plus_as_space) {
6612  std::string result;
6613  result.reserve(component.size());
6614 
6615  for (size_t i = 0; i < component.size(); i++) {
6616  if (component[i] == '%' && i + 2 < component.size()) {
6617  std::string hex = component.substr(i + 1, 2);
6618  char *end;
6619  unsigned long value = std::strtoul(hex.c_str(), &end, 16);
6620  if (end == hex.c_str() + 2) {
6621  result += static_cast<char>(value);
6622  i += 2;
6623  } else {
6624  result += component[i];
6625  }
6626  } else if (component[i] == '+' && plus_as_space) {
6627  result += ' '; // + becomes space in form-urlencoded
6628  } else {
6629  result += component[i];
6630  }
6631  }
6632  return result;
6633 }
6634 
6635 inline std::string append_query_params(const std::string &path,
6636  const Params &params) {
6637  std::string path_with_query = path;
6638  thread_local const std::regex re("[^?]+\\?.*");
6639  auto delm = std::regex_match(path, re) ? '&' : '?';
6640  path_with_query += delm + detail::params_to_query_str(params);
6641  return path_with_query;
6642 }
6643 
6644 // Header utilities
6645 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string>
6646 make_range_header(const Ranges &ranges) {
6647  std::string field = "bytes=";
6648  auto i = 0;
6649  for (const auto &r : ranges) {
6650  if (i != 0) { field += ", "; }
6651  if (r.first != -1) { field += std::to_string(r.first); }
6652  field += '-';
6653  if (r.second != -1) { field += std::to_string(r.second); }
6654  i++;
6655  }
6656  return std::make_pair("Range", std::move(field));
6657 }
6658 
6659 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string>
6660 make_basic_authentication_header(const std::string &username,
6661  const std::string &password, bool is_proxy) {
6662  auto field = "Basic " + detail::base64_encode(username + ":" + password);
6663  auto key = is_proxy ? "Proxy-Authorization" : "Authorization";
6664  return std::make_pair(key, std::move(field));
6665 }
6666 
6667 inline std::pair<std::string, std::string>
6668 make_bearer_token_authentication_header(const std::string &token,
6669  bool is_proxy = false) {
6670  auto field = "Bearer " + token;
6671  auto key = is_proxy ? "Proxy-Authorization" : "Authorization";
6672  return std::make_pair(key, std::move(field));
6673 }
6674 
6675 // Request implementation
6676 inline bool Request::has_header(const std::string &key) const {
6677  return detail::has_header(headers, key);
6678 }
6679 
6680 inline std::string Request::get_header_value(const std::string &key,
6681  const char *def, size_t id) const {
6682  return detail::get_header_value(headers, key, def, id);
6683 }
6684 
6685 inline size_t Request::get_header_value_count(const std::string &key) const {
6686  auto r = headers.equal_range(key);
6687  return static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(r.first, r.second));
6688 }
6689 
6690 inline void Request::set_header(const std::string &key,
6691  const std::string &val) {
6692  if (detail::fields::is_field_name(key) &&
6693  detail::fields::is_field_value(val)) {
6694  headers.emplace(key, val);
6695  }
6696 }
6697 
6698 inline bool Request::has_trailer(const std::string &key) const {
6699  return trailers.find(key) != trailers.end();
6700 }
6701 
6702 inline std::string Request::get_trailer_value(const std::string &key,
6703  size_t id) const {
6704  auto rng = trailers.equal_range(key);
6705  auto it = rng.first;
6706  std::advance(it, static_cast<ssize_t>(id));
6707  if (it != rng.second) { return it->second; }
6708  return std::string();
6709 }
6710 
6711 inline size_t Request::get_trailer_value_count(const std::string &key) const {
6712  auto r = trailers.equal_range(key);
6713  return static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(r.first, r.second));
6714 }

6717  return params.find(key) != params.end();
6718 }

6722  auto rng = params.equal_range(key);
6723  auto it = rng.first;
6724  std::advance(it, static_cast<ssize_t>(id));
6725  if (it != rng.second) { return it->second; }
6726  return std::string();
6727 }

6734 inline bool Request::is_multipart_form_data() const {
6735  const auto &content_type = get_header_value("Content-Type");
6736  return !content_type.rfind("multipart/form-data", 0);
6737 }
6738 
6739 // Multipart FormData implementation
6740 inline std::string MultipartFormData::get_field(const std::string &key,
6741  size_t id) const {
6742  auto rng = fields.equal_range(key);
6743  auto it = rng.first;
6744  std::advance(it, static_cast<ssize_t>(id));
6745  if (it != rng.second) { return it->second.content; }
6746  return std::string();
6747 }
6748 
6749 inline std::vector<std::string>
6750 MultipartFormData::get_fields(const std::string &key) const {
6751  std::vector<std::string> values;
6752  auto rng = fields.equal_range(key);
6753  for (auto it = rng.first; it != rng.second; it++) {
6754  values.push_back(it->second.content);
6755  }
6756  return values;
6757 }
6758 
6759 inline bool MultipartFormData::has_field(const std::string &key) const {
6760  return fields.find(key) != fields.end();
6761 }
6762 
6763 inline size_t MultipartFormData::get_field_count(const std::string &key) const {
6764  auto r = fields.equal_range(key);
6765  return static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(r.first, r.second));
6766 }
6767 
6768 inline FormData MultipartFormData::get_file(const std::string &key,
6769  size_t id) const {
6770  auto rng = files.equal_range(key);
6771  auto it = rng.first;
6772  std::advance(it, static_cast<ssize_t>(id));
6773  if (it != rng.second) { return it->second; }
6774  return FormData();
6775 }
6776 
6777 inline std::vector<FormData>
6778 MultipartFormData::get_files(const std::string &key) const {
6779  std::vector<FormData> values;
6780  auto rng = files.equal_range(key);
6781  for (auto it = rng.first; it != rng.second; it++) {
6782  values.push_back(it->second);
6783  }
6784  return values;
6785 }
6786 
6787 inline bool MultipartFormData::has_file(const std::string &key) const {
6788  return files.find(key) != files.end();
6789 }
6790 
6791 inline size_t MultipartFormData::get_file_count(const std::string &key) const {
6792  auto r = files.equal_range(key);
6793  return static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(r.first, r.second));
6794 }

6802  const char *def,
6803  size_t id) const {

6813  const std::string &val) {
6814  if (detail::fields::is_field_name(key) &&
6815  detail::fields::is_field_value(val)) {
6816  headers.emplace(key, val);
6817  }
6818 }

6836 
6837 inline void Response::set_redirect(const std::string &url, int stat) {
6838  if (detail::fields::is_field_value(url)) {
6839  set_header("Location", url);
6840  if (300 <= stat && stat < 400) {
6841  this->status = stat;
6842  } else {
6843  this->status = StatusCode::Found_302;
6844  }
6845  }
6846 }
6847 
6848 inline void Response::set_content(const char *s, size_t n,
6849  const std::string &content_type) {
6850  body.assign(s, n);
6851 
6852  auto rng = headers.equal_range("Content-Type");
6853  headers.erase(rng.first, rng.second);
6854  set_header("Content-Type", content_type);
6855 }
6856 
6857 inline void Response::set_content(const std::string &s,
6858  const std::string &content_type) {
6859  set_content(s.data(), s.size(), content_type);
6860 }
6861 
6862 inline void Response::set_content(std::string &&s,
6863  const std::string &content_type) {
6864  body = std::move(s);
6865 
6866  auto rng = headers.equal_range("Content-Type");
6867  headers.erase(rng.first, rng.second);
6868  set_header("Content-Type", content_type);
6869 }
6870 
6871 inline void Response::set_content_provider(
6872  size_t in_length, const std::string &content_type, ContentProvider provider,
6873  ContentProviderResourceReleaser resource_releaser) {
6874  set_header("Content-Type", content_type);
6875  content_length_ = in_length;
6876  if (in_length > 0) { content_provider_ = std::move(provider); }
6877  content_provider_resource_releaser_ = std::move(resource_releaser);
6878  is_chunked_content_provider_ = false;
6879 }
6880 
6881 inline void Response::set_content_provider(
6882  const std::string &content_type, ContentProviderWithoutLength provider,
6883  ContentProviderResourceReleaser resource_releaser) {
6884  set_header("Content-Type", content_type);
6885  content_length_ = 0;
6886  content_provider_ = detail::ContentProviderAdapter(std::move(provider));
6887  content_provider_resource_releaser_ = std::move(resource_releaser);
6888  is_chunked_content_provider_ = false;
6889 }
6890 
6891 inline void Response::set_chunked_content_provider(
6892  const std::string &content_type, ContentProviderWithoutLength provider,
6893  ContentProviderResourceReleaser resource_releaser) {
6894  set_header("Content-Type", content_type);
6895  content_length_ = 0;
6896  content_provider_ = detail::ContentProviderAdapter(std::move(provider));
6897  content_provider_resource_releaser_ = std::move(resource_releaser);
6898  is_chunked_content_provider_ = true;
6899 }
6900 
6901 inline void Response::set_file_content(const std::string &path,
6902  const std::string &content_type) {
6903  file_content_path_ = path;
6904  file_content_content_type_ = content_type;
6905 }
6906 
6907 inline void Response::set_file_content(const std::string &path) {
6908  file_content_path_ = path;
6909 }

6911 // Result implementation
6912 inline bool Result::has_request_header(const std::string &key) const {
6913  return request_headers_.find(key) != request_headers_.end();
6914 }
6915 
6916 inline std::string Result::get_request_header_value(const std::string &key,
6917  const char *def,
6918  size_t id) const {
6919  return detail::get_header_value(request_headers_, key, def, id);
6920 }
6921

6923 Result::get_request_header_value_count(const std::string &key) const {
6924  auto r = request_headers_.equal_range(key);
6925  return static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(r.first, r.second));
6926 }

6928 // Stream implementation
6929 inline ssize_t Stream::write(const char *ptr) {
6930  return write(ptr, strlen(ptr));
6931 }
6932 
6933 inline ssize_t Stream::write(const std::string &s) {
6934  return write(s.data(), s.size());
6935 }
6936 
6937 namespace detail {
6938 
6939 inline void calc_actual_timeout(time_t max_timeout_msec, time_t duration_msec,
6940  time_t timeout_sec, time_t timeout_usec,
6941  time_t &actual_timeout_sec,
6942  time_t &actual_timeout_usec) {
6943  auto timeout_msec = (timeout_sec * 1000) + (timeout_usec / 1000);
6944 
6945  auto actual_timeout_msec =
6946  (std::min)(max_timeout_msec - duration_msec, timeout_msec);
6947 
6948  if (actual_timeout_msec < 0) { actual_timeout_msec = 0; }
6949 
6950  actual_timeout_sec = actual_timeout_msec / 1000;
6951  actual_timeout_usec = (actual_timeout_msec % 1000) * 1000;
6952 }
6953 
6954 // Socket stream implementation
6955 inline SocketStream::SocketStream(
6956  socket_t sock, time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec,
6957  time_t write_timeout_sec, time_t write_timeout_usec,
6958  time_t max_timeout_msec,
6959  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time)
6960  : sock_(sock), read_timeout_sec_(read_timeout_sec),
6961  read_timeout_usec_(read_timeout_usec),
6962  write_timeout_sec_(write_timeout_sec),
6963  write_timeout_usec_(write_timeout_usec),
6964  max_timeout_msec_(max_timeout_msec), start_time_(start_time),
6965  read_buff_(read_buff_size_, 0) {}
6966 
6967 inline SocketStream::~SocketStream() = default;
6968 
6969 inline bool SocketStream::is_readable() const {
6970  return read_buff_off_ < read_buff_content_size_;
6971 }
6972 
6973 inline bool SocketStream::wait_readable() const {
6974  if (max_timeout_msec_ <= 0) {
6975  return select_read(sock_, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_) > 0;
6976  }
6977 
6978  time_t read_timeout_sec;
6979  time_t read_timeout_usec;
6980  calc_actual_timeout(max_timeout_msec_, duration(), read_timeout_sec_,
6981  read_timeout_usec_, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec);
6982 
6983  return select_read(sock_, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec) > 0;
6984 }
6985 
6986 inline bool SocketStream::wait_writable() const {
6987  return select_write(sock_, write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_) > 0 &&
6988  is_socket_alive(sock_);
6989 }
6990 
6991 inline ssize_t SocketStream::read(char *ptr, size_t size) {
6992 #ifdef _WIN64
6993  size =
6994  (std::min)(size, static_cast<size_t>((std::numeric_limits<int>::max)()));
6995 #else
6996  size = (std::min)(size,
6997  static_cast<size_t>((std::numeric_limits<ssize_t>::max)()));
6998 #endif
6999 
7000  if (read_buff_off_ < read_buff_content_size_) {
7001  auto remaining_size = read_buff_content_size_ - read_buff_off_;
7002  if (size <= remaining_size) {
7003  memcpy(ptr, read_buff_.data() + read_buff_off_, size);
7004  read_buff_off_ += size;
7005  return static_cast<ssize_t>(size);
7006  } else {
7007  memcpy(ptr, read_buff_.data() + read_buff_off_, remaining_size);
7008  read_buff_off_ += remaining_size;
7009  return static_cast<ssize_t>(remaining_size);
7010  }
7011  }
7012 
7013  if (!wait_readable()) { return -1; }
7014 
7015  read_buff_off_ = 0;
7016  read_buff_content_size_ = 0;
7017 
7018  if (size < read_buff_size_) {
7019  auto n = read_socket(sock_, read_buff_.data(), read_buff_size_,
7020  CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_FLAGS);
7021  if (n <= 0) {
7022  return n;
7023  } else if (n <= static_cast<ssize_t>(size)) {
7024  memcpy(ptr, read_buff_.data(), static_cast<size_t>(n));
7025  return n;
7026  } else {
7027  memcpy(ptr, read_buff_.data(), size);
7028  read_buff_off_ = size;
7029  read_buff_content_size_ = static_cast<size_t>(n);
7030  return static_cast<ssize_t>(size);
7031  }
7032  } else {
7033  return read_socket(sock_, ptr, size, CPPHTTPLIB_RECV_FLAGS);
7034  }
7035 }
7036 
7037 inline ssize_t SocketStream::write(const char *ptr, size_t size) {
7038  if (!wait_writable()) { return -1; }
7039 
7040 #if defined(_WIN64) && !defined(_WIN64)
7041  size =
7042  (std::min)(size, static_cast<size_t>((std::numeric_limits<int>::max)()));
7043 #endif
7044 
7045  return send_socket(sock_, ptr, size, CPPHTTPLIB_SEND_FLAGS);
7046 }
7047 
7048 inline void SocketStream::get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
7049  int &port) const {
7050  return detail::get_remote_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
7051 }
7052 
7053 inline void SocketStream::get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
7054  int &port) const {
7055  return detail::get_local_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
7056 }
7057 
7058 inline socket_t SocketStream::socket() const { return sock_; }
7059 
7060 inline time_t SocketStream::duration() const {
7061  return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(
7062  std::chrono::steady_clock::now() - start_time_)
7063  .count();
7064 }
7065 
7066 // Buffer stream implementation
7067 inline bool BufferStream::is_readable() const { return true; }
7068 
7069 inline bool BufferStream::wait_readable() const { return true; }
7070 
7071 inline bool BufferStream::wait_writable() const { return true; }
7072 
7073 inline ssize_t BufferStream::read(char *ptr, size_t size) {
7074 #if defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER < 1910
7075  auto len_read = buffer._Copy_s(ptr, size, size, position);
7076 #else
7077  auto len_read = buffer.copy(ptr, size, position);
7078 #endif
7079  position += static_cast<size_t>(len_read);
7080  return static_cast<ssize_t>(len_read);
7081 }
7082 
7083 inline ssize_t BufferStream::write(const char *ptr, size_t size) {
7084  buffer.append(ptr, size);
7085  return static_cast<ssize_t>(size);
7086 }
7087 
7088 inline void BufferStream::get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string & /*ip*/,
7089  int & /*port*/) const {}
7090 
7091 inline void BufferStream::get_local_ip_and_port(std::string & /*ip*/,
7092  int & /*port*/) const {}
7093 
7094 inline socket_t BufferStream::socket() const { return 0; }
7095 
7096 inline time_t BufferStream::duration() const { return 0; }
7097 
7098 inline const std::string &BufferStream::get_buffer() const { return buffer; }
7099 
7100 inline PathParamsMatcher::PathParamsMatcher(const std::string &pattern)
7101  : MatcherBase(pattern) {
7102  constexpr const char marker[] = "/:";
7103 
7104  // One past the last ending position of a path param substring
7105  std::size_t last_param_end = 0;
7106 
7107 #ifndef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
7108  // Needed to ensure that parameter names are unique during matcher
7109  // construction
7110  // If exceptions are disabled, only last duplicate path
7111  // parameter will be set
7112  std::unordered_set<std::string> param_name_set;
7113 #endif
7114 
7115  while (true) {
7116  const auto marker_pos = pattern.find(
7117  marker, last_param_end == 0 ? last_param_end : last_param_end - 1);
7118  if (marker_pos == std::string::npos) { break; }
7119 
7120  static_fragments_.push_back(
7121  pattern.substr(last_param_end, marker_pos - last_param_end + 1));
7122 
7123  const auto param_name_start = marker_pos + str_len(marker);
7124 
7125  auto sep_pos = pattern.find(separator, param_name_start);
7126  if (sep_pos == std::string::npos) { sep_pos = pattern.length(); }
7127 
7128  auto param_name =
7129  pattern.substr(param_name_start, sep_pos - param_name_start);
7130 
7131 #ifndef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
7132  if (param_name_set.find(param_name) != param_name_set.cend()) {
7133  std::string msg = "Encountered path parameter '" + param_name +
7134  "' multiple times in route pattern '" + pattern + "'.";
7135  throw std::invalid_argument(msg);
7136  }
7137 #endif
7138 
7139  param_names_.push_back(std::move(param_name));
7140 
7141  last_param_end = sep_pos + 1;
7142  }
7143 
7144  if (last_param_end < pattern.length()) {
7145  static_fragments_.push_back(pattern.substr(last_param_end));
7146  }
7147 }
7148 
7149 inline bool PathParamsMatcher::match(Request &request) const {
7150  request.matches = std::smatch();
7151  request.path_params.clear();
7152  request.path_params.reserve(param_names_.size());
7153 
7154  // One past the position at which the path matched the pattern last time
7155  std::size_t starting_pos = 0;
7156  for (size_t i = 0; i < static_fragments_.size(); ++i) {
7157  const auto &fragment = static_fragments_[i];
7158 
7159  if (starting_pos + fragment.length() > request.path.length()) {
7160  return false;
7161  }
7162 
7163  // Avoid unnecessary allocation by using strncmp instead of substr +
7164  // comparison
7165  if (std::strncmp(request.path.c_str() + starting_pos, fragment.c_str(),
7166  fragment.length()) != 0) {
7167  return false;
7168  }
7169 
7170  starting_pos += fragment.length();
7171 
7172  // Should only happen when we have a static fragment after a param
7173  // Example: '/users/:id/subscriptions'
7174  // The 'subscriptions' fragment here does not have a corresponding param
7175  if (i >= param_names_.size()) { continue; }
7176 
7177  auto sep_pos = request.path.find(separator, starting_pos);
7178  if (sep_pos == std::string::npos) { sep_pos = request.path.length(); }
7179 
7180  const auto &param_name = param_names_[i];
7181 
7182  request.path_params.emplace(
7183  param_name, request.path.substr(starting_pos, sep_pos - starting_pos));
7184 
7185  // Mark everything up to '/' as matched
7186  starting_pos = sep_pos + 1;
7187  }
7188  // Returns false if the path is longer than the pattern
7189  return starting_pos >= request.path.length();
7190 }
7191 
7192 inline bool RegexMatcher::match(Request &request) const {
7193  request.path_params.clear();
7194  return std::regex_match(request.path, request.matches, regex_);
7195 }
7196 
7197 } // namespace detail
7198 
7199 // HTTP server implementation
7200 inline Server::Server()
7201  : new_task_queue(
7202  [] { return new ThreadPool(CPPHTTPLIB_THREAD_POOL_COUNT); }) {
7203 #ifndef _WIN64
7204  signal(SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
7205 #endif
7206 }
7207 
7208 inline Server::~Server() = default;
7209 
7210 inline std::unique_ptr<detail::MatcherBase>
7211 Server::make_matcher(const std::string &pattern) {
7212  if (pattern.find("/:") != std::string::npos) {
7213  return detail::make_unique<detail::PathParamsMatcher>(pattern);
7214  } else {
7215  return detail::make_unique<detail::RegexMatcher>(pattern);
7216  }
7217 }
7218 
7219 inline Server &Server::Get(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7220  get_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7221  return *this;
7222 }
7223 
7224 inline Server &Server::Post(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7225  post_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7226  return *this;
7227 }
7228 
7229 inline Server &Server::Post(const std::string &pattern,
7230  HandlerWithContentReader handler) {
7231  post_handlers_for_content_reader_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern),
7232  std::move(handler));
7233  return *this;
7234 }
7235 
7236 inline Server &Server::Put(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7237  put_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7238  return *this;
7239 }
7240 
7241 inline Server &Server::Put(const std::string &pattern,
7242  HandlerWithContentReader handler) {
7243  put_handlers_for_content_reader_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern),
7244  std::move(handler));
7245  return *this;
7246 }
7247 
7248 inline Server &Server::Patch(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7249  patch_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7250  return *this;
7251 }
7252 
7253 inline Server &Server::Patch(const std::string &pattern,
7254  HandlerWithContentReader handler) {
7255  patch_handlers_for_content_reader_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern),
7256  std::move(handler));
7257  return *this;
7258 }
7259 
7260 inline Server &Server::Delete(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7261  delete_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7262  return *this;
7263 }
7264 
7265 inline Server &Server::Delete(const std::string &pattern,
7266  HandlerWithContentReader handler) {
7267  delete_handlers_for_content_reader_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern),
7268  std::move(handler));
7269  return *this;
7270 }
7271 
7272 inline Server &Server::Options(const std::string &pattern, Handler handler) {
7273  options_handlers_.emplace_back(make_matcher(pattern), std::move(handler));
7274  return *this;
7275 }
7276 
7277 inline bool Server::set_base_dir(const std::string &dir,
7278  const std::string &mount_point) {
7279  return set_mount_point(mount_point, dir);
7280 }
7281 
7282 inline bool Server::set_mount_point(const std::string &mount_point,
7283  const std::string &dir, Headers headers) {
7284  detail::FileStat stat(dir);
7285  if (stat.is_dir()) {
7286  std::string mnt = !mount_point.empty() ? mount_point : "/";
7287  if (!mnt.empty() && mnt[0] == '/') {
7288  base_dirs_.push_back({mnt, dir, std::move(headers)});
7289  return true;
7290  }
7291  }
7292  return false;
7293 }
7294 
7295 inline bool Server::remove_mount_point(const std::string &mount_point) {
7296  for (auto it = base_dirs_.begin(); it != base_dirs_.end(); ++it) {
7297  if (it->mount_point == mount_point) {
7298  base_dirs_.erase(it);
7299  return true;
7300  }
7301  }
7302  return false;
7303 }
7304 
7305 inline Server &
7306 Server::set_file_extension_and_mimetype_mapping(const std::string &ext,
7307  const std::string &mime) {
7308  file_extension_and_mimetype_map_[ext] = mime;
7309  return *this;
7310 }
7311 
7312 inline Server &Server::set_default_file_mimetype(const std::string &mime) {
7313  default_file_mimetype_ = mime;
7314  return *this;
7315 }
7316 
7317 inline Server &Server::set_file_request_handler(Handler handler) {
7318  file_request_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7319  return *this;
7320 }
7321 
7322 inline Server &Server::set_error_handler_core(HandlerWithResponse handler,
7323  std::true_type) {
7324  error_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7325  return *this;
7326 }
7327 
7328 inline Server &Server::set_error_handler_core(Handler handler,
7329  std::false_type) {
7330  error_handler_ = [handler](const Request &req, Response &res) {
7331  handler(req, res);
7332  return HandlerResponse::Handled;
7333  };
7334  return *this;
7335 }
7336 
7337 inline Server &Server::set_exception_handler(ExceptionHandler handler) {
7338  exception_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7339  return *this;
7340 }
7341 
7342 inline Server &Server::set_pre_routing_handler(HandlerWithResponse handler) {
7343  pre_routing_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7344  return *this;
7345 }
7346 
7347 inline Server &Server::set_post_routing_handler(Handler handler) {
7348  post_routing_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7349  return *this;
7350 }
7351 
7352 inline Server &Server::set_pre_request_handler(HandlerWithResponse handler) {
7353  pre_request_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7354  return *this;
7355 }
7356 
7357 inline Server &Server::set_logger(Logger logger) {
7358  logger_ = std::move(logger);
7359  return *this;
7360 }
7361

7363  pre_compression_logger_ = std::move(logger);
7364  return *this;
7365 }
7366 
7367 inline Server &
7368 Server::set_expect_100_continue_handler(Expect100ContinueHandler handler) {
7369  expect_100_continue_handler_ = std::move(handler);
7370  return *this;
7371 }
7372

7380  return *this;
7381 }

7384  ipv6_v6only_ = on;
7385  return *this;
7386 }

7389  socket_options_ = std::move(socket_options);
7390  return *this;
7391 }
7392

7394  default_headers_ = std::move(headers);
7395  return *this;
7396 }
7397 
7398 inline Server &Server::set_header_writer(
7399  std::function<ssize_t(Stream &, Headers &)> const &writer) {
7400  header_writer_ = writer;
7401  return *this;
7402 }
7403 
7404 inline Server &Server::set_keep_alive_max_count(size_t count) {
7405  keep_alive_max_count_ = count;
7406  return *this;
7407 }
7408 
7409 inline Server &Server::set_keep_alive_timeout(time_t sec) {
7410  keep_alive_timeout_sec_ = sec;
7411  return *this;
7412 }
7413 
7414 inline Server &Server::set_read_timeout(time_t sec, time_t usec) {
7415  read_timeout_sec_ = sec;
7416  read_timeout_usec_ = usec;
7417  return *this;
7418 }
7419
