9781 inline Result ClientImpl::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9782  const UploadFormDataItems &items,
9783  const FormDataProviderItems &provider_items,
9784  UploadProgress progress) {
9785  const auto &boundary = detail::make_multipart_data_boundary();
9786  const auto &content_type =
9787  detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
9788  return send_with_content_provider(
9789  "PUT", path, headers, nullptr, 0, nullptr,
9790  get_multipart_content_provider(boundary, items, provider_items),
9791  content_type, progress);
9792 }
9793 
9794 inline Result ClientImpl::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9795  const std::string &body,
9796  const std::string &content_type,
9797  ContentReceiver content_receiver,
9798  DownloadProgress progress) {
9799  Request req;
9800  req.method = "PUT";
9801  req.path = path;
9802  req.headers = headers;
9803  req.body = body;
9804  req.content_receiver =
9805  [content_receiver](const char *data, size_t data_length,
9806  size_t /*offset*/, size_t /*total_length*/) {
9807  return content_receiver(data, data_length);
9808  };
9809  req.download_progress = std::move(progress);
9810 
9811  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
9812  req.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
9813  }
9814 
9815  if (!content_type.empty()) { req.set_header("Content-Type", content_type); }
9816 
9817  return send_(std::move(req));
9818 }

9887  const std::string &boundary,
9888  UploadProgress progress) {

9890  return Result{nullptr, Error::UnsupportedMultipartBoundaryChars};
9891  }

9894  detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);

9896  return Patch(path, headers, body, content_type, progress);
9897 }

9937  const UploadFormDataItems &items,

9939  UploadProgress progress) {

9941  const auto &content_type =
9942  detail::serialize_multipart_formdata_get_content_type(boundary);
9943  return send_with_content_provider(
9944  "PATCH", path, headers, nullptr, 0, nullptr,
9945  get_multipart_content_provider(boundary, items, provider_items),
9946  content_type, progress);

9948 
9949 inline Result ClientImpl::Patch(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
9950  const std::string &body,
9951  const std::string &content_type,
9952  ContentReceiver content_receiver,
9953  DownloadProgress progress) {
9954  Request req;
9955  req.method = "PATCH";
9956  req.path = path;
9957  req.headers = headers;
9958  req.body = body;
9959  req.content_receiver =
9960  [content_receiver](const char *data, size_t data_length,
9961  size_t /*offset*/, size_t /*total_length*/) {
9962  return content_receiver(data, data_length);
9963  };
9964  req.download_progress = std::move(progress);
9965 
9966  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
9967  req.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
9968  }
9969 
9970  if (!content_type.empty()) { req.set_header("Content-Type", content_type); }
9971 
9972  return send_(std::move(req));
9973 }

10016  const Headers &headers, const Params &params,
10017  DownloadProgress progress) {
10018  auto query = detail::params_to_query_str(params);
10019  return Delete(path, headers, query, "application/x-www-form-urlencoded",
10020  progress);
10021 }
10022 
10023 inline Result ClientImpl::Delete(const std::string &path,
10024  const Headers &headers, const char *body,
10025  size_t content_length,
10026  const std::string &content_type,
10027  DownloadProgress progress) {
10028  Request req;
10029  req.method = "DELETE";
10030  req.headers = headers;
10031  req.path = path;
10032  req.download_progress = std::move(progress);
10033  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
10034  req.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
10035  }
10036 
10037  if (!content_type.empty()) { req.set_header("Content-Type", content_type); }
10038  req.body.assign(body, content_length);
10039 
10040  return send_(std::move(req));
10041 }
10042 
10043 inline Result ClientImpl::Options(const std::string &path) {
10044  return Options(path, Headers());
10045 }
10046 
10047 inline Result ClientImpl::Options(const std::string &path,
10048  const Headers &headers) {
10049  Request req;
10050  req.method = "OPTIONS";
10051  req.headers = headers;
10052  req.path = path;
10053  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
10054  req.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
10055  }
10056 
10057  return send_(std::move(req));
10058 }
10059 
10060 inline void ClientImpl::stop() {
10061  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(socket_mutex_);
10062 
10063  // If there is anything ongoing right now, the ONLY thread-safe thing we can
10064  // do is to shutdown_socket, so that threads using this socket suddenly
10065  // discover they can't read/write any more and error out. Everything else
10066  // (closing the socket, shutting ssl down) is unsafe because these actions are
10067  // not thread-safe.
10068  if (socket_requests_in_flight_ > 0) {
10069  shutdown_socket(socket_);
10070 
10071  // Aside from that, we set a flag for the socket to be closed when we're
10072  // done.
10073  socket_should_be_closed_when_request_is_done_ = true;
10074  return;
10075  }
10076 
10077  // Otherwise, still holding the mutex, we can shut everything down ourselves
10078  shutdown_ssl(socket_, true);
10079  shutdown_socket(socket_);
10080  close_socket(socket_);
10081 }
10082 
10083 inline std::string ClientImpl::host() const { return host_; }
10084 
10085 inline int ClientImpl::port() const { return port_; }
10086 
10087 inline size_t ClientImpl::is_socket_open() const {
10088  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(socket_mutex_);
10089  return socket_.is_open();
10090 }
10091 
10092 inline socket_t ClientImpl::socket() const { return socket_.sock; }
10093

10193 inline void ClientImpl::set_ca_cert_path(const std::string &ca_cert_file_path,
10194  const std::string &ca_cert_dir_path) {
10195  ca_cert_file_path_ = ca_cert_file_path;
10196  ca_cert_dir_path_ = ca_cert_dir_path;
10197 }
10198 
10199 inline void ClientImpl::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
10200  if (ca_cert_store && ca_cert_store != ca_cert_store_) {
10201  ca_cert_store_ = ca_cert_store;
10202  }
10203 }
10204 
10205 inline X509_STORE *ClientImpl::create_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert,
10206  std::size_t size) const {
10207  auto mem = BIO_new_mem_buf(ca_cert, static_cast<int>(size));
10208  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { BIO_free_all(mem); });
10209  if (!mem) { return nullptr; }
10210 
10211  auto inf = PEM_X509_INFO_read_bio(mem, nullptr, nullptr, nullptr);
10212  if (!inf) { return nullptr; }
10213 
10214  auto cts = X509_STORE_new();
10215  if (cts) {
10216  for (auto i = 0; i < static_cast<int>(sk_X509_INFO_num(inf)); i++) {
10217  auto itmp = sk_X509_INFO_value(inf, i);
10218  if (!itmp) { continue; }
10219 
10220  if (itmp->x509) { X509_STORE_add_cert(cts, itmp->x509); }
10221  if (itmp->crl) { X509_STORE_add_crl(cts, itmp->crl); }
10222  }
10223  }
10224 
10225  sk_X509_INFO_pop_free(inf, X509_INFO_free);
10226  return cts;
10227 }
10228 
10229 inline void ClientImpl::enable_server_certificate_verification(bool enabled) {
10230  server_certificate_verification_ = enabled;
10231 }
10232 
10233 inline void ClientImpl::enable_server_hostname_verification(bool enabled) {
10234  server_hostname_verification_ = enabled;
10235 }
10236 
10237 inline void ClientImpl::set_server_certificate_verifier(
10238  std::function<SSLVerifierResponse(SSL *ssl)> verifier) {
10239  server_certificate_verifier_ = verifier;
10240 }
10241 #endif
10242 
10243 inline void ClientImpl::set_logger(Logger logger) {
10244  logger_ = std::move(logger);
10245 }
10246 
10247 /*
10248  * SSL Implementation
10249  */
10250 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
10251 namespace detail {
10252 
10253 template <typename U, typename V>
10254 inline SSL *ssl_new(socket_t sock, SSL_CTX *ctx, std::mutex &ctx_mutex,
10255  U SSL_connect_or_accept, V setup) {
10256  SSL *ssl = nullptr;
10257  {
10258  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
10259  ssl = SSL_new(ctx);
10260  }
10261 
10262  if (ssl) {
10263  set_nonblocking(sock, true);
10264  auto bio = BIO_new_socket(static_cast<int>(sock), BIO_NOCLOSE);
10265  BIO_set_nbio(bio, 1);
10266  SSL_set_bio(ssl, bio, bio);
10267 
10268  if (!setup(ssl) || SSL_connect_or_accept(ssl) != 1) {
10269  SSL_shutdown(ssl);
10270  {
10271  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
10272  SSL_free(ssl);
10273  }
10274  set_nonblocking(sock, false);
10275  return nullptr;
10276  }
10277  BIO_set_nbio(bio, 0);
10278  set_nonblocking(sock, false);
10279  }
10280 
10281  return ssl;
10282 }
10283 
10284 inline void ssl_delete(std::mutex &ctx_mutex, SSL *ssl, socket_t sock,
10285  bool shutdown_gracefully) {
10286  // sometimes we may want to skip this to try to avoid SIGPIPE if we know
10287  // the remote has closed the network connection
10288  // Note that it is not always possible to avoid SIGPIPE, this is merely a
10289  // best-efforts.
10290  if (shutdown_gracefully) {
10291  (void)(sock);
10292  // SSL_shutdown() returns 0 on first call (indicating close_notify alert
10293  // sent) and 1 on subsequent call (indicating close_notify alert received)
10294  if (SSL_shutdown(ssl) == 0) {
10295  // Expected to return 1, but even if it doesn't, we free ssl
10296  SSL_shutdown(ssl);
10297  }
10298  }
10299 
10300  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex);
10301  SSL_free(ssl);
10302 }
10303 
10304 template <typename U>
10305 bool ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(socket_t sock, SSL *ssl,
10306  U ssl_connect_or_accept,
10307  time_t timeout_sec, time_t timeout_usec,
10308  int *ssl_error) {
10309  auto res = 0;
10310  while ((res = ssl_connect_or_accept(ssl)) != 1) {
10311  auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl, res);
10312  switch (err) {
10313  case SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ:
10314  if (select_read(sock, timeout_sec, timeout_usec) > 0) { continue; }
10315  break;
10316  case SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE:
10317  if (select_write(sock, timeout_sec, timeout_usec) > 0) { continue; }
10318  break;
10319  default: break;
10320  }
10321  if (ssl_error) { *ssl_error = err; }
10322  return false;
10323  }
10324  return true;
10325 }
10326 
10327 template <typename T>
10328 inline bool process_server_socket_ssl(
10329  const std::atomic<socket_t> &svr_sock, SSL *ssl, socket_t sock,
10330  size_t keep_alive_max_count, time_t keep_alive_timeout_sec,
10331  time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec, time_t write_timeout_sec,
10332  time_t write_timeout_usec, T callback) {
10333  return process_server_socket_core(
10334  svr_sock, sock, keep_alive_max_count, keep_alive_timeout_sec,
10335  [&](bool close_connection, bool &connection_closed) {
10336  SSLSocketStream strm(sock, ssl, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
10337  write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec);
10338  return callback(strm, close_connection, connection_closed);
10339  });
10340 }
10341 
10342 template <typename T>
10343 inline bool process_client_socket_ssl(
10344  SSL *ssl, socket_t sock, time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec,
10345  time_t write_timeout_sec, time_t write_timeout_usec,
10346  time_t max_timeout_msec,
10347  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time, T callback) {
10348  SSLSocketStream strm(sock, ssl, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec,
10349  write_timeout_sec, write_timeout_usec, max_timeout_msec,
10350  start_time);
10351  return callback(strm);
10352 }
10353 
10354 // SSL socket stream implementation
10355 inline SSLSocketStream::SSLSocketStream(
10356  socket_t sock, SSL *ssl, time_t read_timeout_sec, time_t read_timeout_usec,
10357  time_t write_timeout_sec, time_t write_timeout_usec,
10358  time_t max_timeout_msec,
10359  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time)
10360  : sock_(sock), ssl_(ssl), read_timeout_sec_(read_timeout_sec),
10361  read_timeout_usec_(read_timeout_usec),
10362  write_timeout_sec_(write_timeout_sec),
10363  write_timeout_usec_(write_timeout_usec),
10364  max_timeout_msec_(max_timeout_msec), start_time_(start_time) {
10365  SSL_clear_mode(ssl, SSL_MODE_AUTO_RETRY);
10366 }
10367 
10368 inline SSLSocketStream::~SSLSocketStream() = default;
10369 
10370 inline bool SSLSocketStream::is_readable() const {
10371  return SSL_pending(ssl_) > 0;
10372 }
10373 
10374 inline bool SSLSocketStream::wait_readable() const {
10375  if (max_timeout_msec_ <= 0) {
10376  return select_read(sock_, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_) > 0;
10377  }
10378 
10379  time_t read_timeout_sec;
10380  time_t read_timeout_usec;
10381  calc_actual_timeout(max_timeout_msec_, duration(), read_timeout_sec_,
10382  read_timeout_usec_, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec);
10383 
10384  return select_read(sock_, read_timeout_sec, read_timeout_usec) > 0;
10385 }
10386 
10387 inline bool SSLSocketStream::wait_writable() const {
10388  return select_write(sock_, write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_) > 0 &&
10389  is_socket_alive(sock_) && !is_ssl_peer_could_be_closed(ssl_, sock_);
10390 }
10391 
10392 inline ssize_t SSLSocketStream::read(char *ptr, size_t size) {
10393  if (SSL_pending(ssl_) > 0) {
10394  return SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
10395  } else if (wait_readable()) {
10396  auto ret = SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
10397  if (ret < 0) {
10398  auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
10399  auto n = 1000;
10400 #ifdef _WIN64
10401  while (--n >= 0 && (err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ ||
10402  (err == SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL &&
10403  WSAGetLastError() == WSAETIMEDOUT))) {
10404 #else
10405  while (--n >= 0 && err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ) {
10406 #endif
10407  if (SSL_pending(ssl_) > 0) {
10408  return SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
10409  } else if (wait_readable()) {
10410  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::microseconds{10});
10411  ret = SSL_read(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(size));
10412  if (ret >= 0) { return ret; }
10413  err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
10414  } else {
10415  break;
10416  }
10417  }
10418  assert(ret < 0);
10419  }
10420  return ret;
10421  } else {
10422  return -1;
10423  }
10424 }
10425 
10426 inline ssize_t SSLSocketStream::write(const char *ptr, size_t size) {
10427  if (wait_writable()) {
10428  auto handle_size = static_cast<int>(
10429  std::min<size_t>(size, (std::numeric_limits<int>::max)()));
10430 
10431  auto ret = SSL_write(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(handle_size));
10432  if (ret < 0) {
10433  auto err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
10434  auto n = 1000;
10435 #ifdef _WIN64
10436  while (--n >= 0 && (err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE ||
10437  (err == SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL &&
10438  WSAGetLastError() == WSAETIMEDOUT))) {
10439 #else
10440  while (--n >= 0 && err == SSL_ERROR_WANT_WRITE) {
10441 #endif
10442  if (wait_writable()) {
10443  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::microseconds{10});
10444  ret = SSL_write(ssl_, ptr, static_cast<int>(handle_size));
10445  if (ret >= 0) { return ret; }
10446  err = SSL_get_error(ssl_, ret);
10447  } else {
10448  break;
10449  }
10450  }
10451  assert(ret < 0);
10452  }
10453  return ret;
10454  }
10455  return -1;
10456 }
10457 
10458 inline void SSLSocketStream::get_remote_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
10459  int &port) const {
10460  detail::get_remote_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
10461 }
10462 
10463 inline void SSLSocketStream::get_local_ip_and_port(std::string &ip,
10464  int &port) const {
10465  detail::get_local_ip_and_port(sock_, ip, port);
10466 }
10467 
10468 inline socket_t SSLSocketStream::socket() const { return sock_; }
10469 
10470 inline time_t SSLSocketStream::duration() const {
10471  return std::chrono::duration_cast<std::chrono::milliseconds>(
10472  std::chrono::steady_clock::now() - start_time_)
10473  .count();
10474 }
10475 
10476 } // namespace detail
10477 
10478 // SSL HTTP server implementation
10479 inline SSLServer::SSLServer(const char *cert_path, const char *private_key_path,
10480  const char *client_ca_cert_file_path,
10481  const char *client_ca_cert_dir_path,
10482  const char *private_key_password) {
10483  ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_server_method());
10484 
10485  if (ctx_) {
10486  SSL_CTX_set_options(ctx_,
10487  SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION |
10488  SSL_OP_NO_SESSION_RESUMPTION_ON_RENEGOTIATION);
10489 
10490  SSL_CTX_set_min_proto_version(ctx_, TLS1_2_VERSION);
10491 
10492  if (private_key_password != nullptr && (private_key_password[0] != '\0')) {
10493  SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
10494  ctx_,
10495  reinterpret_cast<void *>(const_cast<char *>(private_key_password)));
10496  }
10497 
10498  if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate_chain_file(ctx_, cert_path) != 1 ||
10499  SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx_, private_key_path, SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) !=
10500  1 ||
10501  SSL_CTX_check_private_key(ctx_) != 1) {
10502  last_ssl_error_ = static_cast<int>(ERR_get_error());
10503  SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
10504  ctx_ = nullptr;
10505  } else if (client_ca_cert_file_path || client_ca_cert_dir_path) {
10506  SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, client_ca_cert_file_path,
10507  client_ca_cert_dir_path);
10508 
10509  SSL_CTX_set_verify(
10510  ctx_, SSL_VERIFY_PEER | SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, nullptr);
10511  }
10512  }
10513 }
10514 
10515 inline SSLServer::SSLServer(X509 *cert, EVP_PKEY *private_key,
10516  X509_STORE *client_ca_cert_store) {
10517  ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_server_method());
10518 
10519  if (ctx_) {
10520  SSL_CTX_set_options(ctx_,
10521  SSL_OP_NO_COMPRESSION |
10522  SSL_OP_NO_SESSION_RESUMPTION_ON_RENEGOTIATION);
10523 
10524  SSL_CTX_set_min_proto_version(ctx_, TLS1_2_VERSION);
10525 
10526  if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, cert) != 1 ||
10527  SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, private_key) != 1) {
10528  SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
10529  ctx_ = nullptr;
10530  } else if (client_ca_cert_store) {
10531  SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, client_ca_cert_store);
10532 
10533  SSL_CTX_set_verify(
10534  ctx_, SSL_VERIFY_PEER | SSL_VERIFY_FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, nullptr);
10535  }
10536  }
10537 }
10538 
10539 inline SSLServer::SSLServer(
10540  const std::function<bool(SSL_CTX &ssl_ctx)> &setup_ssl_ctx_callback) {
10541  ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_method());
10542  if (ctx_) {
10543  if (!setup_ssl_ctx_callback(*ctx_)) {
10544  SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
10545  ctx_ = nullptr;
10546  }
10547  }
10548 }
10549 
10550 inline SSLServer::~SSLServer() {
10551  if (ctx_) { SSL_CTX_free(ctx_); }
10552 }
10553 
10554 inline bool SSLServer::is_valid() const { return ctx_; }
10555 
10556 inline SSL_CTX *SSLServer::ssl_context() const { return ctx_; }
10557 
10558 inline void SSLServer::update_certs(X509 *cert, EVP_PKEY *private_key,
10559  X509_STORE *client_ca_cert_store) {
10560 
10561  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex_);
10562 
10563  SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, cert);
10564  SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, private_key);
10565 
10566  if (client_ca_cert_store != nullptr) {
10567  SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, client_ca_cert_store);
10568  }
10569 }
10570 
10571 inline bool SSLServer::process_and_close_socket(socket_t sock) {
10572  auto ssl = detail::ssl_new(
10573  sock, ctx_, ctx_mutex_,
10574  [&](SSL *ssl2) {
10575  return detail::ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(
10576  sock, ssl2, SSL_accept, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
10577  &last_ssl_error_);
10578  },
10579  [](SSL * /*ssl2*/) { return true; });
10580 
10581  auto ret = false;
10582  if (ssl) {
10583  std::string remote_addr;
10584  int remote_port = 0;
10585  detail::get_remote_ip_and_port(sock, remote_addr, remote_port);
10586 
10587  std::string local_addr;
10588  int local_port = 0;
10589  detail::get_local_ip_and_port(sock, local_addr, local_port);
10590 
10591  ret = detail::process_server_socket_ssl(
10592  svr_sock_, ssl, sock, keep_alive_max_count_, keep_alive_timeout_sec_,
10593  read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_, write_timeout_sec_,
10594  write_timeout_usec_,
10595  [&](Stream &strm, bool close_connection, bool &connection_closed) {
10596  return process_request(strm, remote_addr, remote_port, local_addr,
10597  local_port, close_connection,
10598  connection_closed,
10599  [&](Request &req) { req.ssl = ssl; });
10600  });
10601 
10602  // Shutdown gracefully if the result seemed successful, non-gracefully if
10603  // the connection appeared to be closed.
10604  const bool shutdown_gracefully = ret;
10605  detail::ssl_delete(ctx_mutex_, ssl, sock, shutdown_gracefully);
10606  }
10607 
10608  detail::shutdown_socket(sock);
10609  detail::close_socket(sock);
10610  return ret;
10611 }
10612 
10613 // SSL HTTP client implementation
10614 inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host)
10615  : SSLClient(host, 443, std::string(), std::string()) {}
10616 
10617 inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port)
10618  : SSLClient(host, port, std::string(), std::string()) {}
10619 
10620 inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port,
10621  const std::string &client_cert_path,
10622  const std::string &client_key_path,
10623  const std::string &private_key_password)
10624  : ClientImpl(host, port, client_cert_path, client_key_path) {
10625  ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_client_method());
10626 
10627  SSL_CTX_set_min_proto_version(ctx_, TLS1_2_VERSION);
10628 
10629  detail::split(&host_[0], &host_[host_.size()], '.',
10630  [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
10631  host_components_.emplace_back(b, e);
10632  });
10633 
10634  if (!client_cert_path.empty() && !client_key_path.empty()) {
10635  if (!private_key_password.empty()) {
10636  SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
10637  ctx_, reinterpret_cast<void *>(
10638  const_cast<char *>(private_key_password.c_str())));
10639  }
10640 
10641  if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate_file(ctx_, client_cert_path.c_str(),
10642  SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) != 1 ||
10643  SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey_file(ctx_, client_key_path.c_str(),
10644  SSL_FILETYPE_PEM) != 1) {
10645  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10646  SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
10647  ctx_ = nullptr;
10648  }
10649  }
10650 }
10651 
10652 inline SSLClient::SSLClient(const std::string &host, int port,
10653  X509 *client_cert, EVP_PKEY *client_key,
10654  const std::string &private_key_password)
10655  : ClientImpl(host, port) {
10656  ctx_ = SSL_CTX_new(TLS_client_method());
10657 
10658  detail::split(&host_[0], &host_[host_.size()], '.',
10659  [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
10660  host_components_.emplace_back(b, e);
10661  });
10662 
10663  if (client_cert != nullptr && client_key != nullptr) {
10664  if (!private_key_password.empty()) {
10665  SSL_CTX_set_default_passwd_cb_userdata(
10666  ctx_, reinterpret_cast<void *>(
10667  const_cast<char *>(private_key_password.c_str())));
10668  }
10669 
10670  if (SSL_CTX_use_certificate(ctx_, client_cert) != 1 ||
10671  SSL_CTX_use_PrivateKey(ctx_, client_key) != 1) {
10672  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10673  SSL_CTX_free(ctx_);
10674  ctx_ = nullptr;
10675  }
10676  }
10677 }
10678 
10679 inline SSLClient::~SSLClient() {
10680  if (ctx_) { SSL_CTX_free(ctx_); }
10681  // Make sure to shut down SSL since shutdown_ssl will resolve to the
10682  // base function rather than the derived function once we get to the
10683  // base class destructor, and won't free the SSL (causing a leak).
10684  shutdown_ssl_impl(socket_, true);
10685 }
10686 
10687 inline bool SSLClient::is_valid() const { return ctx_; }
10688 
10689 inline void SSLClient::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
10690  if (ca_cert_store) {
10691  if (ctx_) {
10692  if (SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_) != ca_cert_store) {
10693  // Free memory allocated for old cert and use new store `ca_cert_store`
10694  SSL_CTX_set_cert_store(ctx_, ca_cert_store);
10695  }
10696  } else {
10697  X509_STORE_free(ca_cert_store);
10698  }
10699  }
10700 }
10701 
10702 inline void SSLClient::load_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert,
10703  std::size_t size) {
10704  set_ca_cert_store(ClientImpl::create_ca_cert_store(ca_cert, size));
10705 }
10706 
10707 inline long SSLClient::get_openssl_verify_result() const {
10708  return verify_result_;
10709 }
10710 
10711 inline SSL_CTX *SSLClient::ssl_context() const { return ctx_; }
10712 
10713 inline bool SSLClient::create_and_connect_socket(Socket &socket, Error &error) {
10714  return is_valid() && ClientImpl::create_and_connect_socket(socket, error);
10715 }
10716 
10717 // Assumes that socket_mutex_ is locked and that there are no requests in flight
10718 inline bool SSLClient::connect_with_proxy(
10719  Socket &socket,
10720  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time,
10721  Response &res, bool &success, Error &error) {
10722  success = true;
10723  Response proxy_res;
10724  if (!detail::process_client_socket(
10725  socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
10726  write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, max_timeout_msec_,
10727  start_time, [&](Stream &strm) {
10728  Request req2;
10729  req2.method = "CONNECT";
10730  req2.path = host_and_port_;
10731  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
10732  req2.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
10733  }
10734  return process_request(strm, req2, proxy_res, false, error);
10735  })) {
10736  // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are no
10737  // requests in flight
10738  shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
10739  shutdown_socket(socket);
10740  close_socket(socket);
10741  success = false;
10742  return false;
10743  }
10744 
10745  if (proxy_res.status == StatusCode::ProxyAuthenticationRequired_407) {
10746  if (!proxy_digest_auth_username_.empty() &&
10747  !proxy_digest_auth_password_.empty()) {
10748  std::map<std::string, std::string> auth;
10749  if (detail::parse_www_authenticate(proxy_res, auth, true)) {
10750  // Close the current socket and create a new one for the authenticated
10751  // request
10752  shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
10753  shutdown_socket(socket);
10754  close_socket(socket);
10755 
10756  // Create a new socket for the authenticated CONNECT request
10757  if (!create_and_connect_socket(socket, error)) {
10758  success = false;
10759  return false;
10760  }
10761 
10762  proxy_res = Response();
10763  if (!detail::process_client_socket(
10764  socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
10765  write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, max_timeout_msec_,
10766  start_time, [&](Stream &strm) {
10767  Request req3;
10768  req3.method = "CONNECT";
10769  req3.path = host_and_port_;
10770  req3.headers.insert(detail::make_digest_authentication_header(
10771  req3, auth, 1, detail::random_string(10),
10772  proxy_digest_auth_username_, proxy_digest_auth_password_,
10773  true));
10774  if (max_timeout_msec_ > 0) {
10775  req3.start_time_ = std::chrono::steady_clock::now();
10776  }
10777  return process_request(strm, req3, proxy_res, false, error);
10778  })) {
10779  // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are
10780  // no requests in flight
10781  shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
10782  shutdown_socket(socket);
10783  close_socket(socket);
10784  success = false;
10785  return false;
10786  }
10787  }
10788  }
10789  }
10790 
10791  // If status code is not 200, proxy request is failed.
10792  // Set error to ProxyConnection and return proxy response
10793  // as the response of the request
10794  if (proxy_res.status != StatusCode::OK_200) {
10795  error = Error::ProxyConnection;
10796  res = std::move(proxy_res);
10797  // Thread-safe to close everything because we are assuming there are
10798  // no requests in flight
10799  shutdown_ssl(socket, true);
10800  shutdown_socket(socket);
10801  close_socket(socket);
10802  return false;
10803  }
10804 
10805  return true;
10806 }
10807 
10808 inline bool SSLClient::load_certs() {
10809  auto ret = true;
10810 
10811  std::call_once(initialize_cert_, [&]() {
10812  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> guard(ctx_mutex_);
10813  if (!ca_cert_file_path_.empty()) {
10814  if (!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, ca_cert_file_path_.c_str(),
10815  nullptr)) {
10816  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10817  ret = false;
10818  }
10819  } else if (!ca_cert_dir_path_.empty()) {
10820  if (!SSL_CTX_load_verify_locations(ctx_, nullptr,
10821  ca_cert_dir_path_.c_str())) {
10822  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10823  ret = false;
10824  }
10825  } else {
10826  auto loaded = false;
10827 #ifdef _WIN64
10828  loaded =
10829  detail::load_system_certs_on_windows(SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_));
10830 #elif defined(CPPHTTPLIB_USE_CERTS_FROM_MACOSX_KEYCHAIN) && \
10831  defined(TARGET_OS_OSX)
10832  loaded = detail::load_system_certs_on_macos(SSL_CTX_get_cert_store(ctx_));
10833 #endif // _WIN64
10834  if (!loaded) { SSL_CTX_set_default_verify_paths(ctx_); }
10835  }
10836  });
10837 
10838  return ret;
10839 }
10840 
10841 inline bool SSLClient::initialize_ssl(Socket &socket, Error &error) {
10842  auto ssl = detail::ssl_new(
10843  socket.sock, ctx_, ctx_mutex_,
10844  [&](SSL *ssl2) {
10845  if (server_certificate_verification_) {
10846  if (!load_certs()) {
10847  error = Error::SSLLoadingCerts;
10848  return false;
10849  }
10850  SSL_set_verify(ssl2, SSL_VERIFY_NONE, nullptr);
10851  }
10852 
10853  if (!detail::ssl_connect_or_accept_nonblocking(
10854  socket.sock, ssl2, SSL_connect, connection_timeout_sec_,
10855  connection_timeout_usec_, &last_ssl_error_)) {
10856  error = Error::SSLConnection;
10857  return false;
10858  }
10859 
10860  if (server_certificate_verification_) {
10861  auto verification_status = SSLVerifierResponse::NoDecisionMade;
10862 
10863  if (server_certificate_verifier_) {
10864  verification_status = server_certificate_verifier_(ssl2);
10865  }
10866 
10867  if (verification_status == SSLVerifierResponse::CertificateRejected) {
10868  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10869  error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
10870  return false;
10871  }
10872 
10873  if (verification_status == SSLVerifierResponse::NoDecisionMade) {
10874  verify_result_ = SSL_get_verify_result(ssl2);
10875 
10876  if (verify_result_ != X509_V_OK) {
10877  last_openssl_error_ = static_cast<unsigned long>(verify_result_);
10878  error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
10879  return false;
10880  }
10881 
10882  auto server_cert = SSL_get1_peer_certificate(ssl2);
10883  auto se = detail::scope_exit([&] { X509_free(server_cert); });
10884 
10885  if (server_cert == nullptr) {
10886  last_openssl_error_ = ERR_get_error();
10887  error = Error::SSLServerVerification;
10888  return false;
10889  }
10890 
10891  if (server_hostname_verification_) {
10892  if (!verify_host(server_cert)) {
10893  last_openssl_error_ = X509_V_ERR_HOSTNAME_MISMATCH;
10894  error = Error::SSLServerHostnameVerification;
10895  return false;
10896  }
10897  }
10898  }
10899  }
10900 
10901  return true;
10902  },
10903  [&](SSL *ssl2) {
10904 #if defined(OPENSSL_IS_BORINGSSL)
10905  SSL_set_tlsext_host_name(ssl2, host_.c_str());
10906 #else
10907  // NOTE: Direct call instead of using the OpenSSL macro to suppress
10908  // -Wold-style-cast warning
10909  SSL_ctrl(ssl2, SSL_CTRL_SET_TLSEXT_HOSTNAME, TLSEXT_NAMETYPE_host_name,
10910  static_cast<void *>(const_cast<char *>(host_.c_str())));
10911 #endif
10912  return true;
10913  });
10914 
10915  if (ssl) {
10916  socket.ssl = ssl;
10917  return true;
10918  }
10919 
10920  shutdown_socket(socket);
10921  close_socket(socket);
10922  return false;
10923 }
10924 
10925 inline void SSLClient::shutdown_ssl(Socket &socket, bool shutdown_gracefully) {
10926  shutdown_ssl_impl(socket, shutdown_gracefully);
10927 }
10928 
10929 inline void SSLClient::shutdown_ssl_impl(Socket &socket,
10930  bool shutdown_gracefully) {
10931  if (socket.sock == INVALID_SOCKET) {
10932  assert(socket.ssl == nullptr);
10933  return;
10934  }
10935  if (socket.ssl) {
10936  detail::ssl_delete(ctx_mutex_, socket.ssl, socket.sock,
10937  shutdown_gracefully);
10938  socket.ssl = nullptr;
10939  }
10940  assert(socket.ssl == nullptr);
10941 }
10942 
10943 inline bool SSLClient::process_socket(
10944  const Socket &socket,
10945  std::chrono::time_point<std::chrono::steady_clock> start_time,
10946  std::function<bool(Stream &strm)> callback) {
10947  assert(socket.ssl);
10948  return detail::process_client_socket_ssl(
10949  socket.ssl, socket.sock, read_timeout_sec_, read_timeout_usec_,
10950  write_timeout_sec_, write_timeout_usec_, max_timeout_msec_, start_time,
10951  std::move(callback));
10952 }
10953 
10954 inline bool SSLClient::is_ssl() const { return true; }
10955 
10956 inline bool SSLClient::verify_host(X509 *server_cert) const {
10957  /* Quote from RFC2818 section 3.1 "Server Identity"
10958 
10959  If a subjectAltName extension of type dNSName is present, that MUST
10960  be used as the identity. Otherwise, the (most specific) Common Name
10961  field in the Subject field of the certificate MUST be used. Although
10962  the use of the Common Name is existing practice, it is deprecated and
10963  Certification Authorities are encouraged to use the dNSName instead.
10964 
10965  Matching is performed using the matching rules specified by
10966  [RFC2459]. If more than one identity of a given type is present in
10967  the certificate (e.g., more than one dNSName name, a match in any one
10968  of the set is considered acceptable.) Names may contain the wildcard
10969  character * which is considered to match any single domain name
10970  component or component fragment. E.g., *.a.com matches foo.a.com but
10971  not bar.foo.a.com. f*.com matches foo.com but not bar.com.
10972 
10973  In some cases, the URI is specified as an IP address rather than a
10974  hostname. In this case, the iPAddress subjectAltName must be present
10975  in the certificate and must exactly match the IP in the URI.
10976 
10977  */
10978  return verify_host_with_subject_alt_name(server_cert) ||
10979  verify_host_with_common_name(server_cert);
10980 }
10981 
10982 inline bool
10983 SSLClient::verify_host_with_subject_alt_name(X509 *server_cert) const {
10984  auto ret = false;
10985 
10986  auto type = GEN_DNS;
10987 
10988  struct in6_addr addr6 = {};
10989  struct in_addr addr = {};
10990  size_t addr_len = 0;
10991 
10992 #ifndef __MINGW32__
10993  if (inet_pton(AF_INET6, host_.c_str(), &addr6)) {
10994  type = GEN_IPADD;
10995  addr_len = sizeof(struct in6_addr);
10996  } else if (inet_pton(AF_INET, host_.c_str(), &addr)) {
10997  type = GEN_IPADD;
10998  addr_len = sizeof(struct in_addr);
10999  }
11000 #endif
11001 
11002  auto alt_names = static_cast<const struct stack_st_GENERAL_NAME *>(
11003  X509_get_ext_d2i(server_cert, NID_subject_alt_name, nullptr, nullptr));
11004 
11005  if (alt_names) {
11006  auto dsn_matched = false;
11007  auto ip_matched = false;
11008 
11009  auto count = sk_GENERAL_NAME_num(alt_names);
11010 
11011  for (decltype(count) i = 0; i < count && !dsn_matched; i++) {
11012  auto val = sk_GENERAL_NAME_value(alt_names, i);
11013  if (val->type == type) {
11014  auto name =
11015  reinterpret_cast<const char *>(ASN1_STRING_get0_data(val->d.ia5));
11016  auto name_len = static_cast<size_t>(ASN1_STRING_length(val->d.ia5));
11017 
11018  switch (type) {
11019  case GEN_DNS: dsn_matched = check_host_name(name, name_len); break;
11020 
11021  case GEN_IPADD:
11022  if (!memcmp(&addr6, name, addr_len) ||
11023  !memcmp(&addr, name, addr_len)) {
11024  ip_matched = true;
11025  }
11026  break;
11027  }
11028  }
11029  }
11030 
11031  if (dsn_matched || ip_matched) { ret = true; }
11032  }
11033 
11034  GENERAL_NAMES_free(const_cast<STACK_OF(GENERAL_NAME) *>(
11035  reinterpret_cast<const STACK_OF(GENERAL_NAME) *>(alt_names)));
11036  return ret;
11037 }
11038 
11039 inline bool SSLClient::verify_host_with_common_name(X509 *server_cert) const {
11040  const auto subject_name = X509_get_subject_name(server_cert);
11041 
11042  if (subject_name != nullptr) {
11043  char name[BUFSIZ];
11044  auto name_len = X509_NAME_get_text_by_NID(subject_name, NID_commonName,
11045  name, sizeof(name));
11046 
11047  if (name_len != -1) {
11048  return check_host_name(name, static_cast<size_t>(name_len));
11049  }
11050  }
11051 
11052  return false;
11053 }
11054 
11055 inline bool SSLClient::check_host_name(const char *pattern,
11056  size_t pattern_len) const {
11057  if (host_.size() == pattern_len && host_ == pattern) { return true; }
11058 
11059  // Wildcard match
11060  // https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/firefox-3.0/+bug/376484
11061  std::vector<std::string> pattern_components;
11062  detail::split(&pattern[0], &pattern[pattern_len], '.',
11063  [&](const char *b, const char *e) {
11064  pattern_components.emplace_back(b, e);
11065  });
11066 
11067  if (host_components_.size() != pattern_components.size()) { return false; }
11068 
11069  auto itr = pattern_components.begin();
11070  for (const auto &h : host_components_) {
11071  auto &p = *itr;
11072  if (p != h && p != "*") {
11073  auto partial_match = (p.size() > 0 && p[p.size() - 1] == '*' &&
11074  !p.compare(0, p.size() - 1, h));
11075  if (!partial_match) { return false; }
11076  }
11077  ++itr;
11078  }
11079 
11080  return true;
11081 }
11082 #endif
11083 
11084 // Universal client implementation
11085 inline Client::Client(const std::string &scheme_host_port)
11086  : Client(scheme_host_port, std::string(), std::string()) {}
11087 
11088 inline Client::Client(const std::string &scheme_host_port,
11089  const std::string &client_cert_path,
11090  const std::string &client_key_path) {
11091  const static std::regex re(
11092  R"((?:([a-z]+):\/\/)?(?:\[([a-fA-F\d:]+)\]|([^:/?#]+))(?::(\d+))?)");
11093 
11094  std::smatch m;
11095  if (std::regex_match(scheme_host_port, m, re)) {
11096  auto scheme = m[1].str();
11097 
11098 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
11099  if (!scheme.empty() && (scheme != "http" && scheme != "https")) {
11100 #else
11101  if (!scheme.empty() && scheme != "http") {
11102 #endif
11103 #ifndef CPPHTTPLIB_NO_EXCEPTIONS
11104  std::string msg = "'" + scheme + "' scheme is not supported.";
11105  throw std::invalid_argument(msg);
11106 #endif
11107  return;
11108  }
11109 
11110  auto is_ssl = scheme == "https";
11111 
11112  auto host = m[2].str();
11113  if (host.empty()) { host = m[3].str(); }
11114 
11115  auto port_str = m[4].str();
11116  auto port = !port_str.empty() ? std::stoi(port_str) : (is_ssl ? 443 : 80);
11117 
11118  if (is_ssl) {
11119 #ifdef CPPHTTPLIB_OPENSSL_SUPPORT
11120  cli_ = detail::make_unique<SSLClient>(host, port, client_cert_path,
11121  client_key_path);
11122  is_ssl_ = is_ssl;
11123 #endif
11124  } else {
11125  cli_ = detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port, client_cert_path,
11126  client_key_path);
11127  }
11128  } else {
11129  // NOTE: Update TEST(UniversalClientImplTest, Ipv6LiteralAddress)
11130  // if port param below changes.
11131  cli_ = detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(scheme_host_port, 80,
11132  client_cert_path, client_key_path);
11133  }
11134 } // namespace detail
11135 
11136 inline Client::Client(const std::string &host, int port)
11137  : cli_(detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port)) {}
11138 
11139 inline Client::Client(const std::string &host, int port,
11140  const std::string &client_cert_path,
11141  const std::string &client_key_path)
11142  : cli_(detail::make_unique<ClientImpl>(host, port, client_cert_path,
11143  client_key_path)) {}
11144 
11145 inline Client::~Client() = default;
11146 
11147 inline bool Client::is_valid() const {
11148  return cli_ != nullptr && cli_->is_valid();
11149 }
11150

11152  return cli_->Get(path, std::move(progress));
11153 }

11155  DownloadProgress progress) {

11160  DownloadProgress progress) {

11167  std::move(progress));

11358  return cli_->Put(path, params);
11359 }
11360 inline Result Client::Put(const std::string &path, const Headers &headers,
11361  const Params &params) {
11362  return cli_->Put(path, headers, params);
11363 }
11364 inline Result Client::Put(const std::string &path,

11667 inline void Client::set_ca_cert_store(X509_STORE *ca_cert_store) {
11668  if (is_ssl_) {
11669  static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).set_ca_cert_store(ca_cert_store);
11670  } else {
11671  cli_->set_ca_cert_store(ca_cert_store);
11672  }
11673 }
11674 
11675 inline void Client::load_ca_cert_store(const char *ca_cert, std::size_t size) {
11676  set_ca_cert_store(cli_->create_ca_cert_store(ca_cert, size));
11677 }
11678 
11679 inline long Client::get_openssl_verify_result() const {
11680  if (is_ssl_) {
11681  return static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).get_openssl_verify_result();
11682  }
11683  return -1; // NOTE: -1 doesn't match any of X509_V_ERR_???
11684 }
11685 
11686 inline SSL_CTX *Client::ssl_context() const {
11687  if (is_ssl_) { return static_cast<SSLClient &>(*cli_).ssl_context(); }
11688  return nullptr;
11689 }
11690 #endif
